Tap at Brooklyn Beet Co. in Bay Ridge. Pours a clear orange gold with small head. Aroma is earthy and grassy hops and crackery malts, with an unusually fruity profile too: something like roasted apple and honey. Obviously fresh; I imagine this beer is often consumed past its prime from bottles. Taste is crisp, mildly sweet grain with earthy and spicy finish, lightly herbal. Very pleasant.

0.5 bottle beer, no foam, clear golden color. If I wanted to show someone how pilsner taste like i would give then Budweiser. You taste the hops but there is no bitterness. Very pleasant beer to drink.

Review based on the BJCP2008 (style 2B - Bohemian pilsner). Bottle 33 cl - Batch unknown. AROMA: mild sweet and grainy aroma with some DMS. no floral hop aromas. APPEARANCE: gold color and translucent. thin creamy white head with average retention. TASTE: mild sweet grainy flavour. medium-low bitterness with a medium-dry finish. PALATE: medium-thin body with medium carbonation. OVERALL: a bland bohemian pilsner. where are the Saaz hops? NOTE: the label says "Czech Imported Lager" wich we are inclined to believe this is a special batch without the hops. We have in memory that this beer is more hop intensive than this drinked example.

Canned 4 pack ; Do not drink this from a clear green bottle ,it rapes this beer . From a can or draught it is a nice elegant Pils. bready ,herbal, hoppy nose. but no skunk thankfully . Bright golden beer ,  with a decent two finger head .  pils malt is tangy , bready , chewy ,cookie like. long bitter dryness . Easy to sink aromatic kinda Pils.
La migliore pils ceca molto probabilmente. Di facile bevuta risulta essere molto leggera e piacevole
Pale gold, clear, white head. Light cereals and simple malts with gentle hoppy freshness. Cereals and hint of yeast, light bitter ending and aftertaste. Refreshing.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A clear golden yellow beer ; many small bubbles ; medium white head ; medium retention. Herbal aroma, hay, light caramel. Medium dry bitter refreshing, light sweet. Light to medium body, thin texture, good carbonation, herbal bitter finish. Overall, nice herbal aroma, pleasant bitterness ; refreshing.

Thinking my review of pilsner urquell is now over rated after drinking this very good LAGER, yes lager and lager this good is good. I love lager and this is a great lager whatever beer snobs think. Great sweetness and delicate hops shine through unlike the bottle of meaty savoury Urquell and the dryness of Staropramen. 500ml bottle, golden, floral, sweet and after taste of slight bitterness. Lovely fizzy carbonated, refreshing lager lovlieness and what’s wrong with that? Its not anywhere near the best beer in the world, it’s no Goose Island IPA but for time and a place comeback and drink me lager this is yer beer.

Bottle. Clear golden color with small & fast-disappearing head. Very delicate and pleasant aroma of grass and citrus notes, flowers (true Saaz hops). Taste is bitter-sweet, very well balanced. Aftertaste is thin and delicate. Nice example of lager.

Bottle. One of the best quality Czech lagers. Complex bitter-sweet, leaving subtle hoppy palate. Medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Klar, gul, och vitt skum. Doft: Röda äpplen, jäst, malt, hembakat bröd, frukt, lätt kanderat socker. Smak: Malt, röda äpplen, jäst, billig utspädd frukt juice, lager. Smakar bättre än den luktar. Lätt drucken, skulle nog passa bra till farmors mat om hon fortfarande skulle laga mat.

500ml can served in an ordinary glass.
A: Pours a clear yellow to orange (golden) color forming a one to two fingers bubbled and aired white head. Medium retention and few lacings formed and left in the glass
S: Refreshing in the nose. Strong notes of Saaz hops which is grassy and citrus. Notes of sweet grains
T: Refreshing in the mouth too. Grainy upfront. Pale malts and caramel malts. Strong notes of Saaz hops. Again, grassy and citrus. In overall, a dry taste with a nice hops bitterness punch
M: Light body and good carbonation. Grassy and lemony aftertaste
O: Very good drinkability. Not as good as Urquell, but still a classic Czech Pilsener
[ BA Review @ 2/19/2010 ]
330ml bottle pours pale gold with a brief head, aroma is light malty fruity, taste is crisp fresh grassy dry sweetish not too bitter or hoppy, a fine brew

Pours clear straw with a short, short-lived white head, minimal lacing (3/5). Nose is pale malt and grassy hops (6/10). Taste is mild to moderate sweet followed by mild bitter (7/10). Light crisp body, prickly carbonation dropping to moderate, with a dry bitter finish (3/5).

As lagers go, not bad at all. The Czech pilsner is light, crisp, and dry, with none of the rice or corn adjunct flavours that make North American lagers so utterly vile. You can see the family resemblance, sure - but this is the successful cousin, not the unemployable layabout in the wife beater. I could see drinking a very large number of these under a tent somewhere, preferably with live music and large chunks of some mammal or other being singed over open flame. Needs to be drunk cold and quick - it does not improve with warming, or if one lets the carbonation drop. (12/20)

0.5l bottle from Tesco Filakovo (Slovakia). Medium white head with neutral sourish aroma, maybe some bread. Minimal sour taste. Quickly vanishing. The beer itself is a balance of moderate bitterness and maltiness. Everything is very moderate in this beer, almost tasteless, I would say. Palate is moderate, too. I usually like that, but this time it is not convincing. Aftertaste is neutral. Neutral watery core lager taste. Maybe maltiness is a bit more present. In he end, some honey shows up. Strange, because this is a very neutral beer, very moderate taste, on the brink of becoming boring, but sort of well composed and balanced. No mistakes but not much soul either. Still kind of acceptable.
Very fresh and light pilsner, not bitter not too sweet. With medium body it is my favorite pilsner.

Pours clear pilsner yellow with high white head
Aromas has lager yeast, hints of corn, bread, wheat
Taste nice fresh clean. Hints of sweet fruits, corn syrup. Wee bit watery but miles better than the american version

---- personal review, no claim to be representative or neutral ---- repost undesired ---

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Blonde dorée assez pâle. Mousse blanche disparaissant rapidement.
Arômes de malt, céréalé.. On ne sent pas d’houblonnage. Rien de spécial.
En bouche similaire, très peu d’amertume. Se rapprochant plus d’une pale lager que d’une pilsener.
Plutôt déçu vu les notes.

Czech lager is the best in the world. Lovely stuff. Mild, well balanced and not as bitter as some Pilsners. Taste is grain and bread with a mild metallic edge. Dry crisp finish. Very enjoyable lager. Although I still think I prefer Staropramen in regard to Czech beer.

The best Czech lager you can possibly buy outside Czech(?) I haven’t yet drink any better lager. Nice medium body, round sweetness with beautiful Saaz aroma hop throughout. Almost no head retention, though.
Bottle 0,5l. Beer on half way between pale lager and pilsner. Indefinite aroma, fresh malty flavor with mild hop bitterness, drinkable and refreshing.

Four bottles in four days. One of them was very bad, beer with salty astringency in flavor. The others, brewed different date, was better. Very smooth mouthfeel, light body. Malty, grainy flavor, only slight bitterness. Good drinkable. This beer is on half way between czech pilsner and standard pale lager.

Loiríssima!!!

Que espuma cremosa!!!!

Cheiro de malte... Doce... Na intensidade certa. Um pouquinho de lúpulo.

Bom amargor, boa carbonatação.

O retrogosto me pareceu doce... sabão... Sei lá, talvez a minha expectativa fosse demasiada.

Bottle. Pours clear yellow golden with very white one finger head and high carbonation. Aroma is pilsner malt, subtle butterscotch and some yeasty spices. Taste is slightly sweet with light fizzy body and crisp medium bitter finish.
Rien d’exceptionnel, mais quand même sympa. Légèrement sucrée, céréalière, très sec. Une texture très légèrement onctueuse.
0,5l bottle. I think this beer has a better reputation as it tastes. Ok its easy drinkable but theres nothing special on this beer. Average.

Very Average, nothing brilliant. Pale in colour as one expects from a lager. flavour is slightly hoppy but overridden by the carbonation. Okay for hot Aussie summers, but personally the newly arrived Praga Pilsener has more too offer with its classic Euro flavour.

Uma das melhores pilsens, com ótima drinkability. Malte e lúpulo divinamente equilibrados. Final amargo na medida e com uma refrescância absoluta. Espuma média, límpida e de um dourado perfeito para essa lager.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from can. Aroma is grassy hay. Very clear golden color with white head. Light bitter taste. Light bodied, with lively carbonation, and a dry finish. Overall a nice crisp lager.
330ml bottle. Drank at the shanghai brewery ( china ). Hazy golden colour. White head. First impression : smells like weed. Taste Probably as weed. Watery also as last taste.

From can. Clear golden. Dense, but slowly diminishing, head and lacing. Superb and refined aroma of continental hops, with some malt sweetness. Flowerfields and newly mowed lawn. Less hops and less complexity in taste. Good drinkability.
0,33l fles bij OT301. Weinig bijzonder pilsner vooral moutig licht bitter medium zoet met een matige body
Clear gold, medium white head. Hop and "big lager" on the nose. Bitter sweet with a watered down finish. Overcarbonated. I swear this was good last time, not so much now.

This stuff is like KFC: I get a weird hankering for it about once every five years, and then I remember why I haven’t had it in five years. 
Nose is grass, grain and skunk. Taste is the same. Finish is ambiguously dry. It’s better than its bastard son, but that’s about it.
Bottle. Clear golden with a small head. Skunky and grainy aroma. Sweetish, pale malt and grassy flavors, mild herbal bitterness. Light-medium bodied. Feels not fresh though BB 04/15.
Bottle, clear pour, no head, tastes like budweiser,so not much of a taste or nose at all, just light easy drinking lager.
From the cask came a golden brew with a thin white head. Subtle malt and hop aromas flavors make this lager very drinkable.
Bottle. Dark golden yellow appearance, large bubbles, average white head. A standard pilsner hops taste, which makes it nicely bitter, with a grass and malt aroma
Nice bohemian pilsner, with its orange/yellow colour and unique czech taste.
Een gewoon pilsbiertje waar er zoveel van zijn, ik vind het niet zo speciaal. Dan zijn er veel betere

0,3l on Tap at Dvoracky. Goldenes Bier mit kleiner, weißer Schaumkrone.
Riecht leicht malzig. Schmeckt malzig süß und angenehm bitter. Tolles Bier.
Dla mnie piwko nr 1 nr 2 Pilsener Urquell nr 3 Gambrinus jak o czeskie chodzi piwka.... a ogolem Dla mnie nr 1 wsrod piwek zdecydowanie smak i zapach pasuja mi idealnie
A very nice Czech pilsner. Very good for a mass-produced lager. Beats the American version any day.
Far better that American clone, still quite poor. Noticeable bitterness, malty aroma. Pours pale golden with small, quite stable head.

Bottle at S&G tasting.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: grains.
TASTE: grains, pilsener. Not much here...
Weak on flavors and aromas for a Czech Pilsner. Saaz hops are given a prominent place and there are no off-flavors, but ultimately this is watery and a bit bland.

Jaune pâle avec un petit tête blanc. L’arôme des céréales et un petit peu d’agrumes florale. C’est aussi un peu acerbe. Le goût est des graines legerment sucré avec très peu d’amertume dans la finale.

One of the most classical Bohemian Pilseners around, brewed with pure ingredients in a more or less authentic way. Stable, snow white, moussy head, colour a pure golden blonde. Aroma of pure Bohemian Pilsener malts and herbal, Czech hops; taste malty, pure and a bit bready, ending in a refined aromatic hoppiness, relatively complex at least for a lager. Certainly one of the leading examples in its style.
While not a beer with a lot of flavour it is more drinkable and enjoyable than most lagers

Aroma: cereal and bread malts. Appearance: clear gold, small white head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: light bitter continue, malty. Overall: decent Pilsner, light but not bland. Pint at U Medvidků, Prague.

Great Czech beer and great session beer no matter where you are in the world. The taste is mild, but obvious, the colour and head are pretty spot on even for such a commercial brew. Definitely my go-to beer in Czech Republic.
0.5 l bottle. Pours a light golden color with white head. Taste is sweet with a little bit of bitterness. Aroma is floral hops, grain. Average carbonation. Great beer.
@ Havregatan. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget (11:-). Sweet malty and quite bitter, hay/straw. The finish is dry, bitter and malty.
Nice golden yellow in color. Sweet malt nicely balanced with pepper hops and spiciness. Nice example.

Je ne peux m’empêcher de prendre une bouteille de bière lorsque j’achète du vin à la SAQ. Cette fois-ci c’est une charmante tchèque, blonde comme le soleil et son chapeau de mousse, qui se résorbe toutefois rapidement en un mince voile. Au nez c’est le fameux malt, propre au style, avec quelques parfums herbacés, du miel et un bémol métallique. Une politesse veloutée sur la langue, avec des herbes enrobées de miel, se terminant en une douce amertume. Elle est efficace et plaisante. (M.A. 05 décembre 14) (1131-290614)

Reviewed from notes.
This was poured into a pilsener.
The appearance had a clear golden yellow color with a one finger white foamy head. There was some light somewhat clingy lacing after the head dissipated.
The smell had some cooked corn-like/slightly graininess to it.
The taste was mostly sweet with a slight toastiness to it.
On the palate, this one sat about a light on the body.
Overall, I’m trying to figure out the difference between this and Budweiser as I’d probably have to do a blind tasting to try to figure them out.

33cl bottle at home. Clear golden with a medium white head. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Medium bitterness with some sweet tones. Malts, hops, grass and straw. A refreshing pilsner.

My bottle (11.2oz, from Cheese Traders, So. Burlington) does not say the word "Budweiser" anywhere on the label. I dont think I could distinguish between a Grolsch & this beer in a blind taste test.... I like Grolsch a lot and think both of them surpass the lame standards of the general pale-lager-limited masses here in USA. Pilseners, certain pale ales, and wheat/wit beers are my summertime faves for sure.
Clear golden colour,fair white head. Medium sweetnes,some bitterness in the aftertaste. Overall, very good czech pilsner.
Belle couleur jaune doré; arômes et goût malté-houblonné; bon équilibre douceur-amertume; une bonne pilsner
Standout beer! One of my all time favourites. Golden colour, nice frothy head. Long finish with pleasant aftertaste.
One of the better bottled beers of this sort. Nothing fancy but there’s no unnecessary sweetness or sickly aftertaste. Just a crisp, refreshing, bitter pilsner that goes down very nicely.
Cerveja amarga como uma boa lager deve ser. Achei o preço excessivo, mas boa pra tomar de vez em quando
Bottle. Good but unstable white head. In aroma mostly malts with some hops notes. In taste is quite watery with very low bitterness.

Clear, golden color with some head.

Nothing distinct about the taste, just a regular beer one expects. Nicely drinkable.
Clear, bright gold color. There is a little bit of hops in aroma and taste. The bitterness is quite poor in general, but for like a pilsner it’s ok.
Clear light golden with a fair white head. Aroma straw, grass, corn, pilsner malt. Little bread and fruitiness. Flavor follows. Smooth. Mild bitterness and dryness. Pretty nice.
Golden pour with white head. Aroma is very slightly grassy. Flavor is smooth and light, wet hay.
500 ml, bottle. Nice, big white head. Aroma of hops, even good. Clear, gold. Little bitternes.

Mörkt guldfärgad, mycket vacker. Kola, nybakat bröd, karamell.
Önskar bara att den fanns i halvliter
Barwa słomkowa, biała piana, szybko znikająca. Aromaty trawy, ziół. W smaku nuty słodowe oraz ziołowe akcenty chmielu. Alkohol niewyczuwalny, piwo dobrze pijalne.
On tap. Clear golden colour with medium white head. Aroma - Hops, grain. Taste - Bitter, hops, malts.

Draught @ Bar Brouw Oost, Amsterdam.
Classic round golden Czech lager. Nice to start of with, but a bit too malty sweet for a session.
Bottle. Aroma is grass notes, quite crisp and fresh. Taste is malty, sweet, grassy and fresh. Quite nice

4oz Sample at the London Beer And BBQ
Better then the American Budweiser by a long shot not bad for a Pilsner

Clear golden with a huge rocky foam. Smell is malt, bread, corn, grass and citrus. Taste about he same, with a grainy touch. Ends light bitter, dry and hoppy. Body is light, carbo soft to medium, texture smooth. A very drinakble pilsner, a great show of the style and this one mananges to bring out the light hoppiness beautifully. I can have plenty of these and still thirsty for more.
From bottle. Light maltiness, grass, some citrus, very long dry hoppy finish with herbal touch. Medium bodied. Pretty good crisp and tasteful pilsener.

Dorada, oscura para ser una pilsner, con una espuma que se disipa demasiado pronto dejando una apariencia muy triste. Aroma a lúpulo noble, relativamente intenso y entrada en boca dulce, incluso con un poco de caramelo, con suave amargor final. Falta espuma y amargor pero para ser una cerveza de supermercado esta muy bien.

Clear golden color, minimal white head, metallic nose. Medium sweetness and some bitterness. Thin to medium body, watery texture. Bittersweet finish. Malty aroma, traces of hops.

(Magic Beer Room 0,5l bottle)
Pours golden,thin white head. Aroma is malts,grains,sweet herbs. Taste is sweet malts,grains,bitter,smooth. Very refreshing.
From a bottle. This is the czech taste of pilsner origin that I had hoped Pilsner Urquell would provide but failed. Crisp, clear and full of character. Very height of lager expression.
0,5 l bottle. Dark golden in the glass, a more smaller head. Grainy on the nose. Starts grainy, light bitterness, smooth brewingwater. Fruity hints in the background.
Quite colourful for a dry pale lager. A bit of caramel and a slight peachy fuitiness. Dry and slightly hoppy. Thin body but that’s the style.
Coloração dourada bem intensa, aroma herbáceo e com leve malte, sabor maltado e com amargor suave, que não agride e puxa um próximo gole.

I really thought that this beer could deliver much better, and taste like other Czechs like Staropramen and Starobrno. Instead it?s highly mediocre. Very musty. It tastes decent anyway but a bit of a dissapointment for me.

Draugh
Aroma-- malt, yeast
Appearance-pale, clear, white foam, 
Taste-light bitterness, light sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-light body, thin feel, lively, bitter finish
Overall-good
The aroma is not it’s best point. Classic pale Lager with a bit of caramel and a bitter taste.

Can. Surprisingly I rather enjoyed this brew. Taste of caramel, hay, and spices. Has a heavier body than most and a nice carbonation. The aftertaste finishes with a kind of spiciness on the tongue, but a refreshing kind. I would buy this again.

Pils tchèque de 5 % abv, brassée selon de Reinheitsgebod allemand...
Couleur doré moyen brillant. Clarté nette. Bulles fines mais très peu nombreuses.
Mousse blanche qui tombe vite.
Arômes de citronelle, pneu de voiture, pelure de pomme de terre, corde de chanvre.
1ère bouche liquide sur la pils typique : du malt blanc et du houblon amer piquant.
2ème sur un peu de blé, girofle, citronelle.
3ème assez orientée sur l’ammoniaque.
La longueur est plus sur un ensemble malt/houblon, qui n’est pas désagréable mais
sans aucune noblesse. De la grande banalité.
L’alcool n’aide rien.
La finale est assez fade.
CONCLUSION : de la pils au sens propre, c’est-à-dire pas grand chose... On disait dans
les campagnes : de la pils de chat … On peut dire ici : de la pils de czech ...
Cerveja tipo pilsen de coloração amarelo ouro, com espuma de media intensidade, muito palatavel e suave, sabor evidente de cevada. Recomendo a apreciadores de uma ótima pilsen.
One of the best pilsen beers in my opinion. It feels really good in the mouth. A dark gold and very refreshing beer I recommend.

A classic of the style. Pours a clear golden yellow with a foamy white head. Light flavour and aroma, very typical of the style. Malty start, dry finish. Definitely a longstanding brew, but it can’t compete with the new flavours of some of the newer microbrewed pilseners

Appearance was clear gold with white creamy lasting 1 finger head, spotty lacing. Aromas are sweet pils malts upfront then toffee midway with slight mineral water and spicy hops. Taste are sweet caramelize malts upfront, spicy herbal hops with that special smooth mineral h2o. Palate was soft smooth CO2 with light body, then a balanced lasting smooth unique finish. I love this Pils.

Fairly enjoyable for a this style. It always tastes a bit like earthy mushrooms to me, not really bad but always there. It has a decent malt flavour and is nice and crisp and dry in the mouth. Grassiness and a bit of light peppery spice are in there. It’s better than bad but gee I hope Czech people have finer brews than this at their disposal.
Piękna, złota bawa. Niska piana. Średnio musujące, wyśmienity smak.
Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - grass. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Finishes light bitter.
Can bought in Super Vero Belgrade.Yellow color, smell of fruits.Weak bitter taste, but drinkable
Bottle at a barbecue with free Carling Black Label on offer, so I brought this instead. Little aroma, malty taste with sweet finish. Typical pilsner, just on the good side of average.
Tap. Light body, average carbonation, bitter finish, medium bitterness, clear, golden, white foam, & light sweetness.
Light amber colour, white medium head. Sweet, malty and full aroma. Light body, sweet and abrupt taste.

Bottle. Nice yellow, fast fading, white head. Aroma is fruity, sour but not very intense. Taste is sweet, bitter and rounded with a bit of salt, the taste is really round and pleasant. Palate is like the taste very pleasant, balanced carbonation and a creamy texture. 

I´m really pleased with this beer, it´s one of the best Pilseners I´ve ever drank, it totally lacks the metallic bitterness I associate with Czech beers.
Klar lys gyllen farve med lyst skum som avtar raskt. Lukt av noe malt og humle. Smak av noe malt og humle. Boks 4,5%. Supermarked.
Sparse foam . His nose is malty with a hint of caramel. Dry and malty palate, it reveals a rather hoppy bitterness and a mediumfinal.

Molt bona cervesa, refrescant, suau i facil de beure.
Muy buena cerveza, refrescante, suave y fácil de beber.

Golden color that is slightly darker than other lagers. Little/no head. Crisp carbonation. Flowery and caramel like scent and taste. A little sour aftertaste.

-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Medium gold with a thin, white, lasting thing settling head. Smells of light fresh hops and grain and a bit of grapes. Medium oily body. Lovely taste of sweet dry malt with grain and a bitter hop finish. The finish has a bit of a lingering paper.

Can. Pale colour. Aroma is malty, not much hops. Light bitterness. Very good for a simple lager.

Previous rating: 23.04.2015 3/3/3/3/13
Bottle. Weak aroma of malt. Light bitterness. Head does not last long. Acceptable, but below average when it comes to Czech pilsners.
Straw. Golden pour no head. Hay dry flavour. Fairly flat. This is pretty shit. Not much else to say.
Golden pour with a thin whit head. Grain and cereal aroma, bit of a cardboard as well. Similar taste, little hops. Decent pilsner
God øl. Mild smak. God til alle anledninger. Samtidig er den for tam til å drikke for seg selv kvelden ut.
Golden colour. A decent pilsner. Grainy, some hop character, crip, smooth finish.

.5 liter green bottle, which is about 17 ounces. Drink by 1-27-15... pretty long shelf life. My guess is that this was bottled recently.

Appearance: Pours a perfectly clear yellow color with a head that goes away almost instantaneously. No lacing. Looks alright for what it is.

Smell: Pale malts, hay, and maybe the slightest amount of hops. Not great, but a decent smelling pils. A pretty classic sort of aroma.

Taste/feel: The most pleasant thing about this beer that I can tell is the mouthfeel. Too many mass produced beers like this don’t have anything other than a super light body with aggressive carbonation. This one has a light/medium smooth feel with a moderate carbonation. The flavor is also better than the smell. Some of that hay, pale malt, and slight hop bitterness with a biscuit and subtly sweet aftertaste. A very drinkable pils with nothing off about it.

There’s nothing especially unique about this beer, but it’s just a very well made pilsener that’s worlds better than American Budweiser.

Strong pilsner, gold color, grainy, smooth finish, could go for it again, but not my favorite pilsner

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A strong brass color with a solid head that doesn’t overstay it’s welcome. 

Lovely subtle aroma - a sweet, gentle hay air haunted by a calloused hops. 

The hop is indisputably present but it is not overwhelming. The hop can be faint like a dusty mist left by a fleeting phantom and then hit intensely like an ethereal shiver as it passes right through you.

It is slightly sweet and lightly bitter. It is very nice that the hops linger even after the curtain is drawn. 

Overall, it is very refreshing and complex - a top beer.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein goldgelbes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hopfig malzig, grasig, getreidig. Geschmack hopfig bitter, malzig, getreidig.
Really good bottle and label design.It has sweet and fresh nose, but not sweet taste. Drink this beer with fresh fruits.it s ok then..
500ml bottle. Crisp pils, lacking the smooth sweetness of its pilsen brethren.
Bottle, pours a light golden color with white head, taste is sweet with a little bit of bitterness, much better than the American beer with the same name.

A very nice pilsner. 
Light amber/gold color,nice head.
Malty and grainy with a crispy fresh aftertaste. Nice hoppy presence.
På flaske på barometer bar. Gyllen farge. Ingen skum. Smøraktig smak. Ikke noe god. Lite co2
(Backlog) Bottle. Golden pour with white head, Light malt and pilsner aromas, as well as flavors. A little upset this doesn’t blow the us budweiser away...

Pours clear golden yellow. Foamy white head quickly dissipates. Aroma is hay, barnyardy, a bit funky. Palette is slick, medium body. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Lots of carbonation, which kind of obliterates the taste on the finish.

330ml green bottle with a foil sealed cap, poured into a footed Pilsner glass. Appearance is clear pale golden with a small almost non-existent white head, that quickly dissipated leaving no lacing. Aroma of grass, wheat bread and grains. Flavour of wheat bread, corn and a hint of lemon peels. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter. Palate is light bodied, thin watery texture and average carbonation. Plain simple flavours, unoffensive and okay served nearly ice cold. Overall Budweiser Budvar is a good beer for the price, but not taking price into consideration there are better Czech Pilsners.
bottle. golden with small head. solid euro-pilsner with light body and a bit of hops.
Drinkin while watching Cheops' Cave! Awsome rock-group. Check it out ! Medioker lager.

The original Budweiser (well, that doesn’t promise much now does it...). It has a golden color with a medium foam head (like every lager). It’s nothing grounbraking. But way better than it’s american counterpart. A nice pilsener character that makes it stand above the crowd (if only a little). malty taste, slightly bitter aftertaste. A good (regular) beer.
Backlog. Tried both bottled and on tap. Your standard mass-produced Czech lager, no better or worse than it’s competitors.
Pretty good for a lager but generally not my choice of beer. The dark version of this however…
Bottle. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma and taste is malty, bit fruity. Taste is lightly sweet, lightly bitter.
On tap. Dark gold color with one finger head. Malty aroma. Bitter taste that doesn’t linger. Solid beer to go along with a meal.
0.5l bottle. Clear golden color with medium sized white head. Aroma of cooked vegetables, malt, grass and fruits. Taste is sweet and bitter.

Bottle purchased in Prague. Golden pour with a white head. The aroma and flavor have some pilsner malt notes as well as a bit of grass. I also get some light fruitiness in the flavor. Thin mouthfeel and medium carbonation.
bought a bottle some time ago at speciaalbierpakket. gold yellow colour with a white head. crisp mouthfeel, floral, hops, bit metallic, malts, nice pilsner

Clear golden with a white head, floral aroma and light diacetyl.

Taste is floral bitterness. Easy to drink. Light body, diacetyl provides some fullness. High carbonation.

Bottle 0.33 l. Golden color. Small-medium head. No lacing. Level of aroma is low for czech pilsners. Flowery, grassy, metallic. Taste is ok. Some honey and hop notes. Also some sweetness. Overall: very balanced. Ok, but nothing special.
Clear golden colour with big white head. Nicely balanced and very drinkable. Aroma is malty, bready with grassy hop notes. Great pilsener

Rich dark golden colour with smooth white head. Saaz hops aroma evident immediately. Taste is smooth and rich, with maltiness becoming more pronounced as it warms. Hops bitterness is much more subdued than Pilsner Urquell, which makes this beer a bit more mellow and easier to drink.
Pours pale golden with a small white head that shortly disappears. Aroma of malt and grassy hops. Tastes of malt and mild bitterness, some sweetness. Fairly nice and easy to drink.

A very worthy beer. It has a good clean flavour whose profile is accurately maintained from batch to batch. I get sweet malt against a tart effect probably from the yeast, good hop character well-melded, and some oily notes. A classic from a country which knows all about great beer.

Gary
Bottle. Aroma is hoppy. Taste is fresh sweet, and a medium bitter. Bloemig, houterig
500ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Golden colour with small off white head. Noses of straw, and barley. Light and fizzy. Nice with beer.

As far as I’m concerned this is what most North American commercial beers try to (but obviously cannot) be... A wonderful "everyday" beer. Not a work of art, but very well-balanced, subtle and drinkable. Beautiful golden colour with a generous white head that dissipates quickly. Nice yeasty aroma with light citrus and cereal notes. The first taste is almost immediately somewhat tart and hoppy and is carried well by a good dose of CO2. Mild bitter aftertaste. Light but not watery. Great beer... Na zdraví!
Pours a clear golden color. Aroma is malts, grass, and a little honey. Taste is light sweet and light bitter.

Pale lagers, perhaps my least favorite style there is. Tough to rate I suppose because of what they are, bland, watery, unremarkable. This one surprised me though with the amount of flavor in it. The flavor is bread and cereal, but still, at least its something.
Clear amber color, white head. Medium body, average carbonation. Aroma is floral hops, grass, malt, grain. Taste is similar. Light sweet with light bitterness at the end. OK
Excellent Pilsner! Refreshing and ideal to have it very cold on a hot day. Maybe his bastard brother should learn a little from him.
Brilhante e media espuma.Aroma floral e sabor leve e refrescante de cereal e do lupulo saaz

Can @ Home. Pours golden with a huge white head. Aroma of malt, light grain, grassy and floral hops. Flavor is malt, little grain, little sweetness, grass. Thin to medium body, lively carbonation. Clean and refreshing. 010214
33 cl bottle. Easy drinkable lager/pilsner. Floral hoppy aroma. Taste is light sweet and bitter. Good pilsner.

Bottle. Clear golden, white, qucikly dissipating, head.. Sweet malt and honey aroma. Bitter on consumption with a sweet honeyish aftertaste. Medium to low carbonation. Overall a drinkable lager, though there was something off about the taste.
500ml bottle, Dublin. The original budweiser but that’s about as far as the comparison goes. This beer is infinitely superior. A very good, tasty, flavoursome lager - one of the best lagers around
Bottle, 500 ml at Alcatraz, Zagreb. Pours golden yellow, white head. Sweetish malty flavor with hint of bitterness at the end.
É uma cerveja leve, como todas as pilsner tchecas. Muito boa para ser tomada em um dia quente.

A - a clear light golden with almost no head. S - this smells like a lager. Shocking. Sticky honey, honeysuckle and a hint of feet. M - so light. Average carb. T - the taste is honey and flowers in the face. Honey suckle, lager and light grains. 2.3

The original Budweiser lives up to its reputation well! I was immediately impressed by the strong flavorful aroma of floral hoppiness that introduces this brew, matched with a golden, slightly bronzed color with good lacing. Taste is very fresh, pale malts and floral, almost fruity, hops, combined with a touch of spiciness. A bit light on the palate but very smooth and drinkable. Struck me as very distinct from Pilsner Urquell, not necessarily better or worse. Enjoyable all around.
Botella de 33 cl. Color dorado con una espuma blanca que desaparece con rapidez. La carbonatación se deja notar. Alguna nota floral y un ligero dulzor de la malta. Nada destacable

Bottle from Lazy dog
Pours a crystal clear medium golden color with a smallish white head that quickly dissipates to a bubbly ring on top. Skunk hits my nose as soon as I wrangle the cap off the top of this and mostly dissipates as my beer opens up. Spicy floral hops and sweet bready grainy pilsner malt with a hint of rich melanoidin make up the bulk of the aroma. The flavor is sharp with spicy hop flavor, balanced by a honey like sweetness wrapped into a brown bread. Medium body with a spirited level of carbonation and a slick bubbly mouthfeel. Once the mercaptan left I really enjoyed this lager!
Nice golden colour with a malty sweet aroma, taste to follow is fresh and clean, a nice malty/bready sweetness balanced by slight citrusy bitterness. Quality lager.

Clear light yellow color. No bubbles. At first a nice white head but it quickly disappears. After a short while it just looks like apple juice. Medium body. Not much flavors at all. Very low on bitterness.

Bu en bouteille de 33cl, magnifique couleur dorée avec des fines bulles, bien transparentes et une jolie mousse, une bonne bière de soif bien amer qui fait ressortir le côté floral de l’houblon. Excellente Pils Tchèque
Bottle pour. Pours a clear gold with a big white head of foam. Aroma has grainy grassy notes. Fairly sweet and bready. Light body. Medium carbonation. Longer finish. Pretty good and easy drinking.

Bottle, "Czech Imported Lager". Color is pale golden, small quickly reducing head. Very weak aroma of malt. Taste is bitter-sweet, some hoppy bitterness, bread. Diacetyl aftertaste. Very watery. Seriously?
Siankorvaa ja kraanavettä. Ei ollenkaan minun makuun, kamalaa lätkää. Vähätellä ei edes tarvi, tumman rinnalla surkea pikkusisko.

Draft. Soft malty nose, faint esters. Soft bready malt backbone, like a munich helles. Semi sweet, like a pils (guess I didn’t realize it was a pilsner when I was taking notes, oops). Slight butter and diacetyl.
On tap at Tom Tom, Auckland. Pours golden and slightly cloudy. Easy drinking banana yeast flavours come through

Sehr hell, fast zu hell. Wenig Schaum, der schnell vergeht. Geringe Aromen. Geschmacklich leicht malzig, nur geringer Hopfen. Ich mag es, eine Besonderheit, die man getrunken haben muss, ist es nicht. Sehr Mainstream.
Birrón terrible! Alto estándar en el estilo. La mejor Pilsen que tomé hasta ahora. Para repetir.
Aroma: light malt aroma with very faint hopinessTaste: Bitter euro-maltiness with fairly pronounced hoppiness at endAppearance: Pale gold body with poorly maintained head

Cerveja de aroma agradável, fermento e algo frutado. Aparência clara, ouro reluzente com pouca espuma. Sabor leve, clássico. Sem grandes surpresas no paladar. É uma cerveja de corpo leve, boa bebilidade.
Golden and clear with nice white head. Almost no aroma, hint of malt there. Malt, caramel, flowers, with clear aftertaste of Saaz hops. High in carbon
A touch of sweetness tempered by slightly bitter finish. Golden in the glass with nice head. Crisp taste with a touch of citrus. Nose has citrus and wheat. Refreshig.

Pours a clear golden with a small white head. Aroma of grass, grainy malt, some fruits, hint of citrus, hint of floral, hoppy notes. Flavour is light to moderate sweet with a moderate bitter finish. Body is light to medium. A very nice refreshing and aromatic Pilsener.

Golden colour with a fading small off white head. Coherently CO2 propelled liquid. Noses of straw, barnyard and barley. Light fizzy and watery texture. Light body, quaffable with bitter and sweet notes. Finish is fast.

Appearance: Clear amber/golden with 3 finger white head.
Aroma: Corn, spicy, grassy/herby, biscuit.
Taste: Low/medium sweet and sourness with medium bitterness and slight saltiness.
Palate: Thin coarse texture, light body, prickly carbonation, abrupt bitter malty finish.
Comments: Tasty and glass lace.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Clear golden with large frothy white head, Aroma is floral hops, grain. Taste is sweet malt with a nice smooth bitterness in the background, finish has light spicy bitterness.

Color is a medium golden color with a slight white head. Aroma is sweet maltiness, touch of corn, very slight pineness. Taste is crisp, clean, touch of bitterness with a lingering touch of biscuit flavor. Very nice session brew with the exception of the corn in the aroma......after a couple sips it became obvious this was light struck, the beginning stages but definitely has the tell tale taste.

aroma: grassy, hoppy, slightly sweet, fresh; taste: moderate bitter lager, nice palate and very drinkable, thin body, the hop aroma isn’t really dominant, more the hop bitterness. one of the better indutrial beers
a very pleasant crisp refreshing lager. nothing special but it is very drinkable and satisfying

Malty sweet bitter aromas come from this crystal clear yellow brew with no head. Slightly sweet grainy flavor with a biscuty aftertaste. This light bodied brew has low carb. and for a lager it is average.
Refreshing, nice light colour. Pale white head. A proper lager; I’ll take this any day of the week!
Czech style pilsners are not my cup of tea. But this one is actually quite ok. Only had the bottled ones, would like to try tap.

Amerikanerna stal Budweiser från tjeckerna och gjorde namnet till sitt eget. Våldtäkten de sedan begick på receptet skulle än i dag kunna vara anledning till militär invasion. Nu är visserligen inte originalet heller särskilt mycket att skriva hem om, men det svider ändå värre för den fattige än för den rike när rånaren står på farstubron.

Great gold color with a refreshing citric flavor, easy to drink and quite refreshing!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home. Pale yellow, carbonation dissipates quickly. No head. The strong lemon and grassy overtones from the Saaz dominate the aroma. Smells better before the pour, oddly. Fresh and malty taste, a bit of bitterness lingering on the back of the throat. Refreshing. Palette a bit thin but the carbonation bulks it up and gives a nice numbing sensation on the lips. This is a very very good Czech pils, but it has its flaws. Personally I prefer it on draught so my rate again and average the two.

Draft in a branded glass at the Marquis. Brassy body, white head. Looks attractive. Cereal, bread aromas, background of grass. Bitter and metallic taste. Highly carbonated. I feel like I caught this on a bad day, so maybe not fair to review... One to revisit.
I love "Pilsner Urquell" but less the Budweiser Budvar beerIt?s a convenant pils :)next one please :)

330ml green bottle. Pours golden in color with a very small head. No aromas that I can pick up. Has malty, fruit, do I detect apple?flavours, some light bitterness with sweet after notes from barley. Quite a drinkable pils. I’ll have me some more methinks.
Pale, sparkling beer with floral aroma. You can taste the hops and a lot of bitterness with some sweet sidetaste. Long bitter finish. Definitely a good commercial beer, but not my style.
Bottle. Golden with small white head. Aroma of DMS and some sweetness. Light body with some hop bitterness upfront.

From 500 ml can. Pours a perfectly clear honey-gold with a sudsy but lasting white head and vigorous carbonation. Aromas of hay, hint of lemon and a light sweetness. Taste is lemon at the front before a restrained hop bitterness comes through. Although the finish is really clean, there’s a slight creaminess in the palate. Well balanced and really refreshing. Nice Czech lager - liked it.

Flaske. Gylden farve, hvidt skum. Maltet smag med strejf af karamel og citrus. God pilsner.

This has to be one of the better globally-available beers, though I prefer Urquell’s bitterness. Nice golden colour, thin head (500ml can here). Warm, toasty aroma. Flavour creamy as a Budweiser should be, toasty malts again, bit of grassiness. Nice finish. Good.
Toffee/Diacetyl-Noten schon im Geruch. Im Geschmack dann Malzigkeit. Leider absolut ohne Hopfenaroma.
One of my favorite pilsner beers, even when so many available in the Czech Republic, and likely the best beer available in the USA.
Shared bottle. A nice light beer which pours down easy. A true classic. Quite good.
500ml bottle. Light zesty aroma. Slightly floral, a little sweet and a touch metallic. A little hop coming through, too. Nice.

Bottle 330ml @ home from Vinmonopolet. So this is the original bud. Nice to taste it after hearing so much about the ongoing legal disputes. And it?s a nice, drinkable beer. Pours clear golden with tiny head. Aroma is (very) mild maltd and flowers. Taste is way above most pilsners I?ve tried. Some mild hops and malts. Drinking this excellent beer I?m thinking this is something I could drink many of in an evening, but I miss something one can not expect from this type of beer. Aroma and taste. I like beers with more taste, be it an IPA or an imperial Stout. Still, in its style this is as good as it gets.
One of the finest pilseners in the world, which should not be a surprise. Light malts, great hops, nice flowery aroma, great beer all over. Classic label, too.
Прекрасный экземпляр чешского Пилзнера, но на мой взгляд, излишне сладкий. Сначала - сладость, потом сменяется хмелевой горечью. Чистый приятный вкус.
The original Budweiser, way better than it’s American counterpart. Smooth grainy taste of Czech hops and a milt taste of malt.
Bottle at helsingin jäähalli. Clear golden color, white head. Aroma is malts, flowers, hops and some fruits. Balanced malty taste, hops and fruits. Little crispy.

The beer is sweet with a bit of bitterness, but of course it’s too little for me. I need hops, more hops. It has pleasant hoppy finish. Pours golden urine with robust head, but it disappears quickly leaving nothing. For a macrobrewer it’s very nice, but with the choice available, the only time I’ll try it is when I’m short on dough. You can get one for less than 1$ in a supermarket.
Can 0,5l. Pours golden, clear with nice white head. Malty, hoppy grassy aroma. Taste is sweet malt, light fruity and dry. Nice bitter finish. Thats a Budweiser..
Tap at von fressen. Earthy herbal fresh hops. Clear golden with thin white head and lacing. Round mild malts with a good bitter finish.

Aroma: Grainy, floral hoppy, sweet corn, bread
Appearance: Clear gold, thin white head, no lacing

Palate: Medium-full body, dry finish
Overall: Very nice! 

500 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Leon!
2B. Bohemian Pilsener

500ml bottle from duty-free shop at the Vaalimaa Finnish-Russian border crossing, clear deep gold colour, small rocky white head. Aroma is bread, hay, grass, grains and notes of fruit, floral hops and citrus, taste is somewhat on the the malty/sweet side, fairly balanced anyway, bitter and not very long finish, medium body, soft carbonation. Not much difference to a very good bulk lager aside for a bit more depth in the aroma, quite refreshing and very drinkable nonetheless, from the huge Czech companies stuff I do prefer Uruquell a bit more as it has more significant amount of hops. On the other hand 16€ for a carton at the duty free and not much else worth getting, so I always make a point of buying one or two when returning from Russia.

Appearance with golden color and medium foam.
Aroma is very interesting: Hops and malt.
The palate is refreshing and well balanced with malt and hops well integrated.
I highly recommend it!

The color of this beer is a clear golden with a large foamy white head that fades rapidly. The aroma is a fusion of caramel and bread malts with dough yeast, and I’m glad to say that it is not skunked. The taste is slightly sour and a touch sweet, but this lightness combined with the palate (medium body, soft carbonated bite, thick yet slick texture, and abrupt finish) makes this beer quite enjoyable.

Bottle from Tesco in Wokingham, Berks. Pours a clear light amber colour a thin white head and some good lacing. Aroma of bready malt, yeast and corn. Flavours of white grapes, lemon and hay. Finishes with grains, caramel and some pine resin.
Bonne lager tcheque, bien meilleure que la bud américaine. Belle couleur, bon gout houblonné. Tres bonne parmi les lager, bien rafraichissante.
Typical Pilsener appearance. Aroma of grass and herbs, with a slight note of butter. Taste is just about the hops, malt stays pleasantly in the background. Dry finish.
0,5L bottle. High white longlasting head. Clear golden color. Aroma of malt, grass and hops. Classical malty flavor with hops and some bitter finish. Palate is OK.

Aroma: Discreet cereal aroma. hay and barn notes with little hoppy scent.
Appearance: Blond, very sparkling and clear. Little half creamy head lasting quite long. A little lacing showing up on glass.
Taste: Attack is malted, thin, with a slightly hoppy finish.
We can find some discreet notes of hay, earth and little caramel, but generally the taste profile is small. North American pilsners are generally more aromatic. Mouth feel is thin and and slightly sparkling.

500ml bottle at home. Pours clear gold with a good long-lasting white head. Aromas of cooked corn, cereal and lemon. Taste has a gentle bitterness and light malt sweetness. Builds to a cheaper lyager astringency though. If you had to drink lager a lot, this is a good enough one.
Bottle. Golden color, decent head. Nice lager flavor. Wouldn’t sat it’s the best though. Slightly spunky in both taste and aroma.
Bud is always a nice choise for daily drinking. Altough it has a complex aroma it is hard to catch those flavours.
Cereal, bread, woody, breja boa, a verdadeira pilsen. Malditos americanos roubaram o nome Budweiser original dela

Bottle. Pours golden yellow with a small white head. Tastes better than your average lager or pils but not the best. Aroma is a bit malty. Easy drinking with little aftertaste.

Typical skunky green bottle pilsner. Blah. Some grassy notes. Glad I got this style out of the way.

Lys lager. Så å si ingenting skum. Nordisk alkoholprosent. 4, 5 . Noe fruktig smak. Lettdrikkelig.

Green 500ml bottle: BBD 15 May 2014, poured (3 times) into a small Budweiser Budvar glass given to me almost 20 years ago by a barman in Germany after drinking draught Budvar all night and still being able to stand up (well almost). This Pilsner is an old friend and I’m very surprised to find I’ve never recorded a tasting before.

Looked good in it’s old glass: bright golden colour, clean and crisp. The head sadly refused to hang around on any of the three pours.

Is it better than ’Pilsner Urquell’? I think so, sweeter and with more body, maybe the extra 0.6% ABV helps to make the difference as well.

Mild malty nose, some sweetness and more grainy than hoppy.

The taste is also semi-sweet and leaning towards a malty feel although there is a good sharp hop bitterness just below the surface which asserts itself towards the end of each sip.

Body depth suits it and the alcohol level feels just right.

It’s semi-sweetness wins over my sweet tooth and this is the Czech Pilsner beer to beat in my eyes.
Draught. Pours golden in color with a small head. Hay, butter and light malty notes in aroma. Some light bitterness with a bit of malty notes in taste. Nice pils. Fresh, crisp and tasty.

Golden colour, thick white head. Good retention. Nose of grains, hay, grass, citrus. Medium to full body. Brilliantly balanced taste with sweet malty & mild hoppy notes. Saaz hop in all beauty there. A classic of the style
0,5 on draft in Slovakia. Clear gold, white soft head. Light hoppy aroma. Clear taste, light, easy drinking with dry aftertaste. Nothing special, just ok
330 ml bottle, rated from backlog. Golden with fluffy head. Aroma and taste of pale malt, flowers and herbs. Very nice maltiness balanced with sufficient hop levels. Nice

Sharp, hoppy, pilsener. Drunk on draft on many occasions in Czech Republic and in Croatia.

Tap. Pours clear golden with a decent white head. Aroma is bread and some cereal. Taste is medium bitter with a touch of sweetness. Light body with lively carbonation.

Can, brought from Czech Republic. Pours pale golden, stable fluffy head. Beautiful Zatec herbal bouqet, field flowers, some becherovka-like pharmaceutical hints. Tender maltiness and soft plzen water, airy palate and sweet aftertaste. Very light drinkable lezak for warm sunny day walks.
Bottle. A decent pilsner but lacking any real Czech hop presence to make it a goode one. Saying that, I can happily drink a few bottles of this on a hot day.

Appearance: dark gold (not as light in color as American macros)
Pours a sudsy 1/2" head that dissipates rather quickly and leaves very little lacing. Carbonation bubbles last throughout the consumption.

Aroma: I smell toasted grain but don’t detect much hop aroma.

Mouthfeel: fairly watery, but less so than American macros or Euro lagers like Heineken

Flavor: there is some sweetness throughout but the bitterness of the hops seems to outweigh that from beginning to end. Fairly dry finish.

Overall: good but not outstanding
Draft on a music festival in the czech republik very nice thirst quencher liked it
Clear yellow pour with a thin white head. Aroma is sweet malt, a little skunky. Taste is a little sweet, crisp finish. A nice lager. Love to try it fresh.

Foam as normal, can be higher than many others, but not "deutschhh".
Aroma normal hops as pilsner, maybe a sour hint and some flower.

Carbonation low from the 33cl bottle. Not higher from 55cl alu-can. 
Taste of hops and malts, distictively malts, maybe a grain of chocolate.

I dedicate this rating to Zdeněk "Kobra" Ondrášek, our city’s footballer who comes from České Budějovice.
Bottle at bbq. Grains, malt, hint of hops. Fresh and crisp, excellent summer afternoon alternative to a weizen. Better than Urquell.

cereal, floral, earthy, golden, clear, frothy, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, sticky, lively, bitter, a classic pilsener, hoppy, bitter, refreshing, a real role model for all the other pilseners...
Not bad. A rich golden color. Malty. Thin head. Not bad. Had on the roof of the citadel hostel in Jerusalem.

Not that bad as I thought it would be. Just an average lager. Easy to drink I guess.

Tap at Hadanka, Helsinki. Originally rated 09092011. Colour is clear yellow with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, sweetness and malts.

Bought a bottle at Bert’s Bierhuis. Has a blond color and a large white head, which stays long and is highly carbonated. Aroma of gras, hops and citrus fruits. Has a mild and well balanced taste with a little sweetness at the end. Has a dry and light bitter aftertaste. A very good pilsner, just as good as Pilsner Urquell.

Can at Vienna Airport. The aroma is weak yeast and malt. A typical pilsner. The flavour is medium bitter with nicely hopped palate and a little malt. The bitter finish lasts forever. As far as pilsners go, it’s one of the best.

(33 cl bottle at Café Kildevæld in October 2011) Pours a clear straw yellow with white, quickly dissipating head. The aroma is the classical czech mix of malt and hops. Refreshing but perhaps a faint skunky whiff. Fizzy carbination, medium-bodied with oily texture and an abrupt finish. Taste is mildly bitter for a hophead like me with a delectable malty backbone. Decent refreshment beer.

Pours a clear golden color. Head is clean and white, reducing quickly to a thin layer. Nose is sweet with malts and some hops. Taste is crisp, clean and refreshing. Palate is lively with lots of small bubbles. A nice and refreshing drink for summer times.
Herbig, sanft im Abgang. Es schmeckt gut .. sogar lauwarm. Und es ist nicht teuer. :D ....
Minimal white head,  golden color, large bubbles, neutral aroma. Sweet, creamy taste, vibrant bitter aftertaste. Too fizzy for me. Not bad.
0.5 l bottle from Rewe, Marburg... Clear golden color, good head... Nice refreshing hop aroma... Mild tasteful flavor, perfect for hot Summer days... One of the best Czech beers...
Pours a pale fizzy yellow. Nice aromas of grains. .. some apple too. Similar flavours too.. pretty nice.
Et helt greit øl.  litt mer smak en en del andre standard øl.  Greit øl til god mat og drikke.

Celkově se jedná o velmi dobře pitelný, ležák, který rozhodně  nezklame, klasika.
Huge bubbles accompany this gold pilsner. Yeast and hops in the nose, although the yeast is less prevalent in the taste, which is primarily hops. Light bitter finish

large white frothy head. clear thin yellow body. totally diminishing. aroma: honey, moderate yteasty. if: light bitter; ff: light bitter sweet; average duration. palate: light medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, metallic finish. dulçor de mel, amargor suave, balanceia bem refrescante. 4s. 1 euro.

can. pours clear bright yellow with a frothy white head, some retention and lacing. hay, wet grass, bready and hint of biscuits, some earthy and citrusy notes. surprising fruity, light vanilla, and pale caramel sweetish finish - enjoyable. average to soft carbonation, light body - some oiliness. would take a 4-pack of that instead of other imported macro sh*t.

dark body, white, creamy head. aroma is malty. taste is sweet, caramelish, earthy and hoppy. good beer.

2013/04/25 - Pours a clear, dark golden color with a thin, white head. Aroma is biscuit, skunky, mild citrus and a slight funk. Taste is slightly bitter throughout with a sweet caramel aftertaste. Mouthfeel is medium, watered down with a crisp finish. Not as great as I had expected.

Agree with boozedude 

bottle into glass, pours clear light gold, with white head, skunky aroma, taste is very bitter first drink, after your about 1/2 way thru wih beer, i started enjoying it, decent for its style, notig i’ll ever seek out tho

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottle into glass, pours clear light gold, with white head,  skunky aroma, taste is very bitter first drink,  after your about 1/2 way thru wih beer, i started enjoying it,  decent for its style,  notig i’ll ever seek out tho
Boks fra Rema (4,5%): tynne saker. Lys farge og like kort skum som norsk industripils. Savner humlebitterhet og aroma. Lite av alt, med andre ord. Må få prøvd 5%-utgaven.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Straight from the bottle. Nutty/hazelnut aroma with a dark caramel malt. Light floral hops coming through. Taste is a touch light, but very easy drinking. Significantly better than the other Budweiser on the market.
A little sweet for a pils. Smooth, drinkable. Grassy. Seems underhopped, not enough bitterness in the finish. And the balance just doesn’t seem quite right. I’ll stick with Urquell.

On the dark side for a lager and fairly heavily carbonated. Gentle hop aroma but rather a thin palate with quite a bitter finish. Probably benefits from not being the ’other’ Budweiser. Not bad for the style.

Une Pils bien agréable !
Dorée à souhait elle fait envié des que le soleil pointe le bout de son nez. 
Dommage que le col soit fuyant. 
Arômes de d'herbe fraîchement coupée et de céréales. Le miel fait son apparition en bouche. Très bon équilibre.

Bottle. Pours a crystal clear dark golden color with a slight (and quickly disappearing) white head. Nose has some of that funk of pale lagers, and the taste has the same characteristics. A little more robust and flavorful than the average pale lager, which is nice...

Aroma: aromatic floral hop, yeast, rounded almost sweet malt reminiscent of a Golden Delicious apple.
Flavor: mild, medium sweet malt with barely noticeable bittering.
Comment: bland, short finish, lack of bittering hops. Flavor thins out quickly after initial attack. The only thing going for thins is the aroma.
Bottled; pours light gold and with smallish white head. Good crisp taste with a slight bitter aftertaste. A very drinkable pilsner.
Bottle in Prague Hilton. Pours a clean gold with some bubbly white head that recedes. Notes of hay, noble hops, sweet golden pilsner malt. Decent, much sweeter and less bitter than  Urquell.
Bottle. Fizzy golden pour. Straightforward grassy hop aroma. Relatively smooth, somewhat acidic. Decent hop hit. It works fine enough, but not the gold-standard of Czech pilsners of I was expecting.
Smells like a metallic skunk’s arse that just ate hay.  A golden yellow appearance with decent carbonation.  Taste slightly skunky, fairly carbonated.
Poured from 500mL bottle. Clear, straw yellow with minimal white head. Grassy yeast aroma.  Light pilsener with very mild sweet finish.
beautiful clear dark golden colour. hoppy aroma of grass and a little citrus. balanced, slightly bitter taste.

CRISP//FRESH//
good beer to skull tastes super clean and fresh lots of carb. beauty gold glow med white head straw grassey watery flavour in a good way a good beer to mow the lawn with.
Bottled ; Devon ; UK ; Grass and citrus aroma ; Golden color with bigger head ; Lighter sweet and medium bitter taste ; Higher carbon ; Pretty good beer.
0,5l bottle. Aroma is mostly malt and grainy, and taste is pretty much the same. It’s drinkable and refreshing beer, but nothing more than that.

Pours a light golden straw color with a finger of white fizz. The nose is full of doughy clean malts, touch of honey sweetness and a trace of floral hops. Teh palate is light and refreshing with some nice bitter noble hops riding the clean doughy body. Cant ask a pilsner to much more than this. Crushable summer beer.

Can, 50 cl. Clear golden with an ok white head. Sweet malty, slightly buscuity, sweet hoppy aroma. Flavors follows the nose, but has some distinct flowery, grassy components too. Light to medium body. Light to medium bitter finish.

11.2 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured a pale gold, clear with a little bit of white head. Aroma quite bready, yeast, grains and some malts. Taste is sweet with a little bitterness to it nice and crisp, very easy to drink and very refreshing.
Had a couple of times from bottle.  An unspectacular lager, doesn’t stand out from the crowd.
Pale gold pour with little head. Big malt smell and not much else. Taste is sweet, a little bitterness at the end but overall pretty plain. Not great, not terrible, just...ok.

Fière allure. Blonde, lumineuse et pétillante avec un collet de mousse épais, mais éphémère. Nez de céréales mouillées et de miel. En bouche, il y a quelque chose de frais et terreux avec une légère touche houblonnée en finale. Une légère acidité soutient le jeu.

Discreta lager bionda con buona schiuma, non particolarmente profumata ma con un gusto sostenuto mediamente luppolato. Corpo lieve, effervescenza piacevole, struttura acquosa; nulla di esaltante ma c’è decisamente di peggio in giro.

Très peu de mousse, blonde dorée, avec un aspect plutôt mince ; un tout petit peu de mouffette avec du houblon. Discrète au nez. En bouche, plutôt sucrée et un peu de malt, avec un brin d’amertume en finale. Au final, elle ne demeure qu’une blonde européenne sans vraiment d’envergure. Assez de saveurs, ce qui la sauve, mais sinon elle ne soulève pas les passions.

330 ml bottle, poured into a footed pilsner. ABV 5%.
Clear yellow golden colour on the body, with two fingers of snow white foam on top of it. Good retetnion, no lacing on the glass. Lots of activity in the glass.
Nice clean smell of malts, along with some hops, but it disappears after a while.
Taste is unfortunately indifferent, just a bit sweet but not much going on there, nothing shines, nothing distinguishes itself. Crisp nevertheless. 
Medium thin on the body, good carbonation. Just a bit dry on the palate.
Overall, I was expecting this to be much better, for some reason I thought it could even possibly be better than Urquell, but that’s not the case. Good for mass consumption I guess but nothing to write home for.

werry easy drinking beer. it has amber colour and white foam witch stais about 1 - 2 minutes. taste are awesome. (cesch beer lovers) it has a bit bitter and sweetnes together. and some special cesch ingridient .  worst for this beer for me is palate. after you dring beer (beer tasty) in palate stais some strange aroma

Great golden color. Drinks smooth. Tastes an smells like a regular, Bavarian-style beer, but nothing special. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Gyllene i färgen med vitt skum. Lätt söt maltton i doften med gräs och hö. brödig rakt igenom med sötare ljus malt i smaken. Lätt bitterhet på slutet.
330ml bottle. Hay, malty and herbal aromas. Pours bright gold, clear, with nice white head, vanishing, poor lacing. Taste is some sweet, hoppy, mild bitterness. Nice pilsener.
Good lager, better than the American version of Budweiser (by far).

Bottle at Penny Blacks, Birmingham.  Salty dry bitter lager with not much beyond that.  Weak aroma.  This is better than the US Budweiser - but that’s not much of a compliment as many tropical diseases are better than that. Ordinary.

Tap. Clear yellow golden with a medium good lasting and lacing white head. Aroma is dusty, dry grass, herbal noble hops and light grain. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Light body, watery/oily texture, medium carbonation. Watery finish with water and very light hops.

Bottle. Pours a clear, dark golden beer with a small white head on top. I hope that my glass is fucked up because head retention happens within seconds on this one, leaving a headless, non carbonated beer. I’m using one of my lesser glasses for this one, so I hope that that is the case. Anyway, back to the tasting. Aroma is little skunked up, some wet grassy notes, not much special. Flavour is quite bitter and heavy for a pilsener, yet quite easy drinking. Not really impressed with this beer, tough is ok for now..

Dark yellow beer, medium nice head. Nice smell of czech hops, really nice. Taste is light bitter, with some nuts notes. Hoppiness is very good in this beer. 
One of my favourite pilsener till now.
A me mi piace! La trovo veramente ottima a tavola con i sentori di luppolo zatec delicati, sia al naso che in bocca. Good.
With such a fame I had to taste it. But it seems that the fame overrun the beer since there is nothing special about it. A rather common beer.

50 cl bottle @ some terrace, Prague as ”Budejovický Budvar”. Rated on 13.07.2009

Aroma has grainy malt, some grassy hops, floral notes and butter. Flavour has some harsh malt, butter, grassy hops and hints of toffee. Nothing much, seems that I should have come to Prague earlier while I still liked Bohemian pilseners...

Several 330ml Bottles from Costco  at the bargain price of just over a tenner for 12.  Served cool in a number of glasses. Clear gold with a white head. Muted aroma of bread dough and set honey. Bready flavour, medium bodied, soft carbonation, and nothing particularly spectacular about the chewy finish, BUT...  immensely  enjoyable, despite being as familiar as your favourite T-shirt. As a working definition of an everyday beer for the working man it ticks all the boxes, particularly the " most likely to satisfy the most people" box.
500ml bottle. Golden body with a low white head. Malty, and a bit fruity with a touch of hay. Brief hop finish. Medium carbonation, soft bubbles. Light body. Quite ok.
Bottle in Dublin. Pours clear golden color with a small head. Aroma of grass and mild buttery fruits. Flavor of hay, butter and some malts. Overall Ok
Just average, really. Better than many other industrial pilsners. But no aroma, and just above average pilsner taste.

12 oz. bottle (with no mention of Budweiser on the label) pours a clear golden with quickly disappearing white head and little or no lacing.  Aroma is mostly pilsener malts with some floral hops.  Taste is sweet with a bitter but slightly metallic finish.  Body is light to medium.  A decent pilsener which surpassed my expectations.

Out of a bottle. A famous pilsner that I’ve had so many bottles of over the years. If I’m in the mood for a lager this is what I usually go for. Bready & caramel malts. Lager aroma. Quite a bit of hoppy bitterness in this. Crisp & very refreshing

Bottle 50cl. Clear deep golden coloured, snow-white creamy head. Wonderful ripe green Saaz hops in the nose. What a pitty that this beer is only pasteurized available in Germany. Must try this in Czech Republic.

Clear deep golden with medium foamy head, that disappears quite fast.
Aroma.. nose not typical to bohemian pilsener so far. sweetish hoppy kinda malty bit of corn. Spicy mouthfeel.
Medium bittersweet.
I was bit suprised, cause I thought that experience with this beer wont be good, but its quite decent.
Clear hoppy, not very intense malt, but anyway good for balance. Its very OK, if you want to grab a beer without any bad side effects, thou its bit boring, if you want to get something special
Canette de 500ml, robe blonde assez limpide, arôme de grains et d’herbe, goût très florale et herbacé.
So dead boring. I like Budweiser better and it is the bare minimum fir a lager. Not worthy to be compared to Urquell. JSJ
330ml bottle. Drank straight from the bottle. Not at all complex and tasted just like an average lager. Very carbonated and watery.

50 cl bottle.

Originally rated on 20090721.

Pours clear golden color with a small head. Aroma of grass and mild buttery fruits. Flavor of hay, butter and some malts.
Can. Sweet malty aroma. Clear gold with a moderate white head. Sweet grainy malt and grassy hops flavor. Medium body. lively carbonation. The nicest pilsener I’ve tried so far.

Served with fajitas and Springsteen. The wife had it as a cocktail with lemonade. Very exotic. I had it sandwiched between Sailor Jerry and Rioja as well, which it didn’t fare well against. Ok, prefer the other boho I had, whatever that was. Yawn.

Clear golden yellow lager with a poor white head. Budvair is not so hoppy like Pilsner Urguell. Rather malty nose. Light smooth body, well carbonized. Semibitter  but also sweet taste. Malts, hops & grains palate. Neutral finish. B@H

Golden color with almost no head, clear liquid. Aroma of  malts and some hops may be. Taste is light sweet, with medium bitterness.  Light body, thin texture, soft carbonation. Pretty nice and its cheap.

Note: This beer is labeled "Budejovicky Budvar - Czech Imported Lager" when I bought it at Market Place by Jasons (Langham Place).



Pale Gold Colour; Good head and foam, It has an apparent malty smell, with trace of hay after taste. Light bodied and watery; Unlike Urquell, its hop bitterness is almost non-existent. Very easy to mouth.



Comments: Considering this is the original Budweiser, I just can’t hide my utter disappoint that it’s nowhere near the gold standard of Pilsner Urqell. Pretty much in the same league as Stella Artois, i.e., rubbish. Its poor taste is rather close to American Budweiser. They are two of a kind! Avoid it at all cost.

This tastes more similar to Pilsner Urquell than its american cousin.  Sadly, it suffers from the same off flavors in the imported bottles as the former.  Fairly good, but I am curious if this beer benefits as much from a local pour as does Urquell.
great, although quiclkly disappearing white head, bright golden colour; hoppy bitterness with some malty sweetness. correct pilsener
The best lagers come from czech rep. And this is one of them. Great aromas of malt a d grassy hops. Light-medium body. Nice flavors of butterscotch, light malts and some hops. A great pilsner.

Bière blonde de 5 % d’alcool. Beau col au versement, elle possède un odorat sucré et rafraîchissant. Légèrement amertume en bouche, prenante en finale. Petit goût sucré, légèrement de brûlé, un peu comme de la tire. Un goût comme d’orange ou d’agrume quelconque…Sinon, rien de plus à dire, assez simple comme bière.

500ml bottle. Poured pale golden colour with medium sized head and some lacing, but dissipated quickly. Hoppy aroma with a little malt. Thin bodied like most lagers. Clean with a pleasantly bitter finish. A solid lager, but nothing remarkable.

On tap at Penzion 7, Harrachov. Pours clear gold with airy white head. Light aroma of hop. Bitter, hoppy flavour enhanced by malty sweetness. Richly carbonated. A non-aggrassive finish. A decent BP for a mass produced one.
Balanced beer with a nice golden colour and a thin white head. Aromas are malt, hops, white flowers and honey. Quite refreshing. Far better than the Americain "Bud" !
One of the classic Czechs with great bitterness and mellow flavor while being incredibly refreshing.
Bottle. I really like this one a very clean drinking pilsner. Has a nice crisp bitter finish with a good balance of malts and subtle hops, with bready tones in there too. Easy session beer

cereal, resin, citrus, herbs, leaves, golden, clear, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, thin feel, slick feel, average carbonation, bitter
A very nice pour brings golden with light white foam. Citrus and pine aroma and some earthy underlying. Nice carbonation and a thin mouthfeel. Light bitterness in the finish that lingers.  Refreshing and enjoyable.
No foam at all. Bitter aroma. Clear golden colour. Mild, watery taste and a lightly bitter palate. Don’t understand why this is so popular.
Nice hoppy, malty pilsener from the source. Crisp and clean flavor  with some citrus overtones.

50cl bottle. Pours golden with medium sized white head; dissipates quickly with little to no lacing. Aroma is pretty fresh with herbs and spices mixing in with grassy notes and bready malt. Taste is similar with light herbaceous notes combining well with the bready, biscuity malt. Light bitterness to finish. Nicely crisp and refreshing, but a slightly too thin mouthfeel. Always hits the spot when i'm in the mood for an uncomplicated but tasty pilsner.
Can from Asda, Washington. Bright golden coloured with a large white head of foam. It has a malty, toffee and grassy flavour with a delicate floral fruity finish. Good.
Bottle at the Oscar pizza place. Not bad, not memorable. Aromas of wet leaves, honey, and hay. Taste is sweet, and short lived. Palate is oily, and medium bodied. Yellow, with a head that goes away.
Postupně sem budu doplňopvat piva, co jsem vypil a zapsal si, chvilku to asi bude trvat a proto k těm dříve vypitým pivům nebudou žádné "dojmy" . Lepší Budvar, nežli Plzeň !

Bottle at home - 23/10/12.
Pours a clear pale golden, slight chill haze, with a white head that soon dissipates. Lively carbonation visible.
Yeast and malts dominate the nose, a little hops, touch of corn, some spice, fresh mountain stream water effect.
Big malt backbone in the taste, light citrus orange, barley, light grass, touch of grain.
Medium bodied with slightly prickly carbonation but typical of the style leading to a dryish finish.
Famous, drinkable, missable.
very middle of the road beer, flavorful in 1 flavor but bland in all others...strange..
Poured from 5L keg. Pours clear golden color with decent white head. Aroma is malty and hoppy. Flavor is quite malty, but also hoppy and a bit grassy. Decent, tiny bit too sweet for pilsner.

Aroma: hoppy in general (grass, floral?) little skunky (green bottle?); Appearance: golden, clear, small short living white head; Taste: medium bitterness; Palate: light body, thin feel, average carbonation, short bitter finish;
Overall: No less (nor more) than just good beer.
0.5 liters boks fra butikken. En middels lys pils fra Tsjekkia. Lite skum. Har en ganske fyldig smak til pils være. Smaker gress humle.en klar favoritt framfor norsk/dansk industriøl

Aroma of grass. Pours a small white head. Golden colour. Taste is light, slightly spicy and medium sweet. Carbonation medium. Finish abrupt. Ok.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pale gold colour frothy head. Floral hop aroma. Taste is a little bitter followed by a definate sweetness. A floral and slightly metalic taste follows all the way through. Crisp palate. A nice bohemian pilsner.

Bottled, bought in Japan. I have held off rating this for years, waiting to get it on tap in CZ, but last 2 times I was there, there were so many better-looking beers... Anyhow, here goes. Malty, bready  pils malt nose, grass, a touch of orange, cookie dough. Deep, full gold. Sweet and malty, rich flavor, lightly hopped. No skunk. Pretty decent, so it must be super fresh. Light bitterness in the finish. Not special, but solid.

From can, so cannot tell color nor foam. Aroma is bitter pilsener with some little sweet notes. Nuts also. Taste is bittersweet with again some nuts present. Decent bitter aftertaste, a good beer. (Prague 201210)

I don’t much like any beer I can see through; if temperature is the only cue I have, a glass of pale yellow is not something that draws me in. Still, it was worth trying Budvar. Green bottle poured into a Duvel tulip. Saaz hops there, smells a bit skunky but not off-putting. Good balance of malt and hops flavours, easy drinking. Budvar is a pretty decent lager and on a hot day I would gladly reach for a few, but for my regular stuff I like beer with body.

Draught.
Pale gold, white head.
Dry, light to medium body, medium bitterness, balanced CO2.
Malty taste, citrus, bread, hops, light diacetyl, honey.
(2012-09-10)
bottle. Dark gold color with almost no head. Hopy aroma and flavor, slighty bitter. Not bad but Urquell is way better
Bra pislner. Törstsläckare. Lite bitter, lite "hö". Inte speciellet spännande men helt OK.
Pours golden with a small white head.  floral hop nose, Well balanced, clean, crisp
33cl bottle. Golden color. Thin head. Low bitterness. Light hop and corn aroma. Expected better.
Light golden colour. Floral hop comes through in aroma and in flavour. Hops give a slight resin-like sweetness.

Wow, I had tried this beer in a different life, actually when visiting Czesky Budejowice - I just had to have one. But now when I try this, after having decided that I am not a lager person, how can one not love this? Lovely crisp aroma - flowery, a bit skunky, but it seems to be the Saaz hops as I am told. It goes away quite quickly, turning into a maltier nose. Beautiful coppered gold  colour with a medium white head. Flavour is crisp, some malt, some biscuits, some hops and bitterness, so well wrapped together that it’s hard to pulls them apart. Very refreshing, very pleasant. My best lager so far.
Bottle Golden body with a large white head. Aroma of bread, wheat and noble hops, balanced taste of malt and bittering hops. Good dry finish.
Nice hoppy aroma, pours golden with a frothy white head.  It has a medium bitter taste with a nice clean finish.

Ah the proper stuff. Pours clear and light with a frothy diminishing head. Slightly malty nose among the hops. Medium bodied and crisp and refreshing to taste. Well balanced and with a lingering dry bitterness. Made for warm summer afternoons.

Gylden klar skum lidt 
Malt Hummel brød 
Bitter lidt sød lidt 
tap @u medvidku

En canette 500ml, acheté à la SAQ. Blonde, mousse peu tenance mais laisse une légère couche sur les parois. Fine bulle abondante. Arôme de malt et d’herbe. En bouche, pétillante et un corps moyen. Aucun arrière goût. Douce, très rafraichissante, mais pas exceptionnelle.

Como Pilsner Urquell, otra cerveza inconfundible, puede que quizás con menos personalidad, una cerveza algo más redonda, pero suplido con un sabor muy agradable y cuidado. Te das cuenta al tomarla de que esta muy trabajada, intentando de que nada vaya al azar...en pocas cervezas sucede eso.

Nice foamy head over clear gold body. Aroma malty with a hint of grass. Taste mellow and smooth, a bit of malt of front, developing into tastes of bread and a touch of caramel. Palate is fairly bitter but takes time to show up, so at first swallow if almost feels as it there’s no palate at all. All in all smooth and very drinkable.

Clear golden color, white small head. Light body, high carbonation, medium long, dry finish. Aroma: Fresh, grassy hops,  typical for use saaz hops, lightly malty. Taste: Dry, medium bitternes, grassy, hoppy, lightly malty. Classic czech pils, refreshing, high drinkability.

0.5L bottle.  I think I’m in good company to call this one of the best lagers ever.  Bright yellow pour, clear, high carbonation.  moderate-small head, beautiful. Fresh aroma, hops.  Mouthfeel is medium-bodied, really crisp, balanced taste.  Despite the hype, I’m impressed nonetheless.
Can 500 ml. Pours clear golden-blonde with minimal white head. Lot of carbonation. Aroma and flavour : malt, yeast, crisp, slight hops. A bit thin. Nothing great, but good refreshing beer.
Pale, clear golden.  Lots of carbonation, but with minimal head.  Clean, crisp flavor.  Dry, mellow-bitter hops finish.
Softly bitter, light aroma of apples and malt. Beer is good balanced, but nothing that really stays in mind.

0,5 l bottle. An absolute classic. Pours golden to orange. Surprisingly sparkling a lot. I am also always surprised how bitter and full of hops the taste develops. I like this one, but you must be used to pilsners or lagers to enjoy it.
Pours pale gold with minimal head. Aroma is crisp malt and apple, with some sulfur. The taste is crisp and light, with pleasant subtle bitter finish. This is a benchmark pilsner.
330ml bottle- A very well made bohemian pilsener. Good balance of malt and hops.
0,33l bottle. A clear golden pilsener with white head. Soft aroma of hops. The taste is slight sweet, and the finish is lightly bitter. A good beer.
Bottle at bar. Golden color, white head. Malty taste with hint of caramel and citrus. Good lager.
Bottle@Poggio. Small head. Golden clear. Faint malts. Dry crisp. Some body. Its fame in my mind not the most interesting beer in World.
Průmerná dvanáctka. Furt výrazně lepší než stejnojmenné americké patoky, ale jinak žádná sláva.

Bottle at home ... as part of the Mass (well probably just me and Ian) online tasting ... golden yellow ... thin white head ... metalic grassy hop nose ... all i dislike in a lager nose ... sweet grassy front .. light herbal tones ... hayish ... light bitter ... really i thought this one might be better than most lagers ... but its really not me at all... well who would have thought this wasnt a rerate ...
