The nose distinctly biscuity and cracker like in that kind of dry malt way. There are notes of floral hops. The beer is a light golden with a large frothy white head. The taste is dry malt biscuits with floral hops. The beer is light medium bodied with active carbonation and a crisp dry finish. Very refreshing and great with lighter foods.
500ml bottle - not very pretty, straw coloured, headless beer. Crisp flavour, hops in there, but easily forgettable. Not a patch on their dark lager.

Bottled, 0.33l. Clear golden color, large frothy white head and lively carbonation. Aroma of barley malt with light biscuity note and stronger note of herbal and spicy hops. Tastes sweet malty, followed by refreshing, a bit bready note. This beer is pretty well balanced, aftertaste is pleasantly hoppy. Medium body, slick texture and average carbonation in palate. Czech quality...

#1
Im U Medvidku/Praha/Prague wird dieses Bier geradezu zelebriert. 5 Hekoliter Fässer schenken das einzig wahre Budweiser Budvar unpasteurisiert aus und es ist einfach unschlagbar geil!!! Buttrig-sämig im Antrunk mit herrlich rezenter Hopfennote im Abgang und ich schwöre, dass ich noch nie Kopfschmerzen davon bekommen habe ;)
Unglaublich gelungenes Lager! Das BESTE DER WELT!!!
	
Test vom 5.11.2008, Gebinde: Fass 	Noten: 15,15,15,15,-,15 - 15,00

Simply the best!

Getrunken in Prag beim U Medvidku unpasteurisiert am Geilsten Ever!
	
Test vom 7.5.2009, Gebinde: Fass 	Noten: 15,15,15,15,-,15 - 15,00

Bottle. Nice golden color with a medium white head. Warm aroma of malt, hay and cereals, with a lot of yeast. Taste is Some sweet malt-hay, with medium bitterness at the end. The yeastyness is overpowering in the taste. Medium-bodied. Well balanced beer for the everydays.
From the tap in a chilled glass, it’s probably the most moreish larger available. It looses so much from the bottle.
Sold in the UK as Budvar Budweiser its 1 of at least 3 beers with a claim on the name Budweiser. I think its my second favourite of the lot. A good standard lager from the Czech Republic.

Bottle.
Quick rating.
Golden with a white head.
Medium sweet bready malt, grassy and slightly herbal hops, quite a nice bitterness.
One of the best czech beer ever. Its my favorite one. And im from germany! Taste it!!
Bottle from sainsburys. Nice Czech lager. I’m not a big lagers fan but this is ok I think.

poured from bottle into a pilsner glass. Pours a medium gold color with a small head.

Very well balanced aromas of amber grains, biscuits and wheat tones. Nice depth as well to it.

Nice and balanced medium feel that is very complete. Extremely smooth with very good flavors of amber grains, wheat and some bits of noble hops.

What a czech pilsner is about for me. On the bigger side of a czech pilsner, but it was so utterly drinkable. This is just one of those beers that I can keep on drinking til the cows come home.
Very good premium 12° Pilsner. Strong taste of parsley. Refreshing and drinkable.
Horrible aroma, decent bitterness, but short comparing to  a premium lager. Palate holds well for a lager, refreshing. Notes of liquor, kinda sweet.

I don’t like this whatsoever. I knew before that I wasn’t a fan of the Bohemian pils because there’s something wrong with my palate and the Saaz hops... I’ve read that I’m not alone on this one, but I guess if you search for anything on the internet you’ll find it. 

Figured I’d try one of the most famous to see if I’ve just been having bad examples, but nope this one was skunked as well. Maybe it’s better in the brewery but this is what they accepted my money for, despite knowing that a light coloured bottle causes this, so this is how I’m rating it. There are many pale American lagers I’d drink over this, because at least those aren’t offensive, just boring.

Pours a turbulent strawberry blonde with a ruddy brown head. A tiny bit of lacing. Off-putting earthy aroma, accompanied by citrus and sherry. Thick boozy taste, with notes of strawberry and sour milk. Watery mouthfeel and hoppy finish.
Pours clear golden with a lively white head. Sweet malt, grass, citrus and spice. It’s very clean and crisp mouthfeel and good carbonation.

33cl bottle into glass.  Aroma is hops, turfgrasses, fresh water, and damp cool stone.  It looks like any other pilsner.  Taste is mildly bitter, but very well balanced and refreshing.  I’d say medium carbonation.  Overall, (and I hold this rating  relative to the entire lager-sphere), this is a great brew.  Be sure to gulp it down with the foam present.  I do a careless pour because the head fades quickly.  Also, a slight bit of debris tends to collect under the cap wrapper.  Be sure to wipe it off before you pour.  I really like how the Czech Republic does lager.

500 ml bottle. Pours a clear orange/gold with little head and light carbonation. Aromas of light hops, light malts, and a little honey. Crisp, clean, and bitter. Not much else. A thirst quencher for a hot day.
0,5l bottle. Clear golden color. Small white head. Malty, faint hops in aroma. Taste is pretty much same. Well balanced beer.

500ml bottle. Aroma is floral. Appearance is golden with a small white head. Taste is light bitter and sweet in the end, has a niche sweet mouthfeel and a soft carbonation. Overall a good Pilsner. (re-rated 10.08.12)
Moderate malty aroma. Small, frothy white head. Mostly lasting  longevity. Clear yellow body. Light bitter flavor. Light to medium palate.
olor a malta y cereales,al paladar bien refrescante y bien balanceada,una buena pils para veranos calientes, nada mal

500ml can in Prague with freshness date  one month after expiration date. 
Gold color light body, clean pilsner malt flavor. Slight hop flavor and bitterness. A clean and crisp light lager.

500 ml bottle. Golden color and small dissapearing head. Grassy ans maltiness taste. It’s little watery but in a good way. Very easy to drink.
I really liked it, not as black version of Budvar beer but this is also very good.

Poured from a bottle, Japan. Minimal, white head. Slight aroma. Pours a light-gold yellow. Clear, with some fizz. Not a strongly flavored beer, it’s sweet and sour, with not much left on the palate. A pleasant, refreshing beer, not really my style, though. Not a bad beer, and pretty enjoyable for a pilsner.

500ml can. Pours with medium, sudsy head. Dissipates quickly. Thin lace. Deep gold beer (Lovibond 5). Smells slightly cidery. Tastes, oddly, dusty. Even the palate is extremely dry. Fairly balanced between sweetness and hopsy bitterness. Just OK.
bread, cereal, herbs, golden, clear, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, sticky, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter, long finish,

Can 500 ml. Pours clear golden with a medium quickly diminishing white head. Good carbonation. Aroma of pilsner malt and slight hoppy notes. Taste is malt and slight hops. Vegetable aftertaste. Refreshing pilsener.
bottle was different but stated czechvar on label - grassy aroma; light pour bitter up front, but balances well with sweetness and carbonation.. ok beer

Funnily enough I’ve never tried this from a bottle. On my trip to Prague I drank several from the tap, in beautiful taverns and I have to say this is one of my favourite pilsner beers, and I must admit it’s not my favourite style of beer. It’s not worth it going into details... Just an extraordinary beer.
All I can write about this beer is: the best pilsener in the world. Ideal bitter taste. White foam, gold colour. A must-try.

Die Farbe ist hübsch, etwas kräftiger als bei einem gewöhnlichen Pils, die Schaumkrone hält einigermaßen gut. Der Geschmack macht einen qualitativ guten Eindruck besonders der Hopfen ist sehr lecker, ansonsten ist noch eine kräftige malzigkeit vertreten, auch ist es leicht herb. Ein sehr leckeres und Geschmacksintensives Bier! Fazit: Gut! 
   
Test vom 31.5.2009, Gebinde: Glasflasche  Noten: 11,13,12,13,13,13 - 12,65

In bottle; tried this in Prague years ago and was not a fan. Though now I tried it locally in bottle and it is not bad. Good standard lager, a little bitter of a finish but very good in the lager/pilsner category. I would buy again.

Bottle. Medium golden with pretty white foamy head. Smells of honey and a hint of boxwood. Lightly sweet followed by a hint of sour and faint bitterness. i actually kind of like pilseners for a lite beer. Not overly carbonated, but still lively, Not tinny or sour in the wrong way. This is actually much better than I was expecting. Bit of the sweetness lingers.

Bottle at home. Pours a clear and a bit dark straw colour with a small white head. Aromas of sweet pale malt, hay, sweet corn, saaz hops, and some fruits. The flavour don’t differ much from the aroma with hay, grass, saaz hops, and some citrus. Feels a little bit dry in the end. Has a light mouth feel and feels silky and a bit thin. A good pale lager, but maybe a bit sweet.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden color. Very small, quickly vanishing foamy white head. Nose was of vegetables and flowery hops. Flavor was crispy breads and grain, mellowing into sweeter malts and a strange taste like celery. Crisp clean finish. Not the beer I was expecting. I was disappointed.

Poured into pint glass. Only a faint covering as head. A nice clear, golden color though.

It smells like grain (barley) and a slight metallic note.

Smooth taste of malt without the sweetness, mild bitterness middle to end.

Medium and crisp body, bubbly but not too much.

Great tasting, poor appearance though.
Keg at The Stand. Golden with a white head. Fizzy too. There’s definitly a caramel malt element but the familiar pilsener hops dominate. Grassy Saaz goodness. Really crisp an delicious.

Pours hazy at first but then clear golden. Small head that dissipates quickly. Nose is dull. Bread and some off putting skunk. Might be an old bottle. Taste is sweet. Not hop bitterness to be found. Mouthfeel is crisp and clean. Not much aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can from Estonia 5%. Clear golden colour with small head. Aroma is grassy hops. Flavour is sweet malts with hoppy bitter aftertaste.

EDIT: tried from fresh bottle. Ok but dull.

Prágában ittam és emlékeim szerint jobb volt. 
Alap sárga kevés gyorsan elpucoló habbal. Száraz, csípős és élesztős illata van. Szénsavas pezseg a nyelven. Gyengén keserű van egy zavaró édeskés utóíze vége elég jellegtelen. Iható de semmi több.
A nagy legenda csak legenda.

Originally rated September 2004. Sampled from a 500ml brown bottle. Poured a golden colour with a white head, but no lacing and a fast exit. Aromas were of grassy hops with a hint of malt. Taste was a good balance of hop and malt. Had a thin mouthfeel with a smooth finish (with slight bitterness). Medium carbonation. A well balanced refreshing Czech Pilsner.Note: Recently tried again on tap at a bar, and found it quite bland. Rating reflects the bottle tasting (and 8 years ago).

Clear golden amber with a none lasting off-white head. The nose has strong skunky smell and the taste was similar. Now there is good skunky and there is bad skunky. This was the good version but I probably won't drink this one again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
might be my favorite session beer style. From a trip to Prague years ago. refreshing, light, crisp.

0,5l bottle from random supermarket, Budapest. Clear, dark golden color with medium, frothy, white head. Malty aroma, bread and hay with much spicy and grassy hops. Medium bitter taste with some malty sweetness. Light to medium body, smooth carbonation, creamy texture. Smooth hoppy finish with some grain. Classic Czech Pilsner, delicious and refreshing. As good as Pilsner Urquell.
This was a gateway beer for me. Same as Caffrey’s and Hogarden. Still has an appeal, but doesn’t have much complexity, rich flavours are thin and quickly gone.

After the beer was served in the glass there was found a lasting quantity wall adhesive white foam collar which was fine and even of structure. The beer also contained much carbonic acid in the glass. The beer has a clear golden and a very sweet taste. The after tast of the beer is hoppy bitter with a light malty touch . This beer smells very malty.

Golden color with a two finger white head that fades almost immediately to the beer with no lace at all. Aromas of faint hops. Bready malt with a slight metallic hop finish. Light crisp dry mouthfeel and good carbonation.
Pale golden with a white head. Spicy hop aroma. Sweet malty flavour. Far better than the other Bud.

500ml can.  Pours a clear pale yellow with a white head.  Mineral nose, with sweet malt, and some faint hops.  Taste is very clean, with malt, faint peach and apple, mineral notes, and a slightly bitter metallic finish.  A solid pilsener, perfect for summer, but a little light on malt.

This review was of a bottle from Tesco. It’s way better on tap - need to get myself to the Czech pub in west hampstead or even better czecho to get this reviewed properly. But for now it’s a lager with a fullish golden colour and pleasant hop aroma. Taste is quite rich and full for a pilsener, I find these Czech ones a bit better balanced than the German pils, but there’s something about Saaz hops that makes them go a bit metallic when bottled (Urquell does the same a bit) so I prefer the tap version.

500ml bottle (Green)
5% ABV
Pours a straw yellow
head dissipates quickly to a thin line with almost no lacing. Good looking subtle carbonation. Great taste, Crisp, dry. Good amount of perceived Saaz hops. I could drink this all summer long.

Pours a pale orange-yellow with moderate carbonation and a sizable but brief white head.  Crisp, grassy noble hop aroma.  Flavor is similar, with a strong presence of noble hops.  Crisp, relatively bitter, and not weighed down by malty sweetness.  A very good Czech pilsener.

Bottle poured into glass. Light orange amber, bubbly white head fades to a thin cap. Big lager grain nose, nothing exciting, but clean. Peppery, slightly bready. Definite Saaz. Dry peppery palate with fresh grassy Saaz notes and subtle biscuit malt notes. Hard to rate, because it’s still a "boring lager," but an excellent, clean, refreshing example of the style nonetheless. More than the sum of its parts.

Bouteille de 33cl. Couleur dorée, mousse correcte mais peu de tenue. Arômes de céréales, houblon bien présent proposant une belle amertume, pointe de miel en fin de bouche. Une lager plutôt goutue soutenue par une carbonnation très correcte. Trouvée à Auchan - Noyelles Godault.

Budějovický Budvar lachev 500ml from Czech Republic.Piwo jest typowe, moze nudne bo niemal kazde smakuje tak samo, chodzi o koncernowe, ale ta wersja wnosi swiezosc i tresciwosc, Orginalne Budejovickie pivo jest po prostu fajne.

Budweiser Budvar 500ml. Eksportowa wersja z marketu, jest taka sama w smaku, ale bez klimatu. Piana moze ciut mniej trwala.

Bottle. Pours a golden body, with a low white head, that diminishes pretty uickly, leaving a minimal lace. Intense herbal aroma, as soon as I open the beer, that becomes more faint afterwards.  Very nice light to medium bitter taste, with grassy and herbal notes, but with the nesessary malty backbone. Oily and smooth texture, thin to medium body, average carbonation. Probably one of the best czech pilsners, one that one can drink every time of the year. 



Old Rating : Bottle. Pours a golden body, with a average, mostly diminishing, white   head, but has a good lacing. Aroma is malty, grainy and sweet. Taste is moderate bitter, with a bitter, but a little hoppy finish. Medium Body, oily texture, and a light to medium carbonation. Pretty strong for a 5%, i think. Decent, but not that great.
Typical Czech Pilsener. Light and pale, not bitter. fine sparkling. Refreshing!!
golden with a white head - some malts in the aroma - good malt body with some hop bitterness - good
Had this beer some time ago, transferring data from  database before Januar I was using to rate beer. As I drink this again I will add a complete review.
pivo má krásnou barvu a pěnu. Lehká a příjemná vůně. Plná chuť spíše sladká než hořká. Příjemný jemný chmelový dozvuk, akurátní říz. Tady jde vidět, že i velký pivovar dokáže udělat poctivé pivo.
Aroma of sulphur, hay, grain, bread crust, floral hops. Light to medium body, medium carbonation, noble hop flavour and snap bitterness. Malty, bready taste. Clean aftertaste. Nice pilsner, not more
Can. Clear light copper colour with a thin white head. Aroma is slightly sweet malt with some hops. Lightly sweet and a little bitter taste. Medium body. Nice typical Bohemian pilsner.
Yellowish with a thin and quickly fading white fizz of a head. A bit thin and watery, perhaps a bit skunky, with a crisp finish that holds a touch of hops.

11.2 oz bottle poured into a pint glass. The other Budweiser.

Smell is totally skunked from the green bottle but once that fades, there is some bready grain and grassy hops typical of pilseners.

Taste is hay and grassy hops along with a little bit of bread. There is a pine note toward the finish as well. Bitterness is moderate throughout and everything cleans up nicely at the end leading to a crisp dry finish.

Overall this is a pretty nice beer and one of my favorite Czech Pilseners. Would be an awesome thirst quencher on a hot day.
Finest lager in the Budweiser name.  Great pils aroma supplemented by a full flavour.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours golden with a white head. Sweet malt with a nice slightly hoppy bitterness. Very pleasant, and drinkable, but the bottled version is far from the tankova version I drank in Prague. In fact it’s a bit hard to believe it’s the same beer. It’s still a nice beer, but not an exceptional one.
Not really understandable the correspondance in name with its american homonyme...
Pours yellow with a quickly disappearing head. Aroma is sweet malt with saaz hops. Taste is also sweet malt with a hefty dose of saaz hops creating a dry bitter finish. Quite a nice pilsner.

On tap at Carter’s Bar. Pours golden with a small head which then disappears. The nose has gentle pale malt with a lemon note on the end. The taste has more of the same. The palate has a decent body with a dry hoppy finish, though perhaps getting towards astringent. Overall, I’ve had this in bottle and it was better then - I need to re-rate.

This is a good solid pilsener.  I would say better than Plzeňský Prazdroj.  My rating is based on many bottles of this.  Watch out for the green bottle.  It will give you various skunky flavors if not fresh an kept in the dark, (you never know when you buy it).  If you get a good bottle this is the best everyday lager you can find.  If you get a bad one, keep looking for a fresher bottle.  You will be rewarded with a mighty fine pilsener.  US Budweiser isn’t even close. na vaše zdraví.

One of the world’s greats!  The real "Budweiser" and not the STL swill!
Crisp, delicious, clean and Czech!  What more is there, really!
Been enjoying for years.  Prefer the .5L bottle - less trips to the fridge that way.  Oops!  Gotta get another!  Prosit!
Pour une lager, je ne m’attendais pas à ce goût.  Un équilibre presque parfait.  Pas trop d’amertume, pas insipide non plus.  Une surprise.
Golden beer with an ok head.hops,grass,corn,peak.Light bitter.dry ballanced feeling.bittersweet finishing.

Green bottle, 330 ml, savoured December 13 2011; eye: golden, clear, average effervescence, white head that turns into a tiny ring, no lacing; nose: hops, malt, slight caramel; mouth: hops, malt, slight caramel, finale in hops with light presence of malt, medium body, good carbonation, lightly bitter, slightly sweet, slick texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille verte, 330 ml, savourée le 13 décembre 2011; œil : dorée, limpide, effervescence moyenne, mousse blanche qui se transforme en un petit anneau, pas de dentelle; nez : houblon, malt, très léger caramel; bouche : houblon, malt, très léger caramel, finale en houblon avec légère présence de malt, corps moyen, bonne carbonatation, légèrement amère, très légèrement sucrée, texture coulante; en résumé : bien
Supposedly the best beer in the Czech Republic. I somehow doubt it considering I bought it at an American grocery superstore. Still, it is very very good.

The "original" Budweiser, coming from the south Bohemian down of "Ceske Budejovice", which translates to "Bohmisches Budwar" in German.  The philosophy of this pilsner is purposely different than of Pilsner Urquell’s, the aim being to create a sweet, light and creamy (almost ale-like!) brew.  Unfiltered at the "Masne Kramy" right from the tank is a historic tasting experience.

Golden with a medium head. average carbonization and a full body. Very intensive smell of fruits and hops. Nice taste of cassis and other fruits. a bit malty, decent bitterness at the end. a good one!

Drank from tap and bottle many times both here in Australia and the Czech rep. It has a clear honey/light goldenrod colour with a lovely dense packed foam. it sports an incredibly floral nose and slightly biscuity too. Its taste and flavour is soft and slightly sweet with a nice bitter backbone and finish, it leaves the palate lightly bitter however always morish...Great beer one of the best mass produced lagers available.
Pale golden with a thick white head. Malty with fruity notes. malt, hops and fruit. Medium body with a short, dry finish.

On draft at Mommseneck-Am Potsdamer Platz.  Clear, golden-yellow body.  Thick, fluffy white head is lasting and lacy.  Spicy noble hop aroma - classic Saaz.  Light, sweet malt underneath is bready with some cracker.  Malt dominates in the flavor - hop profile seems muddled.  Almost candyish malt sweetness.  Medium-full body with average carb.  Fairly crisp finish.  Good Bohemian Pils, but not as great as I had hoped.
Hoppy-barley aroma and flavor. Excellent taste, great czech lager. Really great, one of my favorites.

Czech Budweiser has a thick, white head and a clear, yellow-golden appearance with some bubbles and lace present. The aroma is of lightly toasted barley malt and clean water. Taste is of cracker, toasted malt, and some hop bitterness for balancing purposes. Mouthfeel is light and watery, and the Czech Budweiser finishes crisp, clean, refreshing, and dry. Overall, this is not like the American Budweiser, but it is very good in its own way.
A little of the classic czech style hops. Needless to say this is loads better than the rip off budweiser, but not a wonderful beer otherwise.  Just alright..

(Flasche in Glas) Optisch ist es ein klarfiltriertes Bier mit einem kräftigen Gelb und weißer Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist süßlich mit einer zitrusartigen Hopfennote.Der Geschmack ist prickelnd und schlank. Ebenso schlank ist die Bittere, die etwas auf der Zunge hängen bleibt.

Aroma: Difficult to detect. Perhaps some honey notes.



Appearance: Light orange, virtually no head. Medium carbonation. 



Taste: Sweet malt flavour. Clean, fresh taste. 



Palate: Thin body. 



Overall: An excellent lager. Certainly the better of the two ’Budweiser’ companies.

golden yellow with a moderate white foamy head. slight citrus aroma.  slightly hoppy with a decent amount of malt. very sessionable.  have only had in the bottle, would like to taste on tap in the Czech Republic to see how it goes down fresh.
The real King of beers. Bottle and on tap. Yellow colour with a white head. Some sweet malt and moderate hoppy. Flavour are about the same. Very mild and tasty lager at the same time. Almost perfect!

Tasted from bottle into pilsner glass. Poured a brilliant golden-amber color with creamy white foam, somewhat lasting, little lace. Aromas of grain and noble hops. Mild malt sweetness with pronounced hops bitterness. Light-medium body and silky mouthfeel, very neutral, dry finish. Very drinkable. Whaddya know? Tastes like a Budweiser should: noticeable hops, elevated color, flavor and body, no cheap adjunct off-tastes, not watery and metallic, less intense carbonation.
Bottle, Pours golden with small head. A: malty, grass, bread. T: lightly bitter. P:  light body, average carbonation,

Grainy scent with golden color that’s darker than many pilseners. Slightly sweet and bitter, but a little flatter than I’d prefer. Lacking in aftertaste. Chased by an Urquell for contrast, found Czechvar to be more German.
Pale yellow pour.  Clear with little head or carbonation.  Aroma of cereal.  Slightly sweet flavor with cereal and bread.  Fruity, maybe strawberry or bubblegum.  Bitter crisp finish.
Bottle 33cl. Golden with white, small and persistent head. Aroma is malty, sweet, fresh grass, cereal. Taste is moderate bitter, with light body and average carbonation. Bittery finish.
May be one of the best lagers in the world but it’s still a lager. On the plus side, the Czech bar where I drank it was awesome.

Better than most European mass market lagers.  11.2 oz. to a German souvenir beer glass.  Pours golden with small white head.  Floral hops and some skunk.  Very smooth, slightly sweet with a bite in the finish.  Has the other Budweiser beat all to hell.
Can 50 cl, bought in Croatia. Probably the best lager in the world. Lots of aroma, lots of taste, lots of beer. I like it very much.

I am definitely biased, but I really do think this is an amazing lager! It was my beer of choice when studying abroad in Prague, and we frequented one of the brewpubs regularly. Great when paired with wild boar!

Bottle. I’m probably a heretic for saying this but if it has to be drainpour it might as well be bud. At least it doesn’t offend. And why the hell do they insist on putting beer in glass bottles. Skunks it every time. Pours pale pale yellow with a big skunky corn thing on the nose. Slightly metallic taste blending with the corn. I can’t wait to pour this down the drain. Awful!
Draught. Golden colour, minimal head. Aroma of malts, grains, light metallic. Taste is nicely balanced malts and bitter, full for a lager. Nice beer, very refreshing.
Clear golden with medium sized white head. Malty and slightly hoppy aroma. Good easy drinkable lagerbeer.

Poured a clear golden color.  Medium head.  Small aroma of some fresh grains and light hops.   Light sweetness, light bitter.  Light body, slick texture.  Ave carbonation.  Clean, crisp, refreshing mild beer.  Easy drinking.  Not much flavors.

Bottle: pours a clear gold with a white head that slowly dissipates with little  lacing. It smells, and tastes sweet - too sweet for my tastes. I enjoyed the beer but found it to be slightly overrated. Definitely the better budweiser though.

I drank a big bottle of this while walking home from the store in the pouring rain. An aura of melancholy hung in the air as I walked through the downpour, pondering the depressive nature of human existance. The rain doesn’t bother me at all, it is a welcome companion to the empty, hollow echo of my dead soul. I cracked open the Czechvar without a care. It smelled mildly floral and hoppy. I chugged this brew as I stalked the night like a creeping vagrant, invigorated by the Saazy Saaz and clean, soft finish of this classic brew. Nobody does Pilseners like the Czechs! It was at this time that I was approached by a ghostly old sea-hag. She started to gurgle and shake, and with a thunderous gut-rumble, she started to spray coocoons out of her abysmal, hollow eye sockets. Fortunately I had this bottle of Czechvar which served as an effective weapon. I cut that bitch to peices.

Bottle:
Medium white head on top of a clear yellow colored beer.
Smell skunky hops, some malts and something light toasted.
Taste malts, some hops, herbs, grass and grains. Low bitterness.
Malty low bitter aftertaste.
Low carbo, soft mouthfeel, low to medium body and a watery texture.
Pretty soft in taste and soft mixed beer.

Pours golden yellow with little to no head. Smells like yeast with an underlying layer of hops. Taste is slightly bitter and a bit watery. Nothing special about this beer, but it’s one that would be considered sessional, or nice on a hot day. Not really my style, but it’s not awful.

Tasted 9/3/11. 330ml bottle. Best Before 01.18.12. Pours filtered with a bright golden hue. Layer of white head. Aromas of sweet cereal grains and a mild grassy hops. Medium bodied with a bright effervescence and a dry finish. Mildly cloying flavor, but the subtle hop nuance and the carbonation both dry it out. Solid example!
Bottle at Dæmningen 37 - Thanks. Clear golden - white head. Ok hoppy. Nice medium Bitterness. White bread. Grassy. Light malty. Nice.

Brown bottle. Pours a blonde colour with a thin white head. Aroma and flavours of caramel and yeast. Nice crisp finish with lingering caramel. Mild bitterness and carbonation with a little CO2 prickle. Nice enough.
Bottle. Pours pale amber, with a light head. Aroma is caramel malt, flowers and spicy hops. Flavour is dominated by caramel malt, but with a nice zesty bitterness balancing the beer.
Bright golden color, with a medium head. Crisp and refreshing. Not too strong, but not totally flavorless, either.
Bottle at the Mets Game.  Nice and refreshing for a baseball game.  Golden lager that tastes of hay, grain, grass, herbs.  Not too shabby

Tried this back to back in a blind test with Pilsener Urquell. They look almost identical. This has a bit more aroma, and is definitely sweeter vs. the more bitter hoppy urquell. Overall, not too bad.
Bottle at Cafe Buitenlust, shared with DutchDrebus. Pretty standard pilsener, decent but not that different from other pilseners.

Clear, pale yellow body a small, white, disappointingly short-lived head, fair lacing. The nose is clean, with malty, caramel notes and hoppy, citric elements. Medium sweet taste, with a light to medium bitter finish. Long, clean, light bitter aftertaste. Medium to lively carbonation, light to medium body, almost oily texture. Almost as nice as the Urquell, but both the malty and the hoppy notes are a bit more subdued. 

[50 cl can, from ICA Hasle, Oslo]
12oz bottle thanks to my uncle George. Palish yellow color, decent white head. little lacing. Typical skunky aroma. Exactly like heineken, slightly less carbonated.
500ml bottle as Czechvar. Golden lager colour. Went down very smooth, light body without becoming watery.

0.5L bottle. Right after opening a massive hit of skunky hops, strong herbal nose. Pours clear gold, with big head quickly reducing. Nose of herbs, very bitter foam. Intense bitterness from the beginning. Bready notes, lots of straw and herbs, grassy hop. Medium body, fizzy carbonation, long bitter finish. Reminds me of Staropramen and Urquell, my bad i didn’t allow to chill properly, colder would have been better i think. Classic and good Czech bohemian.


2013 update - On tap at a pub near Bratislava: the same, carbonated, big white head with a nice lacework (A: +1)


2015 update - On tap at Funus, Bratislava: Gold color clear avg white head. Fresh nose. Aroma is floral, light pilsener malts, white bread, gentle hops. Balanced taste soft bitterness. Light body average carb. Solid svetle higly sessionable.  6 3 6 4 13 = 3.2

Pours deep golden, absolutely clear, but with little head.  Nose is somewhat classic "beer", meaning barley, cereal, wet hay, and touch of sour mash. Aroma is not super pronounced, but nice. Taste is clean, with just right bitterness of hops. Refreshing. Finish is lingering with sweet notes of subtle caramel among the hops and malt. Almost a perfect example of what a Lager should be.
Great example of the type! Excellent pilsner bite right in the middle, goes down great.
Pours golden amber. Nose is stray, dry grass, caramel malt and bread. Taste is grassy hops, caramel malt and bitter dry hop finish. Body is quite thin and watery. Good flavoursome lager.
Poured clear, with a golden yellow color and a white, lacing head. Aroma of straw, hay, malts, hints of caramel and hops. Fairly dry, somewhat bitter finish. Good.

Beginning taste is very bitter than comes the nice smooth citrus and it finishes with a nice very bitter taste.

Slightly less bitter than Pilsner Urquell due to the use of citrus.
Super balanced  though between bitter and sweet and thus easily my favourite czech beer.

tap at some hole in the wall bar in prague.    locals standing around chugging budvar, watching 2 on 2 women’s beach volleyball.    solid bohemian pilsner fresh on tap.   would prefer a tad more hop character.   but a fresh, toasted , cracker and light bright dough malt backing makes this both enjoyable and sessionable.

Pours deep gold with a small head that quickly fades to nothing.
Nose shows uber grassy/skunky hops at first. After this fades, loads of bready malt becomes apparent... craploads.
Similar flavours: bready, grainy malt, honey, and grassy, spicy hops.
Could use a bit more carbonation.

Le liquide a une robe dorée qui se présente avec une petite tête mousseuse.  Les arômes et les saveurs combinent des céréales douces avec des effluves de houblons.  Très peu impressionnant : manque de fraîcheur?  La bouche est tout de même agréable, davantage moyenne de mince avec un pétillement régulier mais modéré et une texture qui n’est jamais légère.  La finale permet une expression grandement timide des houblons.  En résumé, je comprends pourquoi cette bière marque des points.
Bottle. Pours golden with a white head that disappears rather fast. Smells like a normal pilsener. Fruity cereal roasty and caramel malts with a slight metallic finish. Good!

Golden, see through body with small head. Fizzy but still very little aroma. Cereal, soapy, fresh herbs. Taste is really quite bitter and a little metallic. Fairly good for a mass produced pilsner, but nothing more. (33cl bottle)
This is my favorite pilsener so far. Taste is just a bit better than other pilseners.

a good solid beer, not my favorite style of beer but its really good. Nice looking beer poured from a bottle into a glass. Quick foam that disappears rather quickly, but leaves a nice lace. Smell is crisp. Taste has a hint of hops sweetness.

Hot summer’s day in Texas (100+), wanted something really refreshing, but not boring. Warm golden hue. Snappy hops at the front, not too lingering.  Full and sweet malt flavor. Hops drop back in for the finish, but not too dry.  This is a clean malty lager that that makes me understand what many others are trying to do.

Aroma: grassy straw, bread, clean, crisp, typical pils.
Appearance: golden colour, medium white head, lacing. 
Flavour: grass, straw, hay, bread, clean, crisp.
Mouthfeel: average.
Total: very good pils, it’s just that I seem to have outgrown the style.
Clear gold with  lots of bubbles cascading up.  Aroma nice sweet saaz corn mix slight floral notes.  FLavor bit dry nice saaz earthy hops, nice medium mouthfeel.  Overall really nice beer.

Bottle. Golden clear, thick white head. Smells of grass, herbs and malts. Taste is malty, too malty for my taste and way too much sweetness. Also some dryness. Finish also miss some edge even though i find bitterness and hops. Way overrated,

Bottle. Clear golden pour with a good white head. Head quickly turns into a small foam. Hints of bread, honey, hay and hops in the aroma. Same hints in the taste. Pleasant hop finish with a bitter aftertaste. This is indeed a good pilsener.

Mild hopfiger, etwas blumiger Antrunk, sehr süffig, wenig herb. Die blumige Hopfennote nimmt dehnt sich aus, die anderen Aromen weichen dagegen etwas zurück. Die Herbe ist noch untertönig bemerkbar und leitet das Bier von hier aus sogar, im Vordergrund steht aber der Hopfen. Dieser wird allerdings zum Ende selbst etwas schwächer und wird durch die Herbe, gefolgt von seichter, fast etwas rupper Malzigkeit aufgefangen. Ausbalanciertes und milder böhmisches Pils. 11/11/12/11/10/11

Clear golden colour, white head. Malty aroma, slight bitterness, bit of Saaz peeping through. Flavour a bit sweet, malty, slight hops bitterness. Lower carbonation makes it more smooth. Quite nice, balanced and more mellow than I remember it from many years ago when I was in the Czech republic. Guess I liked it more back then.
(draught)
I had a bottle of this while we were in Iceland.  Very nicely balanced.  It reminded me of a classic pilsner.  Very clean tasting.

Relativ mild-hopig und malziger Geruch. Sanft malziger Start mit hopfig-blumigen Einspielungen. Leicht röstmalziger Abgang. 
Gutes Bier. Test vom 2.11.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche

Very clear golden yellow with a snow white head. The aroma is a sweet, but quite clean malt aroma. Light and crisp pils flavors. Sweet malts with decent activity. Not real hoppy, but a mild grassy hop on the finish. Nice clean beer.
Bottle 50 cl. Golden pour with a medium white head. Aroma and taste of easy melt and hops. The finish is lightly bitter hops.
Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - grass. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Finishes light bitter. Soft and nicely balanced. 160410

Bottle purchased up in DC.  I assume we get this around here, but I don’t usually see it in my local store and forget about it... but it seemed really tasty when I saw it and I haven’t had it in years.  Memories of liking it in Europe 15 years ago...  so... pours clear golden with bubbly white head dying down... not much to look at.  Nose is sweet light malts and grassy/floral hops.  Seems on the maltier side of a pils.  Quite simple but very refreshing.

Bottle @ home. Clear, straw yellow appearance with a foamy off white head. Bitter, Czech hoppy, pale malty lager nose with a touch of spiciness. Clean, crisp, Czech hoppy, bitter, hay, straw, pale malty flavor. Crisp finish with a mildly bitter, hoppy finish.
Noble hop aroma, slightly skunky.  Pilsner malt on the palate with a subtle hop presence in the background.
500 ml bottle a golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts water and hops flavor malts water hops and a bitter hoppy finish
Pours a bright golden color with a white head. The aroma is grassy with some nice tones of barley. Taste is well balanced malts and hops. Good beer

(Draught at Surjämten, Duved, Sweden, 22 March 2011) Golden colour with brief, white head. Malty, bready nose with grain, white bread, toffee, butter, hints of citrus and grassy hops. Malty, grassy taste with notes of bread, slightly toasty grain, hay and a generous grassy bitterness in the finish. Medium body, with balanced sweetness. Solid and well made Bohemian pilsener, quite nice.
Awesome pils. Drinkability is great . Not overly complex. Good malt character throughout. Great on a hot day
Pours golden with a white head.Aroma is malt, light butterscotch, light dms and grassy hop. Flavour is malt, light butterscotch and grassy hop.

U Medvídků, Prága. Áttetsző, közepesen sötét arany szín, tetején hófehér, kitartó habkorona, főleg csapolva egész jól mutat. Illata rendben van, jó malátás-szalmás, friss. Ízében is finom maláta mellé bejön a füves keserű komló, megvan a kellő harmónia. Egyszerű, letisztult ízek, frissítő szénsavasság és szárazság. Csapolva az igazi.

0,5 l. can from the supermarket. Very clear golden yellow with a snow white head. The aroma is a sweet, but quite clean malt aroma. Light and crisp pils flavors. Sweet malts with a lively palate. Not real hoppy, but a mild grassy hop on the finish. Nice clean beer. However I prefer the Pilsener Urquell. A bit more edgy...

Bottle. Clear gold body with an average sized dense white head. Moderate to high carbonation. Aroma-taste: Herbal, spicey hops with a bread-biscuit from the malt. Sweetish hint. Light to medium bodied with a long taste. Nice.
Crystal gold translucence with a short-lived fizzy head. Smell is sweet and musty. Flavor is nicely bittered and crisp. Easy to drink and refreshing if cold enough.

Sampled in Bratislava on-tap (Pint) - Clear & medium amber in appearance. Formed a nice creamy head with good retention. Not unlike a lot of pale lagers/pilseners with nice a grassy grain aroma & corn mixed in the the faintest spicy and citrus like smells. A rather sweet like corn taste and again some grassy grains mixed to for a easily drinkable pint with some malts and a mild lemon flavour. A nice light & refreshing beer that is pretty crisp & smooth to boot. A nice tang that tickles the tongue & very drinkable as a session beer.       A very nice pint indeed and especially good when compared with the draught lagers I am used to back home. Easy to drink & very refreshing - - - -
Golden yellow with a soapy white head. This had a crisp, hoppy flavor that was well balanced. Very good beer.
Jaune doré limpide, fine effervescence.  Arôme de céréales et de poivre.  Rafraîchissante et satisfaisante.
2011 - 02 - 25 500ml green bottle. yellow clear colour. dmall fading white head. low in carbonation. taste is stale pilsener.
Very balanced, hoppy lager that stands above most others.  Only downside is, like many others have said, it tastes as it its been aged in bottle and lagers don’t age well (normally).

Bottle from Whole Foods Market P Street, DC. Best by 07/30/11. Pours a clear golden amber color with a medium creamy head. Decent head retention and lacing. Thankfully the green bottle didn’t skunk up the beer too badly, but there is a bit of skunkiness there. Sweet bready notes, apple and faint noble hops. The taste is grassy hops, dry toasted malts, bitter finish. Thin bodied. Decent balance. Not too bad.

Pours golden and clear with a nice frothy head. Aroma is of decent strength and hoppy. Taste of saaz hops, dry with medium bitterness to the finish. Palate is medium carbonation and light bodied. Decent pilsner
33cl bottle. Low Co2, dark gold colour, very quickly disappearing foam, sweet taste and very light hop (for a pils!). Grassy aftertaste. Its fame is better than this beer.

Slight barnyard aroma finishing with sweat malt. Fresh and crisp in the mouth finishing quite dry and slightly bitter with a taste of biscuity malt. overall a nice pilsner atyle beer :) ps. No skunk even though in a green bottle

Czechvar, 500 ml green bottle. Bright clear golden with a frothy white head. Nice floral spicy herbal Saaz hop aroma and taste, light sweet  malts. Average carbonation, light bodied, moderately hopped.  Clean crisp and refreshing. No industrial swill here, this is the real deal. LF (Lagerboy Friendly)
I got a semi-skunky bottle of this so it is hard to rate, but it seems like a middle of the road Czech pils.

Keg (Bayern Keller Böhmen)

4+ Very bland aroma, just a touch of plasticky malts.

2+ Pale, clear and basically fizzy. Started with a huge fluffy head.

5- Again, superbland taste, matches the aroma well. At least this was served at about 11-12C, so the taste was given a chance to show itself. Some slight plasticity to the malts.

2+ Refreshing palate, crisp carbonation. Given the temperature this was served at, the palate was also soft, so you could savour it or glug it and  you wouldn’t end  up with an ice-cream headache. Finish gently hinting at classic plasticky malts and noble hops. Nearly gave it 3, but that would have been charity.

9 Nothing wrong with this. Essentially flawless. But practically flavourless compared to the ales that I love. This would be so much better unfiltered , and even better unpasteurised. Quite why people are giving this above average scores I will never understand. Quite simply, I don’t believe they’ve ever had a good lager, and are mindlessly following the multinational hype. Most over-rated beer ever?

Appearance :pale, hazy, sparkling, rocky head, white foam, 
Taste :light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
The palate: medium body, oily feel, sticky, slick feel, thick feel, average carbonation, bitter, 
Aroma:bread, nuts, Yeast, leather, earthy, Hops, raisin, soy sauce, smoke, vanilla, 
kosher
www.original-budweiser.cz
Very little flavour to this one, nothing special, I would have again only if it were free, nothing great

Floral presence of quality hops. Complex malty taste, with subtle hints of honey; perhaps even caramel. It needs a slow, patient drink. Ive chosen it in many a fine restaurant to sip slowly with really good cuisine (something which raised quite a few eyebrows among some of my wine-loving friends!).In over twenty years, Ive never experienced a drop in quality. To fully experience its quality, you have to drink it in comparison with a glass of American Budweiser. The difference is like night and day!

It’s a light golden beer with a short lived white head and no lacing (no surprises).  Of course for the style it’s good, with a fresh nose of grassy, lemony hops and a slight note of honey.  In the mouth it’s much the same; here the lemon character develops and is met with subdued malts to make a clean, drinkable and thankfully dry pilsener.  Finishes exactly how you’d expect it to, managing to steer clear of the sweaty aroma so common to so many beers in the style.  That said, it’s nothing to get excited about.

Se devo bere una pilsner qualsiasi, allora opto sempre e decisamente per questa ceka, che non mi tradisce mai anche se ormai la vendono anche in latteria. Almeno a differenza di tante altre ha una sua fisionomia a e bel gusto...
Can. Clear golden with small white head. Flavour is malt, hops and slightly bitter.
Bottle in restaurant. Nice head, but swiftly disappears. Bitter, but not overly. Nice cereal characteristics.
Bottled. This one is epic. Golden color, lovely head, Žatec hops, barney malt. Kind of a typical Czech beer you must love if you love beer.
Draft.  Clear golden pour, white head.  Grainy malt, grassy hops, and interestingly some light smoke.  For what it is I actually enjoyed this beer.

A great Bohemian Pilsner very tasty, quaffable, and distinctive in it’s hops aroma. Taste is refreshing I prefer Urquel slighly more with it’s malty backbone coming through but this is a classic none the less.  If you want a beer that drinks easy and is tasty this is a great one.

0.5l box. Pours a golden bronze body body with a white little head. Nose is citrus with hints of caramel and brown sugar (actually reminds me some what of Leffe Blond). Strong carbonation - like a Czech lager should have. First taste the malt, then the grassy hops kicks inn, perhaps a bit wattery in the end. A great lager but no Urquell.
Refreshing lager which tastes of hay and grass.  Light bodied with average carbonation.

Poured from tankovina at brewpub in Prague. Pale straw with little head. Aroma of grass and citrus. Taste is sour, malty, and slightly sweet. Crisp and bright and great representative of the style. Its not special but it sure is good.

Pours clear light straw yellow.  Big bubbly head bubbles and dies.  Biscuity malts face off against grassy/floral noble hops.  I might be drinking it a little warm, but to me, the malts are winning too much for this to be a proper pilsner.  Finish is mostly sweet/malt.  I was looking forward to a lot more hop character, but its not there.  Too bad.

0.5l Bottle.  Pours light golden yellow with little head.  Aroma is sweet malt.  Taste is predominantly the sweet malt with spruce and grass flavors.  Hops are very weak to non-existent, which is disappointing for a supposed Pilsner.  Finishing is dry with a sugar sweetness.
Bottle. Smooth pour - almost no carbonation off th bottom of the glass. No head, no lacing. Sugar, hops, citrus, grass - refreshing. Not amazing.

Bottle.  Pours amber with average white head.  Aromas of toasted malts, grass and hops.  Taste is light and slighty sweet but ends with a mild bitter finish.  Overall I found it to be well balanced but weak in flavouring.

Lucent gold, thin white head, watery medium body, medium-high carbonation.



Aroma: light-struck, lots of sweet malt, some noble bittering hops.



Taste: sweet pale malts, noble hops, some buttery diacetyl, and skunk.



Might be pretty good fresh, but seriously, 700 years of brewing experience and they won’t use brown bottles -asinine!

Bottle served in a lager glass. Pours watery gold in color with a medium sized white head that holds for a bit than vanishes. Spotty lacing. Skunky then changes notes of grass, pepper, pine pitch, and sweet pale malt. Soft delivery and a slight sweet and bitter flavor. Mild carbonation, light body, thin texture. Finishes crisp and dry, yet there’s a bitterness that sticks. Great beer. Yeah Budweiser!

Pours a a nice pale yellow with a head that quickly dissapears. Aroma of hops, caramel, with some subtle floral notes in the background. Fairly full bodied taste that builds up to a refreshing bitter-hoppy finish. Some wateryness keeps it from being an excellent beer, but as far as lagers go, this is a good one.
Bottle. Very pale yellow pour with weak white head. Spicy hoppiness and cool herbal finish. Nothing to write home about but nice and refreshing.
Megbízható kis serecske. Mindig hozza a formáját. Asszem a legjobb hermelín mellé fogyasztani:)

Certainly a go-to pilsener.

50cl bottle. Pours a golden color with medium bubblt head. Yeast and hops in the nose, although the yeast is less prevalent in the taste, which is primarily hops

Bottle. A well-toned pale yellow-orange body with what seems to be a great deal of carbonation shows off in my flute glass, crowned with a small, medium-lasting foamy head with small bubbles. Aroma is grassy hops and smooth pale malts, with a hint of cooked vegetables. Taste is refreshing, with a lively palate that distributes tones of grains, pale malts and hints of wet grass all over the place. Very well balanced; neither malts, grains of hops get a higher ground and all the flavors are properly integrated. Still, it lacks the little extra special touch which would compel me to rate the original Budweiser really high. Moreover, I think there are limits to how good you can actually make a lager; at least I haven’t been convinced yet. A nice beer, though.

50 cl bottle. Pours yellow/golden colour, decent white foamy head. Bready/hoppy nose with hints of grassiness. Flavour is quite hoppy with huge peak after a few seconds, the finish is quite "vegetably". Bittersweet aftertaste and leaves the mouth a bit sticky.

33cl bottle.
Little white foam.  Clear golden colour.  Probably my favourite Czech Pils.
Golden with a white head, nose was grass and citrus notes. Gentle sweetness up front, but delicately bitter aftertaste. Very refreshing Czech lager.

Bottle pours golden with big foamy white head. Aroma has nice pilsener skunk, grain, malt, and hops. Taste is crisp and refreshing nice mellow sweetness of grain, malts, and hops. An excellent Bohemian Pilsener!

Pours an absolutely beautiful champagne peach color...  very inviting.  Skunky aroma right off the bat but that thankfully dissipated immediately to a musky earthy aroma with some cereal notes mixed in.  Dry on the palate with a malty tones and slight medicinal hops aftertaste.  Overall, this is a rather tasty brew.

I just had the 12-ounce bottle Czechvar version (US) at the Czech Museum here in Houston; and this isn’t the beer that will make me go out of my way for a pilsner. It has the classic nose, right enough: the aroma of tart apples, sweet malt and herbs, even a little better. So that was refreshing. But the taste was much as usual with even a good Euro-pils, rather watery and ho-hum. I have had the original in Czech-land along with many other, better pivos. Also, in this catered event, the value ($5/bottle) did not impress.
Had this as Czechvar in the US and Budweiser Budvar in Prague. This is a great lager. Recommended. Serving: Bottle and Tap

Can.Pours clear golden with a fast dissipating white head.Aroma of yellow apples,bready sweet malt and herbs.Flavor is a slight hint of caramel with some sweet malt, generic fruitiness and hay.Dry finish,low bitterness,average carbonation.Ok pilsner, not the best in the world though.

Bottle @ Home

Surprised that this has gone unrated so far, time to make amends!

Unlike the American pretender swill, the real Budweiser is a refreshing and enjoable brew. Pours a light gold with a medium head. There are strong yeast notes on the nose, with some grain and hops in the background. The flavour is refreshingly crisp with the right amount of bitterness to it. A thoroughly enjoyable lager.

On tap at Hogan’s in Dublin, Ireland.  Had to try this somewhere, they had it bottled and on tap at a few places.  Not a Budweiser fan, but our host kept telling me that it was where Budweiser got the idea for their beer (or something to that effect).  It was pretty much what I was expecting, which isn’t much.  Thin, crisp, not much flavor.  Probably a little too sweet, but mostly kinda flavorless and watery.

Bottle/11/2oz - US version.  Pours a straw yellow in color with a small white head and very little carbonation.  Aroma is of malty grains, grassy hops and more than a bot of skunk.  I can’t figure out why brewers use green and clear bottles... this one is green. Flavor was much different (better) than I expected.  Malty grains dominate initially and produce a but of sweetness.  The mild hops kick in to round it out with a lingering bitterness.  Fortunately it does not taste as skunky as it smelled.  A pretty good beer actually.  I would definitely like to taste this on tap or, better yet, closer to the source.

Nice amber/gold color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of malt, hops, & grain; Flavor of malt, hops, grain, and light citrus; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; The original Bud - solid pilsner.
Bottle 33cl. A clear yellow beer with good head. Aroma is typically on lager, bit sweet, quite hopy, less round than the Urquell one, nice anyway.

Clear, yellow - not much head.  Green bottle gives way to slightly skunky aroma.  Taste is better than the smell - some malt and almost light fruit flavor.  Actually fairly decent given the green bottle import.
500ml bottle.  Pours golden with no head.  Aroma is floral and grass.  A little bland to start.  Crisp, hoppy bitter finish.  Good feel in the mouth.

Bottle. Pours golden with a medium head. Aroma is very hoppy and floral. Mouthfeel is creamy. The taste is well balanced. Re-rate: perhaps my palate has evolved, but I don’t find it so fulfilling anymore. It appears to be lighter than I remember.

Tükrös aranyszínű, habja közepes és nem marad meg sokáig.
Illata egy visszafogott/letisztult virágos, fűszeres fajta.
Enyhe csípősséggel kezd, íze malátás, édes.
Aromája - akár az illata - nekem egy picit visszafogott, amúgy virágos, enyhén citrusos, picit fűszeres és gabonás hatások érezhetőek.
Tiszta befejezése enyhén fűszeres, kesernyés és végül enyhén száraz.
Nem volt vele semmi gond, jó és könnyen iható ser volt stb., de azért hasra nem estem tőle...
draft. nice color and head, strong palate, dry hoppy taste. nothing special.
boa lager. aroma agradável e leve. cerveja leve e com boa "drinkability". textura até que cremosa para o tipo. boa opção para quando se quer algo mais leve.
Good aroma,strong,lively,and makes a great taste in your mouth...alcohol catches you fast,so don’t ever think to drink before drive...great beer

I had this beer on-tap at a small jazz pub in Kiel, Germany. The beer has a light golden color with a good head and carbonation. The aroma was light with a hint of sweetness. The taste was clean and refreshing. It went down smooth with an easy finish. This is very drinkable as I had a number of these while relaxing to the music.
Bud Tchèque plus houblonné que la version canadienne. Lourdeur lors de la dégustation. Disponible en SAQ.
(Can 50 cl.) Pours golden with a nice white head. Lovely hoppy aroma. Smooth

Purchased as Czechvar.  Aroma is quite funky, bordering on skunky, which makes me wonder if this really is the same as Budvar 12?  Anyway, aroma is heavy with farm smells, mostly corn and hay.  Crystal clear golden color with a blink-and-you’ll miss is bubbly white head.  Flavor is straightforward, light malt, light hops, light yeast, green grass.  Smooth and easy-drinking, crisp, clean finish.  Good in the heat, but truly not much different than good old Budweiser!
bottle. pours a clear pale gold with a decent white head. strong malt aroma with a grassy and floral taste. nicely carbonated. nice bitter finish.

On tap, at U Medvidku, Prague on 11 July 2010. Gold with a thin head that laces sporadically. Rich hop aroma and a grassy hop kick with tang of grapefruit and a little herbiness. Fairly dry finish; zingy mouthfeel.
Very nice noble hop aroma.  Extremely light bodies and drinkable.  Clean malt flavor throughout with a creamy texture.  Very nice and drinkable.

[Keg at Marine, Whitby] Rich gold with a moderate white head and moderate carbonation. Honey, grass and herbs are evident, but the smooth palatte adds a layer of vanilla.  Despite the sweetness and creaminess, this still manages to be crisp and refreshing.  A glorious lager.

Bottle from Oddbins. Golden pour with a white head which soon dissipates. Aromas of pears, toffee, malts and some citrus. Bitter, hoppy flavours with a splash of citrus. Refreshing brew for a hot summers day.

Poured a nice golden yellow with a thin white head that disappeared quickly.  Light citrus and floral hops with toasted undertones on the nose.  A very nice malt body with that spicy sazz hops clean and short finish.

~pear like aroma with some sour hay notes, spicy saaz hops.
~pours clear golden with small lasting white head.
~Spicy saaz flavor, minerally, like soda water. 
~Light body, high CO2, spicy saaz finish.
~Had on draft, very carbonated. Enjoyable pils, refreshing. I enjoyed the spicy hops on this one.

Those damned green bottles.
This Looks, smells, and tastes like skunk piss. Avoid if you can.

This beer is 100x better then the American bud. Had a 33CL bottle bought at Slijterij Zeewijck in IJmuiden. Rocky white head, moslty lasting. Good lace. Clear yellow body. Hoppy and yeasty (soap) aroma. Moderately bitter and a bit watery initial flavour and lightly bitter (averagely bitter finish). Light body.

500mL Bottle -- Pours rich amber-gold with a small white head.  Aromas of hay, grass, barley, honey, malt, floral hops, and some mild skunk.  Very nice malt and hop character.  Balanced finish that last quite a while.

Bottle. Pours clear yellow with a fizzy, white head. Nice pilsener malt aroma with grass and florals. Lightly sweet with crisp bitters in the tail. Light to medium in body with lively carbonation. Exactly what it should be.
Very skunked aroma, other than that not a bad lager, not my favourite style of beer, but ok for a small sesh

Nouvelle évaluation. Bouteille 500 ml. 5%. Bouteille prise dans le fond de la tablette à l’abri de la lumière à la SAQ. Toute la différence du monde. Nez agréable de céréale et houblon. Très douce en bouche, gpût de houblon balancé, pas trop amère, belle fraîcheur, du bonbon. 

Bouteille  500 ml. 5%. Odeur immédiate de mouffette, traditionnellement associé à la bouteille verte. Couleur or assez foncé, mousse blanche. Assez mince en bouche, un goût d’aluminium saute aux papilles. Pourtant fraîche, elle semble avoir un problème. À réévaluer plus tard.
Bottle 50 cl. Pours a clear golden with a small white head and an aroma of hops. The taste is soft, high on malts with a bitter hoppy finish. One of the best pilsener-type beers I know.
Tap at the bell tower square in Prague. Clear golden with a white head. Refreshing hoppy pilsner aroma and a nice sprucy bitterness on top of pilsner characteristics. I’m happy about this one.
Pours a clear yellow body with a fizzy white head. Sweet with corn, grass, a little hop flavor in there too. Fine, nothing special.
From a bottle - labeled Czechvar Czech beer on mine - i’m assuming same beer as listed here. Very good pilsner. Excellent easy drinking beer.
bitter hoppiness but well restrained due to its lagered origins. Highly carbonated but not overwhelming. Very restrained white malt aftertaste with clean finish.
A fine beer,by all means better than the american,with a great colour and foam and an astonishing power palate for a pilsner. Very refreshing,too.

Tap. Nice golden colour. Matched with a nice medium sized bubbly head. Aroma of malt, maybe toffy,. Very crisp and refreshing taste. Notes of citrus but mainly a malt character. Medium carbonation which made it a nice, easy, seasonable drink.

Clear golden pour with a paper thin head. Bold malty nose with some sweet, floral notes. Malty intro with a moderately carbonated mouthfeel that has a buttery, almost slick finish with hoppy hints as well as a touch of honey. Much better than American Budweiser.

Budejovicky Brewery--Czechvar Premium Czech Lager--2001 16.9 oz. Bottle.  5.00% ABV.  (4.0 / 5.0)  Pilsner?  Clear rich bright golden color.  Foamy white head.  Mild lace.  Crisp malty floral Saaz front.  Slightly creamy light butter crisp Pilsner malt tasty sweet body.  Tangy mild citrus hop end.  Mild Classic Pils.  Sampled 4/24/2002.

Budejovicky Brewery--Czechvar Premium Czech Lager--2001 12 oz. Bottle.  5.00% ABV.  (4.25 / 5.0)  Pilsner?  Clear bright golden color.  Light laced head.  Rich floral crisp Saaz front.  Pilsner buttery crisp malty body.  Crisp mild ciitrus hop end.  Refreshing clean sweetness.  Nice clean Pils.  Real Bud. Green bottle.  Sampled 4/22/2002.

Budejovicky Brewery--B.B.N.P.--Ceske Budejovice--Czechvar Premium Czech Lager Beer--2006 16.9 oz. Bottle.  5.00% ABV.  25 IBU’s?  (4.0 / 5.0)  Pilsner?  Foamy white mild lace head.  Clear bright light gold color.  Pleasant Saaz hop front.  Clean Bohemian mild butter Pils crisp lager body.  Tangy Saaz hop spice clean bitter end.  Tasty.  Green Bottle--No Stank.  Sampled 7/27/2006.

Clear straw yellow color with a vanishing white head.  Aroma of bread malts.  Flavor is mostly bread and hay.  Smooth.  No lacing.  Decent for a pilsner, but not sure why all the high scores other than the Americanized Budweiser is that bad.

Sour-spiced a bit unpleasant sharp smell. Golden coloured, medium till big white head that won’t hold to long. Watery sour-spiced taste, not to bad, but I’m not a pilsner lover at all. Drinkable pilsner for me...

Bottle. Pour was light golden with a fluffy white head. Whew, it’s not skunked. Aroma was crisp and lightly bready with a touch of spicy hops. Flavors were light and crisp with just a bit of a biscuit and a very slight spicy note. Not a bad light pilsener, but I didn’t get too excited over sampling it.

For this style of beer it gets exceptional marks the aroma is not special as I never have seen a lot of lager beers that go out of their way in this department.  Pours golden with a good amount of carbonation. Very smooth and light on the palate with a malty taste of bread and hay. Just the perfect touch of hops to give it a bit of a bite but just enough. Excellent lager and knowing this brews history makes it more enjoyable.

Bottle consumed in May 2010. Pine/floral hop aroma. Nice thick head that lasts. Medium bitterness. Dry bitter finish. A great lager. 736314 ### Draught at a restaurant in Prague (Sept 2016). Gold body. White head. Saaz hops, spice, orange and lemon. Bitter. Crisp and refreshing mouthfeel. Dry finish.737413

Good beer. First thing that came to my mind was it tasted like Budweiser should taste. Little did I know... Goes down very smooth. Very drinkable. Nothing amazing not worth the money but a good beer for sure.

I’ve tried this beer as an import called Czechvar in a 500ml can, and as Budvar from a bottle bought back from the Czech Republic and no different taste.  Poured straw coloured with a diminishing white head. The aroma of bready malts with an initial skunkiness . Crisp mouthfeel with a sticky dryness. A malty brew with a lingering metallic bitternes.
500 ml can from LCBO.  Pours dark golden in colour, decent white head.  Aroma and taste are nicely balanced, maybe a bit on the bitter side.  Good drinking Euro lager.

Poured a light golden color. White head forms pretty tall but subsides fairly quick. Smells malty, and tastes just as malty. Little residual sweetness on the lips. Coats the mouth as well, but the carbonation quickly cuts it. Nice beer while barbecuing up some schweinsteaks. Can drink these all night with no ill effects in the morning. Taste much better close to the source than they did in the states.

50cl can: Finally got myself to rate this after having had it many many times before: Light golden colour with a rather quickly disappearing, bright white head. Grainy, fresh lemony/hoppy, almost citric aroma, very clean. Very crisp on the palate, lightly sweet pilsner malt with a hoppy but not bitter finish, a hint of alcohol. Really not much to speak about, but drinkable without being watery, not bad at all.

Draft at Bohemian Hall in Queens. Ironically, in a Budweiser pitcher. Pours crystal clear gold. Nose is light, pils malt and soft Saaz hops. Very light. On taste, not as robust as PU, pils malt dominating with a light sweetness. Soft bitterness. okay, but could use a bit more life.
Bottle @ The Bon Accord. Hoppy aroma, golden yellow colour. Flat metallic flavour, unpleasant aftertaste. Not great.

Green, 330ml bottle with gold foil.  The first time I had this it was a Budvar I had  in London.  The shop owner opened the bottle for me as I paid for it.  £1.50 for the bottle.  I drank it as I walked out and down the street.  Can’t do that in the States!  
 This time around it is a bottle of Czechvar and in the States.  (Damn AB.)    Pours a golden color, thin white head.  Aroma of pale malt, vanilla, and wood.  Kinda nice.  Flavor is soft and smooth.  Nice sweet honey, pale malt, finishes with a sharp mellow grassy hop.  Very easy to drink.  Refreshing.  I could pound down a few of these babies.  Yum
On tap. Clear golden color, thick, white head. Aroma, grassy. Taste is bittersweet with nice bitter finish. Great beer.
Decent lager. Nose and taste is very dry, some grassy pines and light spice. Rated 8/27/02

From a 330ml bottle on 1/5/2010. My bottle was labeled ’Czech Imported Lager’. Has quite a nice grassy, spicy, malt aroma. Flavour wise, it’s malty and almost herbal, with a decent dash of hop action at the finish. A well above average lager. Rating: 3.3 

Re-rate: From a 330ml bottle on 8/1/2013. Not as good as the previous try. Still decent but not a whole lot of character presents in the flavour.

(Bottle)

Pours with a fairly minimal pure white head; crystal clear golden yellow color.  Aroma has some nice hoppiness to it: grass, hay, minerals.  Light maltiness in the aroma, and just a tinge of sweetness.  Hops come through in the flavor as well, and very traditional Czech Pils.  Some spiciness, but not as much as I would hope.  Fluffy body with soft carbonation, very soft brew on the palate in general.  Very drinkable, and quenching.  Nothing off about this brew, but not a very exciting example.  I would love to try this fresh on tap near the source.  Probably different results.  Not bad in the bottle, though.
Starts with a heavy, burnt malty aroma together with the scent of fresh earth. From there, it is all down hill. Pretty boring. Too fizzy, too watery, too flavourless. Too ugh.
Bottled. Color golden yellow with a proper foamy white head. Nose is like fresh bread and hops. Aroma is the same: hops.  Flavour is hoppy with flat slightly bitter finish.

Unfortunate that this green-bottled beer was slightly skunked.  Otherwise fine soft malt and slight hop spice.  Aromas of hay and light toast are abundant.  Pours a beautiful and incredible golden lightness.  Crisp, a fairly light body however it has that complex malt quality that you would not expect.  Unfortunate for the green bottle.

Dark golden pour, medium off white head.
Aroma of malt and Czech hops.
Flavour is a very smooth subtle hop bitterness, highly drinkable.
I love Czech pilseners.

Skunked up from the green bottle that fades a little after the pour.  (I wish I could get the one in the picture) Clear light gold with a nice foamy head that disappears quickly.  Good carbonation level to match the lager. Grainy with medium hop bitterness taste that lingers around.  Finishes dry.
Bottle, in Prague. Gold coloured, good lacing. Full-bodied and smooth. Nice refreshener.
Crisp beer with a smooth taste. Appearance is a nice golden yellow with a fast bright white head. Aroma is light hay. Medium carbonation that pauses on the surface for a while before breaking.

330 mL bottle.  Pours golden with a bubbly white head.  Aroma is skunky at first owing to the green bottle, but that quickly fades, leaving a honey sweetness.  Flavor has sweet pale malts with some spicy and earthy hop notes, a little honey.  Nice balance of honey and hops.  Drier finish.  I think this is a great pilsener; it’s just too bad it’s imported in a green bottle.
Bottle. A clear golden colour with a small non-lasting white head. Floral hop and malt aromas. Light sweetness from the malt with a dry and bitter finish. An enjoyable pilsner.

Different in appearance from this picture, purchased from the LCBO in Brampton.  Only says Czechvar on the label, not Budvar or Budweiser or anything like that.

Skunky, hoppy smell with a little sweetness like malt maybe.   Pours pale golden color, white head that doesn’t last very long, no serious lacing on the glass as typical of the style..  Refreshing in taste when ice cold, definitely something to enjoy on a patio on a hot day.  Confused by one of the posters on this page who said it pours a deep amber color..  certainly not mine

cheers

Purchased (500 ml bottle) at SAQ Centropolis in Laval (Quebec), March 9, 2010. Straw-colored, short head. Aroma a little skunk, but slightly hopped and crisp. Taste of Saaz hops unimposing, slightly sweet. It is ordinary, but it is NOT BUD!
Bottle. Clear golden with a medium white head. The aroma is hops, caramel, grass and some fruit. The flavour nice hoppy with caramel and a nice bitterness. Ends up hoppy bitter.
Very tasty lager beer. Light yellow, crispy in taste. Not much flavor in direct but afterwards a good growing hoppy flavor. Short aftertaste.

500ml green bottle from SAQ . Pissy yellow descent head on pour. Med carbonation. No skunkiness at all yeah ! Aroma : fresh cereal , herbal hop. Nose is clean and typical of the style. Thin body, it’s pretty crisp. Finish is bitter and medium. To be honest I’m a bit impress, the beer compares to a nice bitterburger in can. It’s not as good as Urquell but it is a good addition to SAQ lineup.

[Bottle] Ahh, I have good memories about this beer dating back from when I first started drinking in Germany a long time ago. After losing a bet that this Budweiser came before the US version, I actually began appreciating it more. It was a staple in former East Germany since it was one of the few imports they had. It still has a strong following there. But I digress.... Pours a yellow color with high carbonation level and a foamy white head. Grass and sweet malt in the nose. Dry and crisp taste, with lingering grainy sweetness and crisp hop bite. I do enjoy this beer quite a bit, but I have never had it in a green bottle.

(12oz bottle thanks to mar bb 2-24-10. That’s right. Expired Beer that wasn’t good to begin with) pours clear pale yellow. Nice lasting head with good lacing! nose of skunk, Apple, and spoiled cereal grain. Taste of dirty water, earthy hops, and some actual malt buried in here too. Medium body with a bit of oilyness. Unfortunately this just isn’t very good.
deep amber, white head.  nose is light hops and skunked malts.  ok palate with a rather skunky flavor with a light hop finish.

Bottle from LCBO and on tap at Hey Lucy. Nice golden color with minimal head and lacing; the saaz hops dominate and provide a crisp refreshing flavor with very little malt. It’s hard to suggest whether this is better than Urquel or not, but it really doesn’t matter since I’ve had better American made examples of the style. Enjoy it if there’s not much else on tap but otherwise I’d give it a miss.

Pale golden color.  Thin white head.  Aroma is metallic and very lager-y.  Taste starts dry and goes toward some bitterness.  A note of wheat malts.  Mouthfeel is full-bodied and lingering.  I admit I don’t get this.  It just seems like a slightly better (American) Budweiser to me.
A pale golden beer with a small head.  The bottle is green of course its a skunky aroma. The taste is skunky & vegetal with a bad aftertaste.
Bottle. Yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops and hints of fruit.

11.2 oz. bottle at a buddy’s house, not sure where he got it.  No matter, though, because it’s not worth searching out.  It’s a fairly typical green-bottled Euro lager/pilsener.  Pours a clear gold with a big white head.  Grainy, hoppy, skunky, corny, and watery in both aroma and flavor.  Light-bodied, with a lot of carbonation and a Euro skunk aftertaste.  Meh.

Serving type: 500 ml Green bottle

Pours a nice golden color with a thin foam head.
A very light tasting beer going down. I found it to be easy drinking. 
This is definitely a beer I would buy again.

Sampled in Japan so this was labled "Budvar" in a green bottle.

Pours a deep golden color with brownish hints to it. Head pours white and is about a finger thick but not very dense. Aroma is one of sweet hay, grains, lemon zest, and slightly bitter hops. Tasting the beer leads one to repeat the cycle of sweet honey, biscuity malts and zesty finish. I will say this beer was fairly dry and sharp. I liked that quality about it very much. The hop dosage is very noticable and sazzy, they are slightly funky that only sazz seems to give to a brew. Very nice and good pilsner although I could see that if you did not drink it fresh the hops and character of the beer would fade quickly, seeing as this bottle was only 2 months old it was still very much alive with potent pilsner character. I’ll give high marks to a beer that you can session and still enjoy a very impressive flavor profile, a winner for me.

Pours yellow-gold and crystal-clear with a frothy white head. Aroma is grass,  pale grainy malt, hints of lemon, apple and spice. Czechvar is crisp with mild bitterness, light biscuits, bare hints of fruit and spicy hops. This beer is light and refreshing. A classic lager.
Just a lager, a little better than the others but not by much.  That’s about it.
Bottle 33 cl. Golden, clear with a medium white head. Aroma; sweet malt and some hoppy sence. Flavor; nice sweet hoppy, with a sweet, but then again bitter ending. good pilsner.

Consumed substantially in Prague on holiday and at the Hotel where the famous old Budvar tanks reside. A lovely beer. Clean crisp, unpastuerised in the Czech Republic, easy to drink and completely guilt-free. A great classic pilsner. 

One of the most quaffable drinks to conusme on a night out for its drinkability. Hops bang and sparkle in the mouth and the creamy texture flows through reminiscent of caramel and vanilla. I love this beer and in Prague it is awesome. There is such a difference between this beer here and in Prague it is eye-opening. It is a traditional world pilsner. If you want a genuine pilsner then go for this. Don’t be disheartened by the unfair reviews.

Bottle. Very clear gold pour, with a nice white head that fades quickly. Nice hoppy aroma, grassy with light dry grain aromas. Taste is soft grain sweetness, a little honey, and light hop bitterness. Very light palate, refreshing.

Bottle. Pours clear orangeish gold with a frothy white head that lasts a little while. Aroma is predominately malty but there is a little hoppiness also with notes of caramel, honey, bisuity malt and grass, leafy hops. Flavour is crisp and very similar to the aroma but with a hint of lemon. Light bodied but not watery, this has moderate carbonation and a lingering bitter finish. Very good Czech pilsner, you can see why Adolf Busch ripped it off all those years ago.

Grainy, honey-ish malt. 
Bittersweet flavours. Honey, grainyness, grass, a hint of citrus. Pretty boring but not a bad lager. These sort of Pilseners would be a hundred times better with just a little more hops!
Bottle at beer tasting. Pours a clear yellow gold. Nose is mostly grains and a bit of hops. Taste is similar. Not bad.
Tap. Pale gold pour with nearly no head. Grain, biscuit, and some pilsner funk. Not very good. Euro version of American macro.
Bottle.  Aroma is macro lager.  Nothing special about this brew.  Just macro lager from Europe instead of the states.

Poured a clear golden yellow with a wispy head and a few floating particles. (I avoided pouring the last 1/4inch filled with sediment.)  The aroma was grassy, biscuity, and little metallic  and the palate was surprisingly smooth, almost oily with a touch of effervescence. The beer is mostly dry with a mild hop bitterness. This is my first test of a genuine Bohemian Pilsner. Not sure it’s my thing.

Bottle. Clear golden straw yellow with a big fizzy white head. Aroma is sweet, grain, yeasty bread dough, slightly mineralic, slightly sour. Crisp, clean tasting, with a refreshing grassy hop finish. Thirst quencher, should make a good session beer. Lively carbonation, light body, fairly dry.
light malty,light yellow,white foam, light sweetness, acetic,short finish,light body, dry texture,lively, metallic light.

Fortunately my bottle didn’t have "Budweiser" stamped on it or I probably would have passed on it. I’m glad I didn’t , I enjoyed it. Pours a nice clear yellow, with a very thin white head and very little lacing. Not much carbonation but it did a nice crisp hoppy taste with a clean finish. Slightly metallic aroma, but not overpowering. Don’t let the "Budweiser" on it turn you away, it’s worth a try.
A golden yellow beer with a white head. Strong hops aroma with flowery notes. Taste is malty and hoppy. Dry end with a very nice bitterness and some metallic taste

Crystal clear, her colors are sun-soaked golden hay and straw beneath a voluminous white head that lingers long before my gazing eyes. Eventually settling into a soft white blanket, I watch a slow stream of tiny bubbles laze their way to the surface were they burst onto the scene, releasing a wonderful nose of sweet cereal grains, dinner rolls, water crackers, green grass, lemon, and bread crust toasted to golden perfection. Brisk, clean, and invigorating, she taunts and teases me to toss inhibitions to the winds and dive deep into her lustrous depths. Who am I to argue with the original Budweiser? My first quaff is full, long, and invigorating. The top of my tongue giggles under a crisp assault of crunchy water crackers, honey glazed toast, and a clean finish which snaps with lemon zest and green grass. A few more deep draws and the top of my tongue starts to dry, lemon skin and green grass showing their continual presence even as cereal grains, toast, honey, and bales of hay parade across my palate from my first quaff to my last. My last? Well, I’ll be. Seeing as my glass is empty, then I would presume the end is here indeed.




Budweiser/Budvar/Chechvar was a pilsner delight. It’s a crying shame that Budvar is rudely forced to call themselves something else just because a certain Goliath felt threatened by a certain David. That won’t stop me, and it shouldn’t stop you from enjoying a Czechoslovakian classic whenever you have the opportunity. Just look for the Czechvar here, and when in Czech, do as the Czechs do and order yourself a Budvar.

Currently sampling out of a 500ml can which is different from the usual 500ml green bottle. I enjoy this thoroughly. It has a flowery hops flavor to it accompanied with a very comforting aftertaste of fresh bread. For me this is very much a comfort beer which at the same time I could drink all day, every day. Good head retention too.
