Czechvar from a green bottle. Best Before 3.30.10. Waft of skunk (or perhaps elephant) upon opening, though this isn’t strong thereafter. Beautiful gold color, decent head. Some heft in the body for a pils, and nice malt flavor with punchy hops. You can tell this would be a great pilsener if fresher. Alas...

Bottled from World Market.  Aroma good hoppy spice.  Golden appearance with small head but lacing bubbles.  Taste with a nice snap on the palate.  Nice hop flavor but some aftertaste that is tolerable.  Not bad overall.
This is what Budweiser should be...this is a clean smooth beer with a grassy sweet note in the taste.  The Czechs have a real winner here
Really not bad.  Would be a good everyday drinker.  Bready with a slight hop snap at the finish.
Pours pale gold into a shaker. Bright white recedes to hug rim. Cracker aromas. Sharp malt and cereal turning to slightly hopped dry finish.  7/3/6/4/12
Aroma of honey comb and lemon. Appearance was golden with creamy head. Flavor of honey, lemon and light hops. Palate was lively. Alright.
Pale yellow with no head, sweet malt aroma, sweet malt taste, slightly over carbonated.
Bottle, Tesco. Always a favourite. Chalky, hoppy and an acceptable ’mustiness’. Fine pale gold appearance, a pleasant dry finish and pretty moreish.

Bottle. Pours a pale golden colour with small white head. Very floral hop aromas. Flavours start with a little sweet malt followed some nice hop bitterness. Quite dry on the finish. Quite easy to drink.

[1/11] Tried many times This time I can see the appeal. Maybe these are better bottles - there’s certainly more of this about here these days. Pretty austere on the malt side, but very crisp with a nice hop note (flowers, spice, earth) and good bitterness. Not a knockout, but good. [3.4] 

500ml can. Gold with a white head that doesn’t last all that long. Aroma of honeyed pale malt, flowers, light spices. Very gentle carbonation. A little sweetness, again grainy and honeyed, bitterness that’s just insistent and lightly spiced. [3.5] 

 A few more. It’s not exciting, but it’s very high quality not exciting.

11.2oz bottle.  Pours a crystal clear golden yellow with a white two finger frothy head.  Has a soft musty  floral hop aroma.  Taste begins with a sweet maltiness which soon yields to the citrus and herbal hops. Finish is crisp, dry, and slightly bitter.  A very good pilsner, yet still over hyped.

For a Pilsner, this really is the icing.  The original and what most others are held against in comparison purposes.  Aroma is of malt and hop.  Pours a clear golden colour with a thin white head.  Taste is great.  Malt and hop in the taste with a little bitter aftertaste is just wonderful.  This brings be back to Prague where I downed quite a number of these pints.  Hopefully will get back there again, this time to visit the brewery.
Gold-coloured beer with a shade of copper. Has a large and tight head that evaporates quickly. The aroma has some honey, bitter hops and malt. The taste is a little watery, a little honeysih hops.

Bottle (33cl). Clear bright golden body with a medium dense white head that is short lasting. Nose of grainy pilsner malts and light citrussy hops. Flavour is medium sweet malts with an okay hop presence. It is medium bodied with an average carbonation. Pretty much an uncomplicated crisp and refreshing pilsner. Of the mainstream exported Czech lagers, this is better than Staropramen (too sweet) but it lacks the dry hop bitterness of Pilsner Urquell which remains the gold standard for this style.
It is much better than US Budweiser. Much more flavor and character. Pilsner Urquel is a much better Czech beer.

330ml bottle. Bright amber colour with a neat and tidy even white foam cap and aromas of malt and hops that dominate anything else that might be there. Clean crip taste with a slight bitterness at the end. Decent enough.
Very clear golden beer with good carbonation and retention. Very malty flavor with no detectable hops both on tongue and nose. Little carbonation or mouthfeel.

Poured from bottle into Pilsner glass.

Clear light gold with thin white head and tendrils of lacing.

Very dry and spicy smell with strong notes of hay, grass and apple.

Great malt body of apple, pear and only slightly grassy. As expected, it turns more spicy and bitter toward the end.

Moderately high carbonation, clean light body, very dry finish. Exactly what I think a Pils should feel like, whether Czech or German.

Exceedingly refreshing Czech Pils with a much better than expected malt body. Could have used a touch more bitterness for balance, but that is a very minor complaint. Until I retry Pilsner Urquell, this is my favorite Czech Pilsner.
Bottle and draft. I drink Staropramen at first, then Pilsner Urquell and then Budvar. The last was better. Good balance of hops and malts.

Pours a golden yellow with very little head. This beer has a faint aroma of hops. It tastes of very bitter hops, too bitter in my opinion. It has a watery mouthfeel and, aside from the hops, is pretty bland. This is a very mediocre beer, and it is highly overrated.

Draught at Villa Patriot Hotel 2019-03-10 Marianske Lanske
Pretty fresh 3,5 , old 3,3

Bottle from Czeck friend, consumed 2010-01-29, Göteborg
Citrus fruits, sweetbread, medium bitterness. A Pilzner that is geating better and better. Raised from 2,8 to 3,3!

Nový Bor, Czeck Republic, Draft in orginal glass, 10 C 20091022. Big strong head! Flavor etc Czech standard pilzner
Big ol thanks to bman1113vr for this one. Clear golden pour. Small white head. Aroma is corn, skunk, urine. Flavor is corn, grass, skunkiness isn’t as bad as the aroma. Fizzy mouthfeel.

Bottle. I can’t help but think to myself, "why green?!". Pours with a clear golden body and a fading white head. Aroma of cut grass clippings, light struckness, and a bit of stale bread. Taste is better, slightly, less lightstruck, bready, thin, watery and grassy. Thin and dry mouthfeel. Too far from the source, and not in a good bottle.

Bottle. The aroma of hops, light sour then it gets more malty. No head, the body is orange-red. The taste is light bitter, then it gets more sour which stays long. Carbonation is normal, the body is light to medium and dry-creamy.

Several bottles.  The fresher the better.  Clear light golden, thin white head.  Nice wholesome grains, light soft sweetness on the nose.  Clean and crisp in the mouth.  As a good pilsener should be this one ends clean and a tiny bit grassy.  A great example and very good value.
500mL bottle at an overpriced pub in downtown Vancouver. Pours light yellow with a small head. Taste is dry, with light hops, but fairly generic. Won’t be having this again - very overrated.

Thanks to rustychiles for grabbing me one of these. Pours piss yellow with minimal head. Aroma is of Saaz hops and some grassy stank...don’t know if it’s light struck a bit or just took a beating getting transferred here. Taste is pretty good. Crisp, dry, nice hop accents. Very light and kind of boring, but way better than the poser Budweiser (read: it ain’t no corn water).
Pours golden with a nice head.  Nice malt notes on the mouth and finish but without the nasty cloying sweetness often tasted.  Nice dry finish.
saaz hop aroma, golden, clear, white foam, rocky head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,
Bottle. Nice clean taste. Very drinkable, dry. Perfect for an every day beer to have on hand.
Had a bottle that someone brought to a party my folks threw. Middle of the road all the way around: decent aroma, color, head, taste. Solid lager, but nothing I’d go out of my way for.

A dark straw with a big bubbled white head. Settles quickly. Smells of orange and slight floral hops. Taste is a nice balance of sweet and dry. Lasting dry finish with hints of tartness. Crisp in the mouth.

Had this from a can, poured into a glass. Very nice appearance, excellent aroma of malts and grains, great fruity taste and eminently drinkable. No hints of rice or other random crap that you might find in, er, "other" beers out there.
This beer isn’t worth the huge naming rights conflict.  They’re both sub-par beers in my book.

Bottle. Clear yellow body with a small white head that disappears. The first whiff is slightly sulphuric, an aroma that sticks around longer than expected. On top of that are aromas of toasted bread and herbs with a hint of dough. The flavor is lightly to moderately sweet and lightly bitter. The finish is lightly sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. A bit of a grainy taste emerges in the finish. Medium body, watery texture and lively carbonation. Not unpleasant yet not all that good either.

Bottle. Pours a nice golden colour with a good white head. I was soon put off however by its skunky aroma. So soon after being excited I was put off by this and was hoping it bore no resemblance to its American successor beer. However my fears were gone as soon as I took my first sip. I was met by a well balanced taste of sweet and bitter. The bitter hops are more noticeable in the finish. Goes down well. A good beer.

This beer has that classic pils flavor that I so love.  Although it is certainly light in body and flavor, Czechvar is clean, crisp and refreshing with a grassy, yeasty flavor and a small hop finish.   A very tasty and enjoyable beer.

Bottle from Tylers.  Smells on point--spritzy,  grassy, slightly skunky in a good way.  Flavor is crisp and clean, with some light hop flavor.  Easy drinking, and much better than the Budweiser I have been consuming as of late.

Clean bitter taste leaving nice full malty flavours. Lucky to have sampled at source in the brewery in Ceske Budejovice- Velvety smooth creaminess on top of  delicious fresh yeastiness. A simply delicious more-ish drink. More carbonated than some Czech lagers, but with a light head. The original and only Budvar, the best.
Pours a golden color with a small white head. Aroma is hops malt and a light skunkiness. Flavor is malt bitter hops and a touch of metal. Crisp and decent but the metal is a bit disconcerting.

Golden lager with a thin head, but truly great flavor, well balanced with a malty lean propped up by a slight hops bitterness and a hint of citrus.  A great companion to football &#40whichever kind you like&#41
Not a bad pilsner.  Easy to drink.  Perfect for a hot day.  A little on the bland side.

Pour from a 12oz green bottle. Medium yellow brew with a touch of amber. Thin whitish head that soon dissaparates. A hint of skunk in an otherwise pleasing aroma of malt and dry hops. Full bodied light malt flavor with a really well balanced but restrained hops finish. pleasant hops bitterness and dry at the end. Very pleasant, well crafted, and well balanced brew. Quite tasty.
Bottle.  Pours a golden body with a white head.  Bread y corny a hint of floral hops.   Sweet thin with a bitter dry finish.  Decent.

11.2 oz. bottle. Golden yellow with a small head that disappeared almost completely. Very little in the nose aside from a touch of sweetness and grass and a some skunkiness.  Sweet bready malt and nice grassy, spicy hops with some mild bitterness. Palate is medium and the finish is on the dry side.

Packaged as Czechvar. 500ml bottle poured into a pint glass. Poured a golden color with a decent 1" head that lasted a couple minutes. Hmmm, smells like beer. Good malt & hop balance in the aroma with a hint of citrus &#40or maybe it’s a hint of skunk&#41. Tastes of sweet malts and bitter hops. Just the right balance as neither are dominating the flavor. Pretty average Lager feel. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Crisp finish. It’s quite drinkable but it’s not to be downed too fast. I have easily enjoyed a few of these in one evening. Only if American Budweiser would taste this good.

11.2 ounce bottle - $1.49 at Total Wine & More in Atlanta, Georgia.

Appearance: Pours out a bright, clear, golden body with a medium-large, white head, though it quickly settles down to a thin, quarter inch layer.

Smell: Lightly sweet-scented barley with a hint of dough gently yields to some soft, spicy Saaz notes.

Taste: A light, sweet maltiness with a doughy bent to it kicks things off followed by a balancing touch of spicy, grassy Saaz hops and bitterness. Minor hint of lemon verbena. Little murmur of diacetyl butteriness in the background. Dry finish with that Saaz spiciness riding out into the aftertaste.

Mouthfeel: Light-bodied. Medium carbonation.

Drinkability: Worth a try. Fairly tasty, easily drinkable -- it’s a nice little beer.
Poured golden with dense white head.  Yeasty, bready aroma.  Dry, slight malty sweet, yeasty, bready, grainy flavor.  slightly creamy on the tongue.
Bottle. Pours gold with a light white head. Aroma is off, kind of smelled like stale biscuits or bread. Flavor is nice and simple, very drinkable, biscuit and hop notes with a clean finish.

This pilsner has a nice thick white head with a clear golden color. The aroma is very malty with hints of corn and butter. The flavor is very bland but full of carbonation. You can taste some hops but nothing strong and there is not much of a sticky finish. Overall it is a refreshing pilsner.

Pours straw pale with medium almost creamy white mostly lasting head. Aroma is flowers and herbs with a faint perfume touch. Flavor is malty sweet, nicely balanced by a crisp herbal bitterness with a long aftertaste.

12oz green bottle from McKinnon’s in Salem, NH. Pours a translucent golden yellow with a thin film of white head. Smells slightly sweet and biscuity. Tastes malty sweet with some biscuit, caramel, and a fair bit of herbal hops. Clean finish as expected. Light in body and carbonation, and easy-drinking. A solid example of the style.

Bouteille de 500 ml. Arômes légers de malt et de houblon herbeux. Robe blonde, peu de mousse et effervescence  à grosses bulles. En bouche, une légère touche de houblon herbeux accompagne un malt très légèrement mielleux et sucré. Finale plutôt douce. Agréable, mais je préfère les pilsener un peu plus amères.
Why skunky green bottles?! Why?!  I’m sure this would be much better on tap or out of a fresh bottle that hasn’t been light-struck.

500mL bottle. Light aroma. Nice golden colour, quickly disappearing white head. Very refreshing mouthfeel, smooth and crisp. Nice light spiciness. Quick dry aftertaste, which is desirable on a hot day like today, keeps you drinking more. Definitely accomplishes what it strives to do, nice overall. But not very exciting.

Draft at Uber. Pours a crystal clear pale yellow with light carb showing and a bit of filmy grayish head. Has almost no nose, but what’s there is a bit sweet and on the hay side of the pasture. Crisp light watery body, could show a bit more carb. Virtually flavorless, and pretty much without finish. This beer sneaks quietly past you like it just lifted your Rolex.

Budweiser???  Nasty!  Oh wait, this is a different kind of Budweiser.  Green bottle - uh oh.  Bright golden color with a small white head.  Aroma of bready/grainy malt and grassy hops - no skunk detectable.  Flavor similar, with a really crisp hop bite and no off-flavors.  Palate somewhat light and refreshing.  Not bad actually.

Bottled. My first time having this beer, the supposed forefather of all modern pale lagers. The influence is clear, though this is doubtlessly a better and more flavorful brew. The aroma retains that distinct skunky/rattiness though so common in cheap lagers which is a bit of a hit, and the drinkability is actually a bit low.
What a treat to drink this one.  A rich yellow colour and a smallish head, plus a moderately hopped aroma.  Taste was smooth, clean, crisp, and refreshing.

Draught at Café Evropa in Prague.
A beautiful golden lager served in a 500ml mug rather than a flute. In my opinion this is the correct way to serve it as the handle helps prevent warming the beer through contact. Delightful hoppy aroma and flavour. Dry, crisp and delicious. Much superior to its unrelated namesake.
Wanted to give this a try. Not bad but not as good as P.U. Just does not have the flavor.

Draught at the Queen & Beaver in Toronto.  Pours a clear yeloow gold with tiny white cap.  Sweet bready malts in the aroma.  Bready malts very nice in the falvour with some grassy hops also present.  Crisp, somewhat dry finish.  Nice.
Yellow color. Bottle. Exceptional pilsner, with small off white head. light better taste of hops... with a light hoppy smell. Better than pilsner urquell

Bottle. 5%. Clear yellowy-gold colour, fairly carbonated, small white foam. Best pilsener I’ve tasted to date, but I obviously lack understanding in the fascination surrounding. Hoppy-malty taste with a hint of sweetness, leaving a bitter feel.

500 ml bottle. BB 19/06/2014. From saveur-biere.com.

Deep golden colour with a frothy medium-size white head. Dry grassy hoppy aroma with metal and some maltiness  Dry grassy hoppy and malty flavour with some metal notes. Nicely hopped Czech Pilsener.

Pours a clear golden/lemon with medium white head that is too light in body to stick. Aroma is grass and corn. Flavor is light and grassy with bitter notes. Body is light with high carbonation. 

budweiser budvar still budweiser.

(Draught) Golden and clear. Medium sized and quite quickly disappearing white head. Grass and ligtly butter in aroma. Quite light and dry palate with quite high carbonation. Lightly malts, grass, bitterness, lightly sweetness and fruitiness in taste. Bitterness and grass in aftertaste.

500mL bottle, BB 11/5/2010 (seriously?.. that’s a bit exaggerated).  Poured clear straw golden with a nice cap of white head.  The aroma picked up toasted bready pils malts balanced well against grainy character and spicy lemon zest.. fresh and well-presented.  The flavor had a base of bready malts, grains, and a faint pinch of corn holding up lemon zest, earth, and something akin to oak.. finished tangy and refreshing.  Light-ish bodied, crisp, and well-balanced on the palate.. moderate and rolling carbonation moved it well.. again a refreshing finish.  This is between great and excellent when fresh.

On special at my local, 375ml bottle. Poured light yellow, transparent, little head with hardly any retention. Aroma of mostly straw and some hops with a tiny bit of skunk. Taste is light but still distinctive, straw, wheat and corn, light mouthfeel, very crisp and goes down smoothly. Finish is similar, very grainy and quite refreshing. Highly sessionable, have sunk 6 in a row very quickly. A decent example of a pilsner, fits the mould well. Would drink this often if it wasn’t so expensive in Australia.

Wow Ican;t believe that I hadn’t rate it so far even though i drink it quite often. It’s usually me 2nd option for pilsner when I don’t find the Urqell. Crisp and highly drinkable with q moderate bitter finish.

Comes in a handsome 500ml green bottle .Better than the regular Budweiser! It has a much more rich flavour with a sharper aftertaste on the toung and cheeks, and it’s not to expensive. It’s the perfect beer when you drink it with a cold cut sandwish or with some brats from the BBQ on a warm summer day.

(bottle 0,5l) (8.12.2018) Overall: Nice hoppy, good czech pilsner. (6.3.7.4..13=3.3

Aroma: Light malty, light floral hops.

Appearance: Clear golden. Medium, white head.

Taste: Noble hops, malty, medium sweet, medium bitter.

Palate: Medium body. Bitter finish.



(Bottle 0,5l) (6.7.2009) (4.2.6.3..11=2.6)
Hops aroma. Clear golden color. minimal white head. Very bitter with bitter astringent finish.

Crisp clean with a nice sweetness and slight hoppy bite. Primarily straw-like cereals. Very, very smooth. It definitely has something.

@ FuzzyBrain ’Drank about 3 bottles in quick succession and no real flavours came to mind just a boring nothing sort of taste so a good beer for getting drunk on and for someone who doesnt like taste of beer.’ 
Love it.

Bottle, Best Western ’President’ Hotel, Istanbul. This has often been a not too shabby get out of jail card in the past, and I have drunk my share of this in years gone by.At least there is something in the aroma and the flavour which so often isn’t the case with this style. Certainly lacking in any kind of wow factor it is nonetheless quite clean and crisp. Any shred of enjoyment was punctured when the bill came in at 8 euros a bottle however.

Over rated. Drank about 3 bottles in quick succession and no real flavours came to mind just a boring nothing sort of taste so a good beer for getting drunk on and for someone who doesnt like taste of beer.

11.2 oz. bottle.  Pours a pale yellow with a small, foamy head that quickly fades.  Very grainy nose with a little skunk and cardboard thrown in.  Not very inspiring.  Medium carbonation with a light mouthfeel.  Light, grainy palate that really is one dimensional.  Short finish with a little bit of graininess.  Better than the average macro swill, but still very average at best.

Bottle. Pours clear yellow and well-carbonated, with a one-finger there-and-gone white head. Nose is corn, hops, skunk. Light grain and corn taste with more skunk and a decent mouthfeel. Okay, but I really expected better. No hop oiliness, no real grassiness. Maybe this is an off bottle, but I am seriously underwhelmed. Fortunately, I still have this Trois Pistoles nearby....
Clear straw pour, light head and lace. Some skunky corny aroma. Hoppy start, light, slightly skunky malt finish, Heineken taste-a-like.

Czechvar bottle. Pours an orange golden with a small frothy white head that diminishes rather quickly. Skunk corn malt and wheat grass on the nose. Decent spotty lacing along the glass. Thin mouthfeel with a light grain malt taste with a touch of hops in the finish. Easy to drink, a very good pils from Budvar.

Enjoyed from a green 12oz bottle in a pub glass.  I had heard a lot of good things about this supposedly classic pilsner, and therefore was anticipating trying it when I scored a six-pack.  The beer pours a medium yellow, with a reasonably fluffy white head.  The aroma reminded me of regular American Budweiser that had been exposed to light.  It wasn’t entirely skunked, but it was close.  I got very little hop aroma.  The palate was just as disappointing, throwing very little, if any, malt, and having just a touch of bitterness- not the bracing and assertive type that one would expect from a Bohemian Pils.  Overall, a disappointment in essentially all facets.

(Sample Date: 3/8/2009   Source:Other)   Richmond Beer Dig. Light graininess with earthy spicy hop aroma. Clear light straw with a small white head. Light graininess with some honey notes and a dry hay like spicy hop flavor.
500 ml bottle in Germany at the Cafe Carrre just before it closed for good. This is what Bud should taste like. A wonderful lager with a great blend of malt and hops, quite a refreshing beer

Bottle. Poured with an average-sized, fizzy white head, that disappeared failry quickly. Dark-yellow color, clear and sparkling. Smelled quite skunky; this aroma hung around for most of the time drinking it. As for the flavor, it was slightly sweet and acidic, and skunky as well. Not great, and didn’t improve over time. Light to medium body with a watery texture and fizzy carbonation, with an average-lasting finish. Don’t think I’d go out of my way to buy it again.

Overall Impression: 
Don’t confuse with the American crap, this is the real (and pretty good) Budweiser (as a good European friend of mine likes to remind me).

33cl bottle poured into a footed pilsner.  Clear golden color with lots of white head.  Nose is all hops.  Taste is all hops as well.  Very smooth with a short finish.  Not bad but not great.  Much better than Anheuser-Busch’s knock-off Budweiser brand.

Bottled.
Golden with white head. Aroma of malt with hint of hay and spices. Flavor is more malt with an OK bitterness.
I was expecting more from this beer, but I guess pilsensers/pale lagers can only get so good. For the kind of beer it is, I guess it’s alright, but it’s really nothing special.
Bottle at Volo. Sweet with faint notes of honey on the nose and palate. Decent lacing and a touch bitter, with a quasi-hoppy profile. One of the better lagers out there.
Beautiful golden colour and a special blonde beer taste. 5 % alcohol percentage powers up its taste. Nice beer! Got it for only 1,34 euros.
Vibrant golden color with great clarity. Sour apple aroma leads to basic lager flavor and soft finish.

Bottle; tailgate tasting at Rose Bowl.  Finally got to taste this one; I will not be making any attempt to do so again.  Poured a clear, light gold color.  Aroma is of grain, bread and a bit of earthy hops.  Flavor of grain, bread, slightly swet malt with a touch of earthy hops.  Didn’t like this one much.
Bottle. Light golden colour, big white head that stays around mostly. Nice aroma - hoppy, grassy. Tastes quite malty with a bitter finish. Nice fresh and crisp. This is the way lagers should be....

Pretty good beer. The gold foil around the bottle top is a bit of a pain if you want to drink it from the bottle. I learned my lesson and just decided to drink from a glass. Can definitely taste the European influence in this beer.

3,50$ for a 500ml bottle (great, I hate taste-ruining cans), at SAQ.  Wow!  Probably the best pilsner I ever had.  I’m usually a strong beer lover but this one is pretty malty, with refreshing notes of citrus and maybe other fruits, but no annoying spicyness whatsoever.  Very pleasant mouthfeel, interesting subtilities, great balance and nothing negative in my opinion.  This will probably be a regular light summer beer for me!
Poured golden orange, sweet, corn, malty, grainy, little earthy hops, little honey, little nutty.

500 mL Bottle. Yellow body with a frothy white head that settles to a tenacious foamy ring lacing the sides of the glass. Aroma is sweet malt with a floral note and grassy astringent hops. Flavor is sweet malt with a clean astringent character about it, a hint of honey expresses with a mild hop bitter-floral aftertaste followed by a mild nutty finish. Gorgeous.

Bottle...  Poured a pale golden with a white head.  Tangy aroma of malts and earthy tones.  A little hoppy, but definitely had a more tart, tangy fruity quality to it.  Probably going for more of that smooth character.
Nice skunky aroma yet a smooth sweet meeting in your mouth. Slightly bitter aftertaste but a full bodied rich feel in you mouth. Nice flavor but not uncommon.

Bottle. From wegmans. Pours a golden yellow color with a huige fluffy white head and lots of bubbles. Aroma is grain and some mild hops. Taste is well balanced and light. Very drinkable and tasty. Not bad.

2009 Tap.  What an enjoyable lager!  Aroma and flavor of corn and wheat, this beer was not remarkably complex.  But what drinkability!  Very refreshing and enjoyable, this should be much more available in the US.

The aroma is very weak, not too much there to smell. Clear as any pale lager. The flavour is very clean, finishes with a nice little bit of hoppiness and then fades away. Not to bad as an import pilsner but it’s easier to find better stuff, like Pilsner Urquell.
Nice aroma, Very skunky. Great golden colour. Clean crisp mouth feel. Very drinkable. Good palate. Starts smooth and malty, and finishes with a sharp bitter bite. Good pilsner.

Pours clear light yellow with a large fizzy white head.  Aroma is moderately malty, of hay, light bread, straw. moderately hoppy of herbs and lemons.  Nicly balanced twords bitter, nice and light, hop finish was more bitter. Light to medium body, watery and soft co2.

330ml bottle in belgrade. Finally a real beer, first in awhile. Full taste of robust hop and malt. Some of the lagerish honey notes but quite spritely to balance. Lots of flavor, wheaty bread and hops. Tasty

Draught at U Medviku, Prague 11.11.2008
Served deep golden with a big white head.
Aroma of new cutted grass and bakery.
Taste is balanced between hops and malt, with a nice bitter sting at the end.

pours a nice looking golden gold, with a white fizzy head that vanishes immediately.  smells of sweet, buttery, corny malts with hops slightly detectable. taste is - wow - better than expected. good balance, crisp hops first assault the senses quickly followed by sweet malt.  that this was gonna be crap but actually it’s pretty nice.

a light smell of grass and bread. the taste is very balanced and drinkable, and there are bits of rye bread, and sesame seeds on bread, and of course classic pilsener taste, with a nice medium body. i like it alot

Comes out of the tap a fairly average clear amber, but it does have a nice, fine-bubbled white head. Aroma is rather weak, malty, and not promising. Flavor is wan but palatable, malty with a good hint of citrus. Texture is smooth and fairly tingly. I am just not a big fan of pilsners.
Bottle. golden colour with white head. Nice fruity aroma. Taste malty and sweet A very nice bohemian pilsner.

Colore dorato vivo,testa bianca e sottile schiuma persistente.Aroma di malto e luppolo con richiami fruttati,così come il gusto è ugualmente maltato con leggere note erbacee e di lievito.Finale di erba e lievemente ma piacevolmente amaro.Ottima pils ceca.
Clear golden color with a white head. Typically saaz-aroma of straw and bread. A note of malt also. Taste: Very well balanced between the hops and a malty sweetness. Really great pilsener.

Clear amber with medium white head, aroma barnyard, olives, cheesy sourness, flowers and  some sweet malts as well, quite unique, Flavor of deep malt with biscuit toasty flavors sweet caramel some clove and very pleasant herby hopy finish. Very nice one.
50cl bottle, clear golden colour, white head, malt and corn aroma, grassy hops notes, light bitter flavor, light body, finish with a little bit more bitterness

Pours Pale to medium gold with a thin white head. Aroma is grass, bread, bay leaf, sweet straw, a bit of skunkiness. Flavor is grass, toast, straw, crusty white bread, mild fruity notes and some nice lager yeastiness. Finish is bread, grass, light herbal notes and some mild but pleasant bitterness. Palate is thin and fairly dry, very crisp. Overall this is a very good all purpose, everyday session beer.
tasting at lake las vegas,golden pilsner color throughout..very strange smell.. solid flavour throughout..really a nice lager!!

(bottle from co-op, Long Stratton) Appearance was golden with brilliant fast bubbles and a pure thick white head. Saaz hop aroma, fruity with that classic skunk - very nice interesting smell. Great thick yet clear taste with lots of hop character and a bitter drying finish. Great lager with a good bit of bite.
A bitter beer that failed to satisfy.  I didn’t find much beyond the expected flavors for the style.

pours a pale yellow with a foamy white head.  poor retention.  mild aroma is malty with hints of lemongrass and spice.  tastes lightly spicy with decent pils malt backing and a hint of lemongrass.  mouthfeel is light and crisp.  pretty true to style and refreshing.
Pours a clear yellow with a nice head... Aroma of grassy hops and bready malts... Taste is clean, crisp with nice bready malts and grassy hops... Medium thin bodied...

[Look]: Light golden color with fairly nice head. 
[Smell]: Dry maltiness, grassy, floral, hint of honey. 
[Taste]: Rich maltiness, mild spicy and floral hops.  Light bodied.  Very clean and dry finish.  
[Overall]: Not bad.  Whole lot better than American Budweiser.  Worth a try.
12 oz bottle.  Pours gold with a thin white fizzy head.  Smells grainy and lightly skunked.  Tastes very crisp and refreshing.  Flavors of barley grain, corn and grasssy hops.  Pretty good beer.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a golden yellow with hints of copper and a thin, whispy white head.  Sweet, malty aroma with slight hints of lemony citrus.  Crisp, slightly bitter with a refreshing taste.  Reminds me of my time in Prague, when it felt weird ordering a "Budweiser."
Bottle. Gold pour with a two finger white head. Aroma is malts and some hops. Well balanced beer. Higher carbonation. Flavor is some hop bitters. Very drinkable.

nose of wet malts with a hint of hops. appearnace is very pale yellow. flavor is flowery, very lightly bitter. also big taste of cereal malt. palate is quick and ultra refreshing, perfect carb. overall a boring beer but still not even as interesting as some others of the style.

Blindtasted with the american version....what....a.....difference.
Nice dark golden look with a foamy white head. Fresh malty aroma with notes of barley and grassy hops. Soft sweet flavor and a medium clean bitterness.
Bottle. Clear golden colour with a small white head. Hoppy aroma with hints of grass. The flavour is sweet malty with some hops. Slightly bitter finish. Quite nice pilsener.

(bottle) pours a clear, pale golden colour with a frothy white head. generic aroma of grainy pale malts and herbal hops. flavour is the same, with a light touch of saaz. light-bodied with medium carbonation and a soft bitter finish.

Tap at the York - their Super Bowl special.  I have to say, it does remind me of Bud though this is fuller, cleaner and doesn’t make me want to bathe in tomato juice afterward.  Very slight lemon and grass, yeast, white grains.  Silky texture like an authentic Hef.
A lovely alcoholic and hoppy sting, accentuated by the high fizziness. Taste of hey. Leaves a wonderful feeling in your mouth. $8.99 six pack at the supermarket.
Simple brew with not much complexity.  Hop bitterness and alcohol taste predominate.  Distinct reminisce of Budweiser but a hair better.

330 mL. Pours a golden yellow with a small white head that dissipates quickly. Aromas of fresh grass, Saaz hops, and sweet corn. Taste is mostly corn with lots of carbonation. There is some orange peel and lemon zest in there too. Finishes with cardboard and metal. I’ll pass thank you.
Bottle. Clear golden colour with white head that doesn’t last long. A thin beer.

Draft. Pours clear, effervescent golden-yellow with a fluffy one-finger white head. Nose is a bit grassy, some dry, lightly sweet malt comes through as well. Taste is quite nice - clean and classic, with a light, crisp sweet malt note underneath the initial burst of carbonation, and a beautiful, light, grassy hit of saaz hops leads into a light finish with just a trace of lingering bitterness. Moderately-high carbonation over a medium-light body. Deliciously drinkable.

Golden yellow with a short white head.  Initial floral hoppy smell during the poor, then as that lingers in the glass a sweet malty aroma overpowers.  Light to medium body with smooth biscuity malt and small undertone of hop. Very simple.

The budvar has a very inviting aroma: First the saaz hops lurks from the glass, then a malty sweetness takes over like a sweet summer breeze from a corn field. Lots of barley to be noticed. After having enjoyed the aroma I turn my eyes to the colour of the beer. It’s a beautiful transparent yellow with a diminishing head. And then follows the first impression of flavour: An aggresive carbonatíon hits me at first, making it hard to actually taste anything. Then a slightly citric bitternes makes it presence, combined with a mellow sweet maltiness, like butter biscuits alongside some floral hoppiness. It is highly thirst arousing and satisfies every dream of a Czech lager.
As soon as you open the bottle you experience a light fruity aroma.  Unlike a lot of Czech lagers, the key character is the malt and not the hop.

Clear gold colour-bubbly white head. Aroma of malt, metal and cheap hops. Light-bodied; Sweet malt and some funky caramel flavours - not good at all! Aftertaste shows funk and cardboard-no good tastes there either! Overall, overrated - this isn’t worth trying at all! I sampled this twelve ounce bottle purchased from Whole Foods in Tyson’s Corner, Virginia on 17-September-2005.
500ml glass. Pleasant initial bitterness. Strong yeast and malt notes on the palate and a crisp finish. Light gold with a medium head.

Bottle. Pours gold with sticky white head. The aroma has a little bit of skunk at first, but that is replaced by lemon zest, hay, and grainy sweetness. The flavor is grain and clover honey with a finish of dry grass. A little bit bland, but ok.
its like a flat version of heiniken. its not bad golden pour with skunk aroma. Taste of slight hops, skunk and slightly acidic. fair

Fairly straightforward Czech lager.  Drinkable, but not distinctive. Of all the ones I tried over there, this was about how I remember them tasting.  Sort of sweet for the style, but not bad.  Golden color and sort of yeasty on the nose.  Finishes cleanly.
Nicely hopped example of a decent lager, very refreshing.  Pales in comparison to other Czech lagers and pilsners, but still very drinkable.

Jun 3, 2007  
Bottle in at Grand Hyatt Berlin. Golden colour. Foamy head. Skunky nose. Hoppy taste. Prickly. Smooth finish. Enjoyable. Surprised I hadn’t tasted this one yet.

pours a clear gold with a foamy white head. bubbly. grassy aroma with subdued citrus notes. taste is a nice balance of hop/malt, with the citrus of the hops coming on strong at the beginning and the malt smoothing it out later on. notes of bread and lemon are there, though it’s not an insanely complex beer. super refreshing, an awesome session brew. finish is the return of the bitter hops. nice prickly carbonation and a somewhat creamy mouthfeel. mid-bodied. used to drink this all the time when i lived in prague, and obviously it’s MUCH better/fresher over there, not to mention cheap as hell (about 80 cents for a .5L bottle, or $1.25 in a bar). if you buy it over here (US), i can imagine you’d be upset about the cost for what you get. but overall i think it’s an awesome brew, and a great intro for newbies.

clear gold color, mild white head dissolves into tiny white bubbles, lacy.  mild grainy nose, trace of grass.  flavor is mildy malty, slightly hoppy, touch of creaminess.  mouthfeel is a bit fizzy, medium bodied, light bitter finish.  quite enjoyable.  i got used to drinking this beer in the late 90s working in moscow.  i got this 6 pack at liquor depot in monee.
A good lager. Finally! Only downside is that it is sold in such small bottles mostly and can cost a bit but this actually tastes quite good.
Aroma of light hops, corn.  Flavor is clean and crisp.  Pretty good for what it is.  It does not get me super excited, but a step up from many within its style.
A experiência não foi muito boa. Talvez estivesse em uma temepratura não muito ideal. Aguardo uma nova oportunidade...
Clean aroma.  Very drinkable.  More hops than the American bud.  Golden color with fizzy white head.
Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma has grassy hops. Flavour is grainy and hoppy. Nice bitterness.

A - fruity and floral
A - clear, golden with little head
F - light sweet and bitter
P - crisp and dry
O - nice pilsner

(bottle) Clear, golden colour with a fluffy white head. Moderately sweet buttery malty nose with a flowery and slightly grassy hop-character. Sweet-bitter flavour, light to medium bodied with a crispy mouthfeel. Balanced malty sweetness and hoppy bitterness with flowery and herbal accents. A pleasant to drink and easy-going classic (28.XI.08).
Bottle. Pours gold with a white head. Sweet grainy/bready malt with light hops. Clean malt profile with grain and hoppy hints. Pretty good.

12oz – Perfect Pour.  Gold, fizzy white head.  Floral bready aromas ride soft notes of peppery toasted caramel.  Soft toasted caramel flavors balance very well on a light floral grassy hop finish.  Light bodied with soft carbonation.  Super session beer…
Fresh grass and a hint of dark lime rind. Hoppy and green in the mouth. Its a good beer for summer and picnics. Pilsner Urquell pips it at the post though.

500ml bottle. White head, yellow color. Aroma has more malts than hops. Low carb on palate. Flavor is more pilsene-llike than aroma: bitterish with hops, some malts at the end. OK, but from two classics, liked the Pilsner Urquell better.

This is the first time that I have had this, although I have had the opportunity to drink this in Eastern Europe, I have always passed it up. Clean aromas of sweet malts and some hops, flavor is clean and light, much better than the typical lager... drink ability is very high.

50 cl bottle at Skallerup Klit. Clear golden color, moderate and disappering white head. Aroma is malt with some sweetness, hints of hops and citrus. Flavor is malty, grassy and sweet with fine bitterness. Nice pilsener!

On draught. A clear golden colored beer, with a thick white head. It disappears quickly. The aroma of malt, hop and citrus. The taste is hoppy bitter, with malts and fruits like citrus. A fresh beer. The aftertaste is smooth bitter.
Bottle. Pours a golden yellow color. Decent Euro Pilsner. clean crisp, balanced. Better than Budweiser in America

Pours a beautiful golden yellow with a nice thick white head.  Plenty of spicy hop aromas with hints of floral perfumes and clove.  Full bodied with satisfying mouth-feel and carbonation.  Sweet malt taste quickly gives way to a crescendo of hop bitterness which lingers on into a nice, long tapering finish with suggestions of yeasty dough, mown hay, and hints of caramel.  Well balanced, and a great reference to keep in mind.  Try with a hearty onion soup or beef broth.
Fantastic pilsner. Hoppy and crisp yet mellow and warm at the end. Classic.

I was so pleased when I first had this to learn it wasn’t actually made by Budweiser....It’s a very solid pilsner, with added floral hops and a nice grain characteristic that makes the beer very smooth.  This is a good go-to beer, and brings back memories of Prague.

Good heavy hoppy and fruity aroma with minor malt notes. Impresive large, white and frothy head with good lacing. The sparkling, yellow pilsner calls for pouring dawn the throut. 

Starts light sweet and bitter an ends with a more moderate bitter flavor. Lively, dry feeling says "One more beer, please Now"

on tap at The Field in Dania.  Golden pour, white head.  Pretty boring grainy, malty aroma with a hint of hops.  Flavor is typical for the style.  A style that I find myself steering away from more and more each day.

Poured from bottle a golden with small white head that fades quickly.  Aroma was initially slightly spicy with yeast and hops, then sweet malt and grassy hay notes.  Flavor is mild and round with lighty sweet malt, bread, and slightly tart grass and hay.  There is a nice balance of light sweetness and mild bitterness that makes this one easy to drink as well as good company for food.

Earthy, grassy aroma, with some bready malt-like qualities thrown in.  Crystal clear golden color, persistent white foam.  The flavor is of malt sweetness, slight twinge of hops.  The finish starts with a syrupy sweetness, and gives way quickly to a clean hiop bite.  This is far from my favorite style, but this beer is good for what it is.

I don’t know which amuses me more, that anyone would fight over the name of such a crappy brew--pick either Budweiser, they both suck--or that this sad little brew could rack up a 66 percentile rating on ratebeer. It tastes like tap water with a touch of syrup, a bit of tin, and a few random notes of lawn clippings. Lovely.

Quality, golden pilsener, but still a bit lacking to Urquell.

Pours nicely, golden color.  Nicely balanced between the malt and saaz, but finished a bit on the bitter side.  I think that Urquell manages to be a bit more bold without the "rubbery" aftertaste of this one.  

Slighly on the fizzy side.  Still, quite enjoyable in spite of the finish.  Perhaps I have a pack that’s a bit less fresh than the Urquell I am used to drinking.  Overall, this is a bit of an easier drinkr than Pilsener Urquell...  It just finishes a bit strangely and leaves a significant aftertaste.  Otherwise, no complaints.
I’m a sucker for a good Pilsner, and this is one of the best. Slightly sweet and fruity, and with the trademark Saaz hops. Lovely.

I am glad I finally got to try this. Had in 0.5 L bottle at Bottlescrew Bills, Calgary, AB. Pours a bright golden colour with a light white head. Aroma of bready, malts, caramel and light fruit/ Flavour is predominantly malty and grassy hops. Light bodied pilsener. Very drinkable and very refreshing.
Bouteille verte 500ml.  Belle pilsner blonde produisant pratiquement aucune mousse.  Le gout est tres rafraichissant.  Aussi solide qu’une Urquell.

Bottle.  Pure golden, low near-white head. Sweet bready malts and light fruity hops in the aroma. Well rounded flavors from refined malts and fresh, fruity and floral/grassy  bittering hops. Light to medium body. Oily mouthfeel. Sweetish, light bitter finish.  Well composed and balanced, high drinkability.
Golden colour with medium white head.Aroma is sweet hoppy and mild has sometaste of hay.Body is medium/light and flavor is strong with dry finish.
50cl Bottle. A dry, hoppy and a bit sweet pilsener. Overall dry mouthfeel and quite strong flavours. Nice.
Really this is rather over rated in many ways. Always too expensive a bottle i find really.... its quite nice and fizzy the budweiser name is off putting.

12oz bottle: Solid gold pour with a frothy head and champagne like bubbles swirling throughout.  Fantastically clean nose with an abundance of grassiness and honeyed malt.  The malts are buttery and sweet on the tongue, balanced by a blast of pine needles and rind.  Very drinkable, but packed with complexity.

Bottle from Belmont Station in Portland, OR--Poured a light straw golden bottle with a beefy white head and lots of bubbles rising through body. Spicy, grassy, skunky nose.  Grainy with a some flowery prickly notes.  Finished rather dry but pretty mild all around.  Well built and sessionable.

Pours a very clear yellow colour with not much head to speak of.  Nose is some flowery hops, not much else.  Flavour is crisp and very sweet, and a little bit flowery, otherwise, pretty bland.  Carbonation is ok, and it’s about as watery as you’d expect it to be.

Had in bottle at bar 35 in Honolulu.  Not sure if this really was as good as the can version that I tried while in Switzerland.  Nevertheless, aroma is pleasant of hops and flowers, palate is refreshing.  Flavor is mild, and contains some upfront sweetness and flowers.  Later, this beer settles down with a hint of bitterness at the end.  For this style, you gotta give this brew some props!

Though I am usually not a fan of lighter beers or lagers in general, this created quite the positive impression on me.  Overall, I found it similar to Pilsner Urquell, though I felt it had a more subtle flavor overall.  Poured a pale, clear golden color with a finger of head.  Has a spicy, hoppy aroma, but nothing too strong.  Slight malty flavor at the front gives way to a nice, sharp hop flavor towards the back of the tongue.  Leaves little aftertaste.  A very nice summer beer much like Urquell.  The Czechs have impressed me again.

(Bottle, almost 5 months past "best by" date).  Typical hoppy aroma.  Golden yellow with a thin white head.  Surprisingly flavorful, with clean hops and a touch of bitterness.  Sweeter, and not as good as Urquell, but a creditable Pils nonetheless.
Bottle - golden beer with white head. Hop aroma! Hop flavor and bitter finish.
Superb bohemian pilsener. Floral hops, light to medium bodied. Really refreshing. Barley maltiness make for a good base. Better than the praised Urquell imo...

Bottle. Gold color but darker than your avrage lager. Nice white head. Hop aroma and a hint of grain. Light palate and very smooth. Flavor is a hop start with a slightly bitter finish. I’m not a big lager fan but this is one good beer!

Bottle. A clear golden beer with a beautiful, fluffy white head. Hop aromas, with the occasional note of bread and a dominant tobacco nose. A thirst-quenching freshness. Light in body, smooth palate texture with an OK bitterness, though has an abrupt finish.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a golden color with a small white head that dissipated quickly.  Aroma of metal and skunk with a hint of malts.  I don’t know if I got a bad batch but i thought this was pretty lousy.  The beer has absolutely no character or depth whatsoever but I don’t expect much out of lagers particularly when they’re owned by a macro multinational.

Slightly more depth than its AB counter part in colour, flavor, and aroma. Fulfills the requirements of a typical pilsner as its crisp, lite, and refreshing. Not outstanding and definitely not worth the $10 i spent the 6 pack. Ive wanted to try this for a long time so Im dealing with the price but I dont think ill be having this again anytime soon.
Clear blond coloured beer with small white head and medium carbonation. Herby spicy aroma. Full palate. Finish is sweet herby and spicy.
gold blond coloured sparkling body with a white head a grainy hoppy aroma a grainy hoppy fruity taste with a hoppy bitter finish
Darker blond coloured beer with lots of carbonation and a small white head. Fruity, hoppy and bitter aroma. Full bitter palate. Finish is bitter and very hoppy, nice balanced and good pilsener. Nice
Pours a weak golden color with a white head. Aroma was really grainy and grassy. Flavor was much the same, very bland and malty.
(bottle BB 05.04.09): Pours a golden yellow body, big frothy head, lasting. Malty aroma, grainy, some nuts. Somewhat dusty, grainy, mineral watery. Refreshing.
Golden in color with a white head that dissipates away.  Crisp and hoppy with good crispness making it very drinkable as a session beer.

Sitting outside on a hot Texas evening and grabbed one of these out of the icebox. Damn that feels funny...11.2 oz!!!Okay, the portion size leaves a little to be desired but the beer made up for it. Nice aroma with a little bite to the taste with a strong finish. Hoppy, malty with everything I like in a good beer. Glad this is finally on the shelves locally.

Bottle.  Pours a golden color with a decent white head that fades away.  Taste is of malt, hops and is fairly bitter.  Has a nice grassy hop aroma.  This is a pretty good beer to have, especially when on sale, but I’d rather go with Pilsner Urquell.  On a side note, it comes in a neat bottle.

I really liked the one.  The first thing I noticed was the nice aroma was quite strong.  Very good taste with just a slightly bitter after taste.  Basically that was the only real flaw I find in this beer.  Definitely a beer that would go great at lunch or dinner!

Finally available locally. Sampled from an old imported “Budweiser Budvar” tulip. Deep gold with a faint loden hue, fast fizzy head that quickly vanishes, and no lace.  The aroma is lightly skunked, but not unpleasantly so, with candy-nutty malt, fresh cigar, earthy spice, and cornhusk scents. Malty, sweetish flavor…toasty and cedary… toasted oat cereal finish, spicy bitterness, some saltiness, minty aftertaste. Medium bodied and a little sugary. This, the real B-weiser, is superior in every respect by orders of magnitude to fizzy AB pisswater.
Widely available in Inverness, okay draught in Bar Pivo.  Golden in colour, a little lighter than pilsner urquell.  Not a bad taste, not mind-blowing however.

12oz bottle, brilliantly clear, 1cm head that fades down to a trace, rich golden color. Smells of sweet malt and spicy hops. Taste is pleasant, a twinge of skunk as noted by previous rater (green glass?) good body, maybe a bit dextrinous or slight underattenuation, strong hop presence, sets the bar for the US Budweiser- if only AB would brew theirs like this, more people here would at least begin to understand what good beer is.

I would love it if this beer was a nice bo pils, but I worry greatly about the damn green bottle. 12oz bottle, served in a NB worthy snifter. (I’m not going to dirty another glass at 2:15AM). Aroma is lightly kilned malt and light herbal and floral hops. A bit of skunking, but it seems to have gassed off, mostly. Just to add an odd note, when I smell this beer I think of Long John Silver. Why? The beer doesn’t smell like fish, maybe it smells like the batter or the hushpuppies, I have no idea. The flavor is crackers and herbal, somewhat bitter, hops. This is pretty tasty, but I am sure it pales in comparison to this a little more fresh. No Bud drinker would get this confused with Budweiser, you can actually taste the malt and hops that go into it.

11.2 oz Czechvar bottle poured into a pilsener glass. Gold in color with a disappointingly small white head that dissipates quickly, leaving only a thin film of lace.

Aroma is grassy with a pale malt base. No skunk despite the green bottle.

Flavor is cereal grainy with a touch of sweetness. Grassy hops and a little lemon round this pilsener out.

Crisp and mostly clean on the finish. A little light on carbonation for the style. Very drinkable.
Draught. Golden color, white head. Sweet malty aroma, balanced taste. Pretty good, but perhaps just slightly too bitter.

Very strong hoppy scent.  Very orange pour with negligible head.  Very hoppy taste, though somewhat grainy.  Definately way more taste then a "Bud".  Something a bit malty in the finish.  Lingering bitter aftertaste I was not impressed with.

Can:  Clear yellow colour, with nice head.
Aroma of hops, malts and som citric nose in the end. Flavor is almost the same here, has a smal body, easy to drink, but still a nice lager beer. Short hopy fiish. Nice
the 12 is something to behold. Go straight to the top - even with Kidney stones this beer was allowed in the hospital by doctors

6-21-08 bottle 

Clear yellow with no lasting head.  Smell is light doughy sweetness but is super light.  Flavor is light and watery with some doughiness to it.  Very light wih a doughy aftertaste.  Moderate carbonation.  Overall, not horrid but just okay.

330ml bottle, served chilled. Beautifully clean pale golden body, white foam. Grainy malt on the nose, slightly sweet, touch of spicy grassy hops. Moderate soft carbonation, smooth mouthfeel, full bodied verging on sweet but way too well balanced to jump over that line. Plenty of grainy pilsner-style malt on the body, grassy hops and a faint apple fruitiness. Finish is clean and mildly bitter. Well balanced and a joy to drink.
cannot believe I overlooked inputting this one. average pils pour and aroma, but has a well done flavor with a bitter kick that gives it some zing.

On Draft in prague- Tyn Court. Pours a clear golden with ok head. Aroma of hops, and flavor a bit bittersweet with some metallic notes. Sweeter and less bitter than Urquell...but Urquell to me is better.
Prefer it to the US Bud but still average at best. A reasonable pilsener. Drinkable but a bit lacking of character. Not one of the best lagers.

Bottle. Pours a clear yellow with a big white head. Sweetish hop aroma. Some citrus notes. Apple and alcohol notes as it warms. Flavour is a bit of hops with malt in the background, but nothing special. Mildly bitter finish. Pretty boring really. 04-07-08.

Pours a pretty golden color, very little head. No noticeable aroma. Flavor is pretty standard for a premium pilsner. Nothing too out there. Nothing bad though. Pretty smooth. No real hop taste or malt taste, no real bitterness either. Ah well, overall pretty solid.

On tap in Prague.
Smooth and nice, both maltiness and hops, a very decent lager. But it is no match for the unfiltered version, which blows this away!

Green 12oz bottle served in a footed pilsener glass. Gold in color with a fluffy white head, very little carbonation is visible in the beer. Sweet, skunky aroma wafts from the glass, man I hate green bottles. Tastes of wet grain, saw dust, & herbal hops. Not bad but not nearly as good as I expected it to be.

Bottle. Clear yellow to orange. Medium head and nice lace. Fresh aroma with grassy hops and medium maltiness. OK fresh hops, though not very aromatic. Medium malty flavor is slightly buttery. The finish is medium bitter and has some caramel. Light to medium body and soft mouthfeel. The finish is quite pleasant and even lasts for a while. Overall a very clean pilsner that is pleasant to drink. Aromas could be richer and more complex.

Bottle. Best by 3/09 so it seems fresh. Bright yello with no head and large carb bubbles.Nice malty and hoppy nose. Taste is a bit skunky, light hops, malt background, and bitter on the end. Light body with a bit of lingering acidity after drinking. Overall a good, lighter bodied pils that’s easy drinking a great for our hot, humid summers.

Appearance: Very pale, dark yellow. Almost not head at all.
Aroma: Fruity, hint of hops.
Taste: Hint of hops, very fresh. Little bit fruity.
Info: 330ml bottle, 7/10-2005, 35/300, 21/500

From bottle. This beer is much better on tap in Europe. Skunky aroma, sweet honey. Thin white head. Clear golden appearance with lively carb. Citrus and herbs in the flavour. A little bitter. Not my favourite style.

Bottle, Kegs & Barrels in McKinney, TX.
Pours a nice clear golden color with white head. Aroma was just slightly skunky with the bottle I had, it was also 1 month past the &quotBest before Date&quot. Flavor is a good balance of malt and hops without being too heavy. Palate is high carbonation with light to medium mouthfeel.....Over all, it was very good.

Pours a medium gold color with quickly dissapating head.  Smell is yeasty, lightly malty and nothing too noteable.  Taste is very yeasty with crisp maltiness and is slightly refreshing, save the heavy yeasty component.  Decent, but not one of my favorite pilsners, nor worthy of being world famous...

From a green 355 ml. North American released bottle with a listed expiration date of 02.11.09. I don’t see the words &quotBudweiser Budvar&quot anywhere on the label.   Pours a golden yellow with almost no head.  The aroma of fresh malts is evident and pleasing. Very enticing. Medium mouthfeel.  Malts and barley in the taste   But I am struck by how fresh it tastes altogether.  It has a dry aftertaste.  Is this really the recipe that Augustus Busch I &quotborrowed&quot in the 1800’s to brew  Budweiser in America?  If so, he got it wrong.

bottle.. clear straw yellow pour , thin white head , no lacing .aroma of pilsner malt, sweet and grainy and at touch of grass. flavor is much the same with a metallic bitter dry finish . thin ,soapy. I dont like pilsner and Im reminded why by this one .
Right appearance. Cooked veggies, diacetyl,  grainy. Malty, sweet, with a faint metallic light bitter end.

On tap at CBG Exbeerience. Clear gold with a white head. Lightly hoppy bread aroma.Watery body, medium carbonation. Biscuit and floral taste. Finish tending to crisp. Seems a little corn-y but maybe that’s just me.

99% sure I have the right rating.  Green bottle labeled as Czechvar 5% abv.  Clear yellow with a slight white head that disappears.  Slight green bottle skunk in the nose otherwise, typical pilsener nose of light malts and a small hop nose.  Smooth on the tongue into a slight bittering finish.  I think this could be much better if it were fresh or in a brown bottle.  But as it is, a good, easy to find pilsener.
bright gold/vitamin b color, tall fluffy temporary head. dry wheaty aroma, dusty saaz. sweet and creamy, long dry soft hop finish. I need a 2 L mug to properly enjoy this.
your swetness is my weekness lots of bubbles and a straw yellow pour pre budweiser vey yummy if bud tasted like this it would be my friend Belgains leave are american beer alone

500 mL pour on tap at a restaurant in Prague on 6/5.  Straw yellow pour with a pillowy white head.  Sweet grainy aroma and flavor.  Nothing offensive about it, but I’m just not huge on pilsners and this beer really didn’t change my mind on that.  Decent, but nothing special either.

Bottled. Lovely golden colour. Strong aroma of malt and hops. Well balanced flavour with a hint of honey(?) and a dry bitter finish. The best beer that I can buy at my local cheap Indian off licence. Perfect with a summer BBQ or a curry. I drank it in the mid 80s on draght in Prague. That was alot better.

i tasted this at the brewery. it was one of the best expressions of the style that i’ve encountered. straw-gold color, appropriately  carbonated, clean on the palate and wonderfully hoppy. 
great looks in the glass and a medium-long, typical finish.

Draught (Traveller’s Pub,Tallinn) - A rich golden colour with a white head and moderate carbonation. Grassy and citric aroma. Clean tasting and easy to drink. Well balanced with the malt and hops. Some citric notes. Refreshing.

Melhor pilsen até agora. Cheiro muito bom de lúpulo, bom mesmo. Aparência normal, amarelo ouro com espuma branca, mas a aparência ganha mesmo na garrafa, muito bonita. Densa e com gosto de lúpulo bom. Muito agradável. Suave sabor de especiarias. amargor bem balanceado.

I know it’s not a A-B Budweiser and all but IMO, it’s not that much better than it.  I’m not a Pilsener guy so that’s probably part of it right there.  Poured golden yellow from a green bottle  with a medium white head that went away fast.  Green bottle skunk overpowers the aroma, along with grassy and perhaps saaz hops.  Taste is watery and crisp with an astringent light hop finish.  Mostly malted with some corn adjuncts in there as well.

The aroma is of spicy/grassy hops with a small bit of delicate malt. The beer pours a nice clear golden color, and maintains a decent head. The flavor is nice, once again dominated by hop bitterness, however without allowing some nice delicate malt flavor. The flavors are strongly bitter and peppery.
330ml bottle. Easy to drink pilsener with fruity aroma and grassy hop flavour. Nice and refreshing.

Green bottle, LCBO.  Medium yellow, decent sized white head.  Mild grainy aroma, faint hops.  Taste is nice - crisp hops, light but werll carbonated and soft mouthfeel, really nice hop linger with a little sweetness.  I would love to try this fresh, or even in a non light struck can/bottle.
Pours a golden yellow color with a small white head. Nice biscuity grain aroma. Nice smooth body and  flavor with a nice crisp finish.

Pours clear, golden colour, small quickly disappearing head. Dry, carbonated mouthfeel. Malty aroma, grassy notes, a fair amount of hops, a hint of buttery feel, some dry bitterness. Could have a bit stronger body.

Re-rate because I underrated this before. 0,5l bottle @ Barona Areena. Pours clear golden with a medium head. Aroma is slightly sweet grainy malts. Flavor is sweet grainy malts, notes of honey and some hops. Great within its style.
blindtest. fruity aroma. not much to say except i thought it was a very thin beer.

this brew pours a light, golden, sparkling and medium sized white head. soft, malty character with little citrusy fruit. Shame on AB for stealing the name and props to this brewery for making a great beer for all these years.

Draught beer.  Not quite what it was a few years ago but still one of the best lagers available.  Excellent balance between malt body and hoppy bitterness with a good citrus element in the finish.  If not handled correctly it can have a truly nasty taste to it so only have the draught at a venue with a good reputation.

Clear golden yellow color.  A bit creamy head is white. Aroma is fresh: malt, butter. Butter can be observed much better from flavor which is also malty and smoothly hoppy. Palate is oily and greasy, light-bodied.

33 cl bottle from Systembolaget. Nice golden color with a small head. The aroma is slightly quite malty with some light hops. Same with the flavor, malty with a pretty good bitterness and actually some very light fruitiness (drank this on tap in Prague last year, and that was even better...). This is one of the best mass produced Czech beers out there imo.

33cl bottle from Systembolaget Charlotteberg. It poured a golden color with a small head that vanishes quickly in the glass. It has a bitter malty aroma. The flavor is slightly bitter and tastes of malts and syrup. One of the best lagers I’ve ever tasted.
500ml bottle: Golden with no head.  Hoppy nose with notes of caramel.  Bready malt flavour; traces of corn.  Somewhat sticky body with a nice balanced bitter finish.

Golden colour, with the slightest hint of red. Foamy white head that dissipated quickly. Malty aroma with a hint of hops. Flavour was somewhat malty, but overall fairly bland with the suggestion of hops and some bitterness & a slight skunkyness. A decent, if unremarkable pilsner.

500ml bottle. 

Medium golden yellow, clear beer with a good sized white head that fades a little quick. Aroma is sweet with some flowery hops. Flavour is a bit dry with some crisp hops and some mustardy acidity. A drinkable pils but not much more.

Pour from a green bottle.  Clear golden with a fizzy big white head that settles quickly.  Some malty vegetable aroma, along with the slight smell of copper.  Malty slightly sweet flavor with just a touch of hop bite on the finish.  A thousand times better than Bud, but still not great.
golden with mild head.  flavor is of mild maltiness with a nice hop crispness.  a solid pilsner, no doubt.  a decent beer

Golden-orange, decent cloudy head, bit of apple and a soft bready nose. Minerally, not much hops, a bit of lingering vegetal sweetness in the finish. Green bottle in Ontario might not be the best way to experience. Not my preferred pils.

0.33l, green bottle "Czechvar" version, bb 12/10/08. Clear golden with a 4-finger head that quickly settles into a somewhat lasting quarter-inch ring. Initial aroma is pure skunk; later fades to some corn, honey and grainy grass. Flavor is similar, disappointingly more skunk-dominated than the smell. Light-medium body is smooth crisp and tingly. Had the Budvar version on draft in Europe about 15 years ago and thought it was pretty good, so gave the rating a few more points than otherwise would. Can’t recommend the green bottled version though.
Again, just not the same after bottling and shipping to the US.  The real budweiser is a thoroughly enjoyable classic Bohemian pilsner, with a bit of sweetness.
Yellow straw color with a thin head. Simple brew with not much complexity.  Hop bitterness is lot and it has some malty character.  Distinct reminisce of Budweiser but somewhat better.
Pale gold in colour,carbonation good,with a good head.Aroma  grainy,bread notes.Flavour,mild hops and malt bit watery though certainly not the best from the Czech Republic.Finish is weak,dry bit off.
12 oz. green bottle.  Pours golden yellow with little head.  Aroma was a hint of citrus with some light malt.  Flavor was crisp, a little bitter.  Light body, could probably drink a ton of these.

Rated: 02.01.2008

Bottle green 500ml, extract of wort 12%

Appearance:Pours nice deep, classically Bohemian Pilsener body in its colour, with very nice soft body carbonation. Head is medium initially, than decreases to small, gives some considerable traces of lacing. Body is shiny and perfectly clear without any sediment. Body colour is deep golden, intensive and essential but not as carbonated as Budweiser Budvar 10%.

Aroma:Very nice, strong, aromatic herbal and citrusy notes of Zatec hops. Great, fat malted body, medium to full. Barley, grainy, crispy, bisquity, juicy, even a bit oily, sweet aroma. Very pleasant stuff. There is all you would expect from a good Bohemian Pilsener style.

Flavour:Front is aromatic, flowery, grassy and citrusy, refreshing. Than the bitterness comes through your tongue and sticks to your palate. Later on there is this wonderfull, aromatic, herbal, hoppy nise and no skunkness at all. Fat in malt, medium to full bodied, grainy, crispy, grapefruit, lemon and lime hints. No additional sugar but there is a natural sweetness from malt, being almoust syrupy like and perfectly balanced with hoppy bitterness.

Palate:Body is medium to full, texture is dry, with strong bitterness on palate due to sharp hoppyness, finish feel is citrusy, fat in malt, long, some hints of chalkyness but again dominated by hops. There is no place for alcohol in perception.
its only when you drink this you realise that budweiser really is a poor second cousin. this is a quality pilsner, cant get enough of it

(cleaning out my beer bottle collection as pictured in my profile and utilizing ratebeer.com)
As I recall, this was a typical czech pilsner with hopp and bitter tones.

Back from a Czech Republic pub-crawl this is part of my express ratings for the “typical” Světlý 11°- (Czech light Pils), Světlý 12°+ (Czech Pils), Polotmavý (Czech Amber Lagers) and Tmavý (Czech Black Lagers).  Non-typical beers will receive personalized descriptions after the express ratings.
----------------------------------------------------------------

How: Tap late-night (when all the good beer bars are closed) at some very cool pub in Prague but with a sucky beer selection

The look: Clear blonde body with a short-lived white head

To me a typical Czech Světlý 12° and above is: Well malted body with plenty of biscuits and cereals.  Sweetness level is in the light-medium range with some honey flavours and a light caramel presence (3/4 honey, 1/4 caramel).  Fruity flavour limited to a light citrus flavour.  Medium carbonation.  Finish is dry and moderately bitter with a light citric touch.  After-taste of dry grassy/herbal hops with a light dry spiciness character.

This one: As above but watered down and way too clean.  Lacks character compared to most other Czech Světlýs.  Way superior to the North America beer with the same name.  I just had to try the original on tap.

Single bottle from Total Wine in Jacksonville, FL.  Pours a nice golden color with a small head.  Aroma is a light malt nose.  Taste is smooth, with a bit of a hops bite on the end, but yet this is another good example of what the Czechs do right with their beer
12 0z. bottle,  no head at all slight bitter taste, smooth though with some hops also
On tap in Praha. Golden colour with small white head. Hoppy aroma, smooth on the palate.. An enjoyable pilsener.

Pretty golden color.  Fluffy but thin head, no lacing at all.  Nose of malt and corn.  Grainy taste with a slightly hoppy finish.  A reasonably good Pilsener, but not an outstanding one.  I like Urquel much better.

On tap in a Czechvar glass.  Golden beer with white head.  Crisp malt/hop aroma.  Body is medium overall, but good for a pilsener.  Not as full and sweet as Pilsener Urquell.  Dry, hoppy finish.  Pleasant beer.

Bottle poured into footed pilsner- poured transparent light golden yellow, thin white head went away a little too quickly as desired, no lacing, very light carbonation.  Aroma of light malt and grass.  Hits the mouth with a defined light body, malt is easily detectable and even enjoyable, finish has a slightly bitter finish.  When compared in a double blind taste test set up by the bartender, I prefered this over the US version of Budweiser.  And I kinda like USA Bud... take that for what it is.  Good example of the style.
At La Tortula. Bottle: Crisp, clean, refreshing. Hops present at a lighter scale that other pilseners. Good session beer.

Pours gold with a small white head. Not much lacing. 
Aroma is skunky. I assume it is from the green glass bottle.
Taste is crisp and clean. Slightly dry hop finish. First impression is too sweet but the bitter hops balance the malts very well. 
Palate is smooth and dry.
Overall this could be the best lager on the planet without the skunk aroma. Will try again to find a better example to review.

You, know, I really think this is better than Urquell.  Its got the aroma, the taste, the body, the whole package.  All the Urquells I ever tasted here in Michigan are old and skunky-tasting.  I wish all pilsners could taste like this one.

A very fine Pilsner brew.  Not quite as good as Pilsner Urquell, but still a fine beer.  Nice carbonation, very refreshing, strong flavor in the end.  Taste like yeast and has a bite to it.  I love this beer, but with food I find it limited, in that is goes well with greasy food, but not much else.

Pours clear golden color with white head that disappears quickly. Grassy aroma. Slight flavor of hops and maybe some malt. Light to medium body with crisp carbonation. Would be very refreshing on a hot summer day.
500mL bottle from the LCBO.  Pours gold, with a fluffy white head.  Biscuity aroma.  Flavour isn’t as quite as crisp or biscuity as Pilsner Urquell, but still a very good beer.

I’ll leave it to others to wax poetic-but I will say I couldn’t find anything wrong with this beer. It doesn’t knock your socks off, but it so refreshing without tasting like a typical lawnmowing pilsner. It has a little weight to it, a little substance. This Budweiser  IS the real King of bottled beer! I seldom drink more than 2 pt/day--but I could drink about 10 of these babies.

Bottle. Yellow with a white head. Malty on the nose - bread, cookie dough and grass. Flavour begins with some malty sweetness with notes of bread and cookie dough. Nt much bitterness to talk about. Feels somewhat diluted. Boring - where the heck is the bitterness?

Bottle. Bought this because Ive never seen it sold as a single in the states. Light skunk aroma. The taste was better than I thought it would be - way less skunky than I predicted. Nice solid pilsner, probably one of the best Ive had.
Pours a  clean golden color with a medium foamy head.   Grassy but mildy skunky aromo, with a taste of slightly sweet hops.

Grassy and fruity nose.  Crystal clear and yellow gold, with a frothy head.  Clean sweet honey taste with great balance.  Very smooth overall with a nice finish.  
One of the best Pilseners available.

Golden yellow/pale green tinges. Has a clean and crisp hopped aroma. Great saaz hops taste, with a medium body that provides a ton of pure lagered beer flavor. Even hints towards some bittersweet tones. Heavily carbonated and, true to the style, starts to taste a bit meaty and grainy as it warms. However this, when you drink it cold, its about as good a lager as they come.

Actually had this beer in the US as "Czechvar". According to Michael Jackson, this was actually the original Budweiser (which I don’t care for). However, this original Czech version is not as grainy or strong tasting as Bud, but is tempered with the flavor of some of the lighter Europeans like Urquell. Pilsnar is not my favorite style, but this is not a bad beer, especially served cold.

Bottle.  Poured gold with a thick fast dissipating white head.  Skunky aroma (it was in a green bottle) that went away and was replaced by a fresh hay aroma.  Malty lager flavour.  Light bitterish finish.  This is not the equal of Pilsener Urquell, but would make a serviceable session pilsener.
Nem vagyok nagy lager rajongó de ez bizony ízlik.Aranysárga szín és szép fehér tömör hab jellemzi.Íze édeskés.malátás,kerek.Utóíze keserédes és hosszan tart.Az amerikai Budnak van még mit tanulnia!
Two 500ml bottles poured into my 1L beer mug.  Pours a beautiful gold color with a foamy white head that doesn’t last too long.  Flavor: Malty, with medium hops.  Overall:  This beer is awesome.

a clear gold beer with a small white head.  fresh aroma of honey, corn flakes, and hops.  flavor is toasted malts,  toasted corn flakes, honey, light hops and a touch of brown sugar.  this stuff is good.
Man möge mir verzeihen, aber dieses Bier ist mein absolutes Lieblingsbier!!
This golden ale poured with a decent white head and a funky barnyard aroma. The flavor start off sweet and malty, but quickly turns to bitter hops. It is refreshing and clean, but not real tasty.
Golden pour, thick frothy white head. Skunky malt aroma with a dash of Czech hops. Mildy sweet flavor with a crisp hop finish. Not bad for a pils.

Got this in Munich, excellent beer. Of course i love this beer because it has a long ongoing fued with Budweiser in the states, that is why all Budweiser products go by "Bud" in all of Europe. Good lager, hoppy and aromatic with a very crisp and malty finish.
from the tap poured golden with a good amount of head.  Nice crisp flavor with a quick finish.

Bottle from Trader Joe’s.  Pours golden yellow with a small white head. Sweet malty aroma mixed in with some skunk.  Palate is a little skunky with malt and slight hops.  Better than BUD.  Ok beer for a lager.
Clear golden with medium white head. Sweet malty aroma with light hoopy notes. Flavor is slightly malty with distinct hoppy notes.
Looks, smells, and tastes like the Budweiser  we’re all familiar with in the States.  However it is crisp and refreshing, and goes down easy.

I had this in the 16oz can and would like to find it on tap, might have a better body.  Clear gold, decent taste compared to the American BUD standard.  Small white head, kind of plane really.  Better than regular BUD.
Aroma is a bit unimpressive, as is the taste. But it is clean, refreshing. Mouthfeel is nice if only a little watery.
Not to be confused with Budweiser, this is a great beer. Rated it amongst the best at my one trip to BEERTOPIA.

My bottle doesn’t look like the picture, it just says Czechvar, "premium czech lager." An amber beer with a small white head that disappears quickly. Aroma is light malt and maybe some corn or other grains. Taste is thin, some vague maltiness and then a finish like water. I was under the impression that this is supposed to be good beer, but is only slightly better than any other mainstream European lager. Perhaps they save the good stuff for Europe and send watery crap to America?

tap at san diego brewing co - Pours clear golden with a thin white head.  It smells of sweet pale malts and some mild hops.  It’s light and easy drinking without being terribly watery.  This mildly hopped session brew isn’t great, but it’s a damn sight better than another "Budweiser" we all know.

Poured from can. Beautiful rich golden color with a modest head. Smells of sweet grains; very pleasant. Sweet up front, then you taste the hops. Great finish. Obviously, this beer puts American Budweiser to shame.

Difficult to give an accurate description of the beer fresh out of the liquor store; as this was cellared for close to two years before I got to it. 
Pours golden with a loose white head. Contains flecks like a trappist beer but that may be due to age. Sweet, fruity malts with grains blended in nicely. Lightly hopped. Thick, creamy palate is the way that a lager should taste.
12 oz. bottle, pours a clear gold body with white head.  Aroma is malty and grainy.  Flavor is the same with a light crisp malt finish.  Slight carbonation on the tongue.  Somewhat sticky aftertaste.
Bottle. Poured an amber golden color. Aroma is malt and water. Taste is smooth with a water finish.

On Tap at Bayview Wine Tasting in Milwaukee.  Pours golden clear with a medium white head.  Aroma, sweet malts, light fruits, grains and some hops.  Feels like a bit of light carbonation on the tongue, a bit light on the palate, but thicker than american pilsners.  The finish is a bit sweet and light bit of hops. very drinkable beer.
a very good beer. crisp yet flavorful. nice maltiness. worth going out of your way to pick a a six pack. not that expensive for a hard to find import

Bottle. Golden color with a white head. Aroma: Sweet malt, lemon, light butter, honey, grass and some hops.
Flavor: Sweet malt, grass, floral hops, light citrus, light butter, crispy. Good hop bitterness in the finish. My favorite bottled Czech lager.
I got this in a bottle, poured into a pilsener glass. Not a very attractive smell. The taste was thin and underdeveloped. Not an undrinkable beer, but I wouldn’t go after it anytime soon.
Bottle. thin white head, sweet floral aroma with e little hops. a little sweet taste with a bitter but not much. A good pilsener.
