Nice golden body with a diminishing bubbly head. Fresh hoppy nose with some floral and herbal notes. Mouthfeel is fairly carbonated and taste is hoppy with some discreet metallic hints. Decent bitter final. The real Budweiser is a very good pils but remains a step under the Pilsner Urquell.

Pours an apple juice like colour with a quickly disappearing white head. Nice straw aroma. This made a great refrsher after rugby practice. Great mouthfeel with good amount of carbonation nice hop bite on the end from the hops. A great thirst quencher.

The aroma reminded me of marijuana or maybe a skunk.  There was a lot of active, tiny carbonation.  The body was light-colored with a thin white head.  The flavor comes on good and strong.  The only drawback is a funky aftertaste.

this is pretty much the definition of a german pilsnener.  smells a little skunky, but quiet notes of hops and bread.  tastes just like a bohemian pilsener ought to:  simple malt profile with some european hops, and a clean crisp finish.  very unnoticeable alcohol.  very refreshing.

Draught at my own garage! Yeehaw! Pours yellow to golden color with a nice creamy white head. Floral hop aroma, with some bready malt. Flavor is nice malty with a good floral hop presence...
Very good pilsner, especially from tap... Im glad that i have 6 kegs of this in my garage!!!
In the green bottle. Tastes fine, but doesn’t really blow you away. Kind of a typical pilsener. I dunno, I bet this tastes way better on tap in the Czech Republic.
pours a copperish colour with a white head. a good strong aroma of saaz hops. the taste had some metalic undertones as well as the hops, good dry finish easy to drink.

Had it out of a bottle so I canr realy rate the appearance. Decent lightly hopped aroma. Flavor is moderatly maly with a light floral presence. Nothing special, but quite nice for a pilsner, and well worth the 12 crown a bottle.

Dark golden color with lots of bubbles.  Large white, rocky head that lasts for several minutes.  Mild fruit aroma with malt and hops.  Flavors are sweet and bitter, with corn and sugar.  Heavy palate for a pils.  Everything a pilsner should be.

My first impression with pilsners is to brace myself for what will most likely be watered down beer with that unmistakable rotting barley flavor if anything at all, but this proved to be a fresh, crisp tasty pilsner. It’s as if all of the crappy beer commercials you see are advertizing this beer but selling their urinal water. Good body, medium palate, and just enjoyable.

I love pils and this is a good one. Still not great but pretty good for a commercial. Very reasonably priced for what you get. This beer is not overly strong on all the characteristics I personally like in a Czech Pils but it is very drinkable and a good knock off of the pilsen style. Light golden color, light floral hopping scent to the nose, starts crisp stays slightly tart yet malty and finishes dry with a little linering metalic after taste characteristic of Pilsen style hopping.

I like this beer and at this price a case or two will replace the domestic pils in my varanda fridge next cottage season.

Golden colour with a moderate head. Nose is yeasty and sweet. Flavour is soft and lightly herbal. Soooo much better than the beer that stole its name, copyright law should take the quality of the product into account.
Bottle.  Very nice malt aroma.  Nice golden color with moderate head.  Smooth malt flavor with a mild hops finish.  This is by far the smoothest Czech pils I’ve tasted but hops pretty subdued.

Bottle at Toronado, 05.22.04  I used this to cleanse my palate between some bigger beers.  This particualr bottle did not travel so well, methinks.  Poured thin and flatish, aromas were saazy, but also a touch sweet and papery.  Effervesence shines on palate.  Raw, pale graininess.  Very little bitterness on finish but pretty refreshing.  Hopefully, I’ll find a more fresh bottle in the future.

In the bottle. My bottle has a cool green skinny neck. I’ll keep it for homebrew. Pours big white head, but quite uncarbonated in the body. I get a hoppy, clover aroma. The hop character grows as you keep drinking. Better with the last sip than the first, and it’s pretty darn good  at the beginning.

Gorgeous beer,  Golden with a larg white head. lingered nicely with some lacing. Nice Saaz aroma of spices and wheat. Flavor included skunkiness that ruined all that goodness.  When are the Czechs going to learn about brown bottles?  Still a very good beer.  I probably got an old one.  I had Budvar on tap in Munich several year sago and it was very good as I remember.
Re-rate - no skunk in this one.  Very nice and spicy, even slight wintergreen in nose.
Very light, little flavour although on the malty side, not very hoppy, lingering hop flavour.

I cannot believe that this is the original, upon which that swill made in the US was based. This pilsner has so much flavour ... a true Czech treat ... the right amount of skunkiness, not heavy in alcohol, but heavy in flavour and body. The Czechs know how to do it!
I can tell this distinctive lager as soon as it touches my tongue.  This is the best all-around lager I have tasted out of a bottle, I would recommend with most foods.
A long sunny Sunday demands a refreshing pilsner - this has everything you need. Crisp hopppy aroma; beautiful golden body with slight white head; crispness again in its dry taste.

Re-rate for February 29th/08- Pours a sparkling deep gold with a frothy white cap. Floral hop aroma with excellent grassy/hay profile with lots of lemon and biscuit. Flavour profile is initially very hoppy (floral, rose petal) with just a touch of black licorice, lemon, grassy and a good biscuit/cookie sweetness. Zesty, sharp finish with excellent bitterness lingering. One of my standby beers. Original score 3.0.
Crisp, clean and tasty.  Sweet and bready (but light) malts, great saaz finish.

A pilsner with more color, body, and flavor than most others. Nice malt and hop balance. This is a great food beer when you don’t want the beer to distract. Also nice for drinking when you want a fairly standard throwback lager but still want a quality beer. Good, classic Bohemian pils, if you can get it fresh.
The Beer of Kings. Much better than our crap Bud. Similar to Pilsner Urquell, maybe not quite as good. Drank this for the first time while vacationing in Austria.

Beautiful head, they seem to know how to pour here in Czech Rep. Lovely aromatic, semi-sweet flavour. Can’t seem to trace much aftertaste. Nice mouthfeel. 3 3 7 3 16



Draught. Weak hoppy aroma. Clear golden colour. Stable white head. The flavour starts off quite malty. There is a good clean sweet hoppiness. The bitterness is not very high. Very drinkable. 6 3 7 3 17
Ah the REAL Budweiser, don’t know if that’s good or bad, but it’s definitely better than our version. Crisp, with a slight bitter hop twang and nice malt finish.

It took a 2 hour trip to find this "Real Budweiser" last weekend. In a green bottle, not brown and shipped all the way over here=skunked. A clear gold with a small white head, looks similar to the horrid "La Biere Du Demon" I just dumped. Yes it's is a bit skunked but the grassy hoppy scent still is discernable. Those same characteristics translate to the flavor as well with some pale malt flavors too. A very crisp dry finish. A nicely balanced beer but doesn't beat Pilsner Urquell in my book!
Easily one of the most drinkable beers imaginable.  Light and crisp and fresh.  I feel bad that we don't get to have it by its original name.  Clearly bests the king of beers.

Drinking this in a bottle here in Canada doesn't seem like the proper way to rate this one. It definitely is a good example of drinking something fresh...years ago I had a friend from Cologne rush me out to the pub to get a fresh pint of what he called Budweiser. I was even more of a neophyte than I am now and was skeptical about his excitement about having a Bud. Then I learned the story. Anyway, the beer was quite tasty and refreshing and sadly don't have notes to rate that verion. So for this version: A decent pilsener. Drinkable but nothing to go out of your way for - unless you're near somewhere that serves it fresh.

A decent pilsener - probably has such a good reputation because drinkers will always compare it to Budweiser, and there are very few beers that would look bad in that situation.  Smooth, decent body and some flavour.
I don't get all the hype about this beer either, basically just another average pilsener, golden color, nice fluffly white head, crisp & smooth, drinkable

Personally I don't know what all the fuss is about this beer.  I've drunk it in Ceske Budejovice quite a few times and it's nearly always sweetish with little hop or interest for me.  Maybe it's just my personal taste, but I find it pretty boring.  (draught in Panda bar, Ceske Budejovice)
The orginal and good classic pilsner from the Czech Republic. It has a mild and smooth taste, and so is the aftertaste.
clear, bright yellow, a clasic pilsener,holds its head, pleasant,smooth,lingering taste.
A great pilsener, you can literally taste the history of this beer.  Very nice, much more than I expected.
Pours a nice gold color with a big white fluffy head and nice lacing. Aroma  and flavor are very similar to each other.  Nice crisp hop notes.  Good medium body.  Pretty good stuff.

Golden colour with large white head that fades to a very thin ring of lacing around the edge of the glass.  Crisp aroma with floral notes, light malt and Saaz hops.  Light caramel flavour, with a long floral hop finish.  Very refreshing.  A shame that Bud doesn't taste like its namesake.
I really enjoy this Pilsener.  Straightforward tasting with decent carbonation.  Taste is pleasant, yeasty, strong hops.  Hints of fresh baked bread.  Very close to a Pilsener Urquell.

Pours a deep gold, minimal off white head. Has a "soda pop" crackling carbonation. Slight chemical/medicinal bitterness going along with the hops. Herbacious and grassy. Note of caramel and some spice round it out. It really didn't do it for me.
Nice lager, with nice malted taste, which prolongs very well with the light hopps in the flavour. Well balanced, but a little bit to sweet for my personal taste

First and foremost, if I was comparing this to just the US version of Bud, it'd get 5's across the board.

Pours a light golden color with a decent head, no lacing, but lots of carbonation.

Smells nice and malty.

Tastes malty, yeasty, and has just a touch of hops. Quite good.

Mouthfeel is very full and creamy. Drinkability is very nice as well. What a great lager; I'll definately be going for this one again.

Cyrstal clear and pale as anything you can think of.  Little head and lots of bubble action.  Aroma is not strong at all. Inital taste is crisp and ends with a smooth aftertaste.  The malty taste is the dominate taste.  A solid average tasting beer, but nothing special.
One of the finest examples of this style.  Great summer session beer, a true quencher.  Good with food.  Not my favorite style by a long shot.  Well balanced, with a nice noble crisp hop finish.
This Czech pilsner pours a bright yellowish amber with a small white head.  The aroma is somewhat spicy and hoppy, with a bubbly grain taste.  Worth having again!
Light amber orange, white head. Aroma is of floral Saaz hops. Bready flavour with some yeastyness behind the light oily hops. Light, balanced. Not a bad beer. Bottle.

Bottle
Not much aroma. Head is white and average. Light amber color. Starts tasteless, ends with small hoppy flavour. Dissapointing Czech beer. (3/3/5/2/9 2.2)

Re-rate, bottled (BB 03/2005)

Golden lager color, small white head. Sweet malty, almost corn-like aroma. Thin, hoppy finish. (3/2/5/2/8 2.0)
A deep amber look with a white foamy head. The flavor wasn't strong, had no overtones or potent aftertaste. Infact it had no flavor at all. Help, I can't taste my beer!
If you wan to take more tahn 1-2 beers I recomend this chez friend, hasn't a sotng taste but at the other hand its taste is so deep.
Light, horribly skunky aroma.  Slight woody flavor.  overall unexciting.....
Lovely white head, looks like a pilsner should. Nice medium hop taste and light fruit notes. Far and away ahead of its namesake.

Bottle, from the Hoghead, Birmingham. Tasty, yeasty aroma. Classic Czech Gold, with a medium, loose-ish white head. The full yeasty flavour immediatly hits you, with sweet moments and bitterness moving in and out of the arena. Well balanced pilsener - miles ahead of most UK lager fare.
Golden color with a med white head. Aroma of malt and bread. Clean malt flavor with just a little hop bitterness.

Yet another from a gift six pack assortment.  Amber body with white head.  Looked typical pilsner.  Aroma and flavor were characteristic of a classic pilsner.  tasted like a good, standard beer.  Nothing special.

apparently, i got a mildly skunked batch cuz i was not overly impressed by this beer.  granted, it is better than it's american namesake but that's not saying much.  i much prefer the urquell but this wasn't bad.  it just had some weird funky taste that i have yet to discern.

Mild peppery herbal hop aroma with some sweetness and bit of grain. Clear golden colour with white bubbly head that dissipates fairly quickly to a fine film. Suggestion of citrus in the start of the taste gets enveloped by a mild toastiness and a slight sweetness with a gentle but lasting bitterness in the finish. Carbonation is medium-light and mouthfeel is refreshingly light. Pairs well with savoury foods or heavy dark meats. Bottle.

Nice golden color,small foamy head that hung around for a decent amount of time and left a small lace behind as well.Malty sweet aroma with a nice hop presence and mild fruit coming through as well.Nice smooth feel,malty and sweet with a nice lemony taste and mild hops.If this is what bud is supposed to taste like,then it's a shame that U.S. companies have screwed up the recipe so badly with there rendition of this brew.I'd have to say that if i had better access to this brew i think it would be a regular in my fridge.

12 oz bottle, shaker glass.  Average, creamy, tight, white head is slowly diminishing and sits on a slightly hazy, deep copper body.  Toasted light bread, grain malt (M); grassy, herb hops (M); hit of red and green apples.  Subtle, pleasant and no green bottle skunk.  Moderately sweet, lightly bitter flavor becomes a lightly sweet, moderately bitter finish.  Incredibly clean.  Medium body, creamy texture, lively carbonation.  The bottom line is: quality.

Nice Czech pilsner...the way it's supposed to be done for any of those Anheuser-Busch execs reading this. A tawny golden color, reminiscent of an all malt brew. Looks a lot like a helles in color. Frothy head. Rich malty body with a fair dose of hops bitterness give this beer a distinct body that keeps you coming back for more. Nicely done.
A nice pilsener, however no where near as good as the Urquell. Bitter taste with tinny finish.

The classic Czech pils
with a lovely golden colour and a dry malty finnish.The only thing that in my opinion stops it from being a world class beer is the rather unimpressive aftertaste that seemed to linger for hours.
A dark and hoppy pilsner.  Silky smooth body and nice flavor. Very light head and slightly cloudy.  Tell the Anhueser-Busch folks that THIS is a  far superior Bud to their mega-swill!
A little darker body than the average pilsner. Small head. Quite hoppy and bitter flavor. Alright for a pilsner but not very exciting!

(Bottled) Paleish golden color with a smallish, mostly fading head. Toffee-buttery-malty, saaz-hoppy aroma with faint hints of alcohol. Slightly sweet, toffee-buttery-malty flavor with some fruitiness and a fair share of aromatic hops. Light to medium-bodied, a bit foamy-carbonated palate. A very balanced, enjoyable Czech pilsener for those moments when you don’t want the harshness of Urquell.

The classic bohemian pilsner. A good standby in pubs that have no real cask ale, particularly if it gives you the opportunity to snub the vile US stuff.  And I always keep a few bottles at home so that if any visitors ask for a lager I can give them a half-decent one that might just start them on the road to acquiring a more discriminating beer palate. Pleasant, easy-drinking stuff, but for bottled beers I would find 90% of bottle-conditioned UK ales preferable. Bottled, Slug & Lettuce (which I had to visit as it was the only place in the area showing an England soccer match - otherwise, this chain is one to be avoided), London SE1, October 2003
A superb pilsener. A lovely malty taste  and a decent aroma. Better on tap than in bottles (duh) but good on every occasion

A very nice Bohemian Pilsener. Less hoppy and a bit more malty than Pilsner Urquell, and a little bit easier to drink. Hops contribute some herbal and spicy qualities, and there is a "leafy green" flavor throughout, but the beer isn't at all that bitter.
Bottled.  Aroma reminded me of fresh crabs... in a good way.  Bitter spicy flavour with hints of cloves.  Overall, quite good but not my cup of tea.
This is the way I remember lagers tasting in Europe. Much fuller aroma,much fuller and more complex taste,I prefer this to Urquell.
Pours yellow with a small head. Lots of bubbles. Mild sweetness and hops. A pleasant, refreshing drink.

Bottle. Golden color with a quickly disapearing head. Aroma is slightly malty, but very light and refreshing. Very light body that finishes clean. Very well balanced. Flavor is light malts, and light hops - touch of spice. This beer is good, but it's very subtle - nothing stands out from the rest. Easy to drink a lot of this.
Pale golden color with a generous white head. Nose is lightly sweet and bready.  Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic with a slight bitterness. Finish is kinda dry and lightly hop spicy.

Pours a clear golden body. Nose is slightly skunked, but has a decent malt and light hop character underlying it. The taste is malted also with a grassy, crisp tongue. A little bit of skunked bitterness makes it's way in too, and detracts from the overall taste. Very soft mouthfeel. Clean finish with also no aftertaste. Pretty good pilsener.

Green Bottle--ugh.

Nose is subtle, slight hop aroma followed by very mild maltiness like creme soda.

White head with good retention and lace, small bubbles and good structure.  Color is a pale yellow like summer wheat or straw.

Tastes subtly like lemon or apple cider.  Mild malt apparent on first taste and smooth easy-going hop character.

Just about everything a traditional Pils should have, but it's almost like a "light" pils.  I've had better.  Still, I love Budvar on a hot summer day!
A fairly strong lager. Has lots of flavor and a light appearance. Has a decent sweet taste. About as good as a lager can get.

Pale yellow with a thin, quickly disappearing head.  Sweet corn nose.  Better than the BMC beers, but not a lot.  Cleaner palate and finish, but still almost a cloying corn sweetness.  Good with a sandwich.

Yellow, soapy foam head. Could be confused for Miller lite. Thats where the similarity ends. Crisp and smooth, some malts to begin. Ends on a nice dry hop note. The green bottle has gots to go, though. Points for freshness dating. Good for the style.

Ok have never tried the "other" Budweiser!
Comes in a nice tapered neck brown bottle..attaractive label and gold foil.
The appearance is good but pretty average for a lager..deep yellow beer..with attractive and fast carbonation strings//largush pure white head that goes down fast some lacing.
Smell however is above normal..some great hop aromas..and it smells fresh.
Taste is very nice not sweet really..some subdued malts than a nice crisp hop finish.
About average on the palate for a lager.
Pretty drinkable brew.
This is a nice Czech lager/pils..not the best I far prefered Starobrno and even Radegast.

I am scared before even opening the beer because of the green bottle. Looks like a pilsner. Smells like I suspected. Always just makes me feel sick simply from the smell. Tastes interesting. Almost floral. Not particularly good at all. This is OK but I need to try one that isn't skunked. It sucks. I'm sure this isn't getting a proper rating but the Czech Republic needs to find some other bottles, as does Germany, and Holland.

Ok, I give up, this is a mighty fine pilsner. This one from a green(!) 330ml bottle. Noticed after I bought it that the 500ml bottles are brown...
Despite the green bottle I got something pretty good. The colour is perfect, a beautiful, clear gold. Too bad the small initial head disappears despite the visible carbonation.

Surprisingly malty for a pilsner but I'd still say it has a fairly good balance. Some sharpness to the aftertaste which I enjoyed except for some hint of a taste I'm not sure how to describe.

Finally I understand why this stuff has been so higly rated. I will, uh... continue to taste this.

Rerate: And so I did. Got a brown 500ml and I think I'm going to be hooked. Best is, I will be able to guaranty myself relatively fresh bottles of this stuff. Still looks beatiful, but thats the most, and best, smell I've ever noticed of a pilsner. Wonderful fresh hop taste to the finish. Best pilsner I've had since got serious about good beer.

Pale golden with short-lasting head. Grassy, herbal hop aroma. Sweet malty flavour leading to a bitter finish. Lacking in hop flavours for my tastes. Firm bodied and not over-carbonated. One of the best pilseners.
Had this on draught in St. Charles, Illinois.  This was nasty, reaffirming once again why I can't stand European Pilsners.
Brown bottle. Typical bohemian Pilsener. Smooth in contrast to german Pilseners. A bit watery. But overall, very nice.

Watery and thin. True to the style, I guess. A good pils, but it's a pils nonetheless. One of my very least favorite styles. No apologies.
Good with spicy food!
Bottled, Filtered? Pale yellow with bubbly head. This is the real McCoy, sharp refreshing clean malt flavour with overlying hoppy flavours. The highest I've ever rated a Pilsner.
Bottled. Nice golden color with minimal head and lacing; the saaz hops dominate and provide a crisp refreshing flavor with very little malt. Definitely a classic pilsner; a great summer beer.
Light golden color. Good head. Some hops in aroma (saaz?). Malt seems a little watery and dominated by hops. Overall, I was a bit dissapointed. I have had better pilseners.
Pours a crystal clear gold, not too much head, but it leaves a nice lacing.  Typical pilsner nose, great Saaz hop flavor.  Nice pilsner.
Beautiful head. Very drinkable. If you take everything out of Anheiser-Busch Budweiser that isnt good and only left what was good this is what you would have.
Light yellow body with a huge white head.  Wonderful Saaz aroma and flavor, earthy and grassy.  Smooth palate.
Golden with a thick nedium head. Nice lacing.too. Fresh Saaz hops in aroma with hints of minerals. Fresh mineral flavour with hints of 'Baltic spring-breeze' and butter. a good Chech pils...

Had this as an opener at a local tasting and not bad for a green bottle.  This one is excused...does not have that usual skunkiness that most of its predecessors do.  A very nice golden pour, into a sparkling amber appearance.  Just very smooth and easy to drink and would be the perfect session beer.
This is what a pilsner is supposeed to taste like.  Some nice hops flavor with a malt back yet crisp and extremely drinkable.  Nothing better on a hot day.

green bottle, but of all evidence well protected contentup to Canada. Pours a clear golden body with a small white head that turns into a little white ring rapidly. Fine herbal hops aroma. Very good malt insistance, grassy, earthy, smooth and light bodied with a light and enjoyable hop bitterness finish. It's just extremely easy to drink and proposes an impressive balance.
Nice smoothness and balance.  One of the more flavorful pilseners I've had.  Refreshing, highly recommended.
Green 12oz bottle. Pours a nice golden color with lots of carbonation. Floral nose. Very smooth flavors with a nice finish. Very nice pils.

I have had a few of these in bottled form. the fisrts two kind of let me down, but the third must have been fresh! 
Totally balanced in my opinion. Straw in color higher carbonation and lace. Starts off slightly malty and this gives way to the Saaz hops(fisishes subtle hoppines)
Great beer if you can be assured of freshness.
Cheers
Light golden, few head, no lace. Flowery nose. Light, smooth and bitter, finish is a bit more malty.

Clear straw - wonderfully fresh. . .balance of straw, hops and malt in the nose.  Nicely carbonated palate with a subtle bit of fruit, red apples, hops and hay.  A perfect accompaniment to lunch on a cancal in Prague. . .

July 2007. Bottle at LCBO Summerhill. Yellow body with a small white head. Mild floral hops in the aroma. Moderate bitter hops, light grassy notes. Average to thin palate. Decent example of the style, but frankly quite dull. 6/3/6/3/12 - 3.0
September 2003. Bottle. Gold liquid, good head dissipated to leave nice lacing. Nice hops aroma and well balanced bitterness.  A Very enjoyable lager, but did not measure up to the hype. 6/3/6/3/14 - 3.2
Nice carbonation and head.  Not much flavor to it, just a nice dry flowery finish.

Aroma is excellent. Flavor is smooth and slightly bitter with some mild fruit in the background. Creamy mouthfeel. Not as hoppy as Pilsner Urquell but very drinkable. Its about time I had the real Budweiser. Great beer.

I was so excited on my first trip to Prague.  The waiter asked for what I want to drink & I ask what they have.. "All we have is Budweiser" he says.  My heart sank, but quickly recovered when he meant the Czech variant.  
Overall I'm think it's a very good beer, but not a world record in my opinion.  Plenty smooth, aromatic, and flavorful, but the aftertaste is marginal.

2013-06-14, draught at Ølbaren, Copenhagen, 5-4-5-2-10=26
Deep blond color with nice compact head. In few words, it has a huge butter aroma that covers the malt; the malt flavor is tired, the bitterness is ordinary, the hop qualities are missing; and there is again some diacetyl.

2003-08-22, draught, 4-2-4-3-7=20
Blond color. Light hay aroma. Weak body, dry, quite bitter at the end. Not what I expected.
Poured a golden color with a quickly diminishing white head and no lacing.  Had the signature pilsener slightly hoppy aroma.  Slight combo of malty and hoppy tastes.  Clean dry finish.
A very nice pilsener. Gold color, white head, thin lacing. Pleasant flowery hop aroma. Well-balanced flavor, not too sweet or too bitter. Very drinkable, AB should take notes.

Draught in Prague. Clear sparkling golden color and beautiful long lasting head. Ideal "belgian lace". Lovely fruity and hoppy aroma. Sweetish malty flavors, with a touch of flowerness and long dry bitter finish. Great.

Golden hue with little head and no lacing. Aroma was light with the standard pils hints of Saaz hops and roasted malts. Floral grassy and horseblanket too. Taste was crisp and balanced, dry on the finish. Thin to medium-bodied with a watery and lively mouthfeel. This BUDVAR (F__k A-B) is still a world classic but I would rather have a Urquell or a German Lowenbrau.
i hear in the czech republic this is the beer to get...the real budweiser.  Always very smooth, good flavor.  always a great beer to feast on!!!

Rich golden color, long lasting medium head. I'm a fan of Pilsner Urquell and this seemed very similar but with less distinctive aroma and flavor, probably because the ex. date was looming. Well balanced with dry finish.

Another one left over from the Christmas gift pack.  It had a best by date of 2/03, so it was probably past it's prime.  That said; I opened it up, poured into the tasting glass, and found that it wasn't skunky, but had a malt and tangy hops smell.  The head poured well, and lasted a decent amount of time (1/2 way through the drink).  I received a good clean light malt taste that lingered, and then a hit of orangey hops.  I think this bottle survived.  It was a good thirst quencher, but nothing I would seek out.  I would go with a fresh US interpretation of the style first.  However, this probably deserves a re-rate from a definite fresh bottle in the future.
pours golden clear. minimal white head. bitter hoppy. decent lager, finishes dry

Draft, at the St. Petersburg, Russia airport lounge, May, 2004. Now this is what an "original pilsner" should taste like, not the poor, skunked bottle I rated last summer. Fresh from a well-maintained tap, it’s a fine-looking beer, gold color, with a good head. A golden malt flavor, too, but just mellow enough to let a wonderfully delicate floral hop character come through. The best beer I’d had after a week of standard Russian pale lagers.
And yet, I can see a bit of the flavor lineage to the American Budweiser... let’s just say the St. Louis product is severely de-volved from the prototype.

Original rating: Bottled. Oooh, looks like my first taste of this classic brew is from a skunked bottle. Still, it has a great spicy hop nose and a decent head. I almost got kind of an orangey hop taste. It’s simply more of a beer taste. I’ll hope to try this again soon and re-rate it.

Golden color, beautiful, medium-lasting, bubbly head. Great aroma for a pils, grassy and hoppy. It's an OK beer: you can taste the malt up front and appreciate the Zatec hops in the  finish, and it sure goes down well, but I still expected a bit more from this one.

Ah, the real Budweiser.  Of course, I'm in the US, so it's Czechvar.  Golden body with a head of large bubbles that disappears quickly. Nice pilsner aroma that fills the room upon opening the bottle.    Nice balanced taste, but no finish.  Better then the other Budweiser, but what isn't?
Bright gold with a firm, white head.  Nose is bready, a bit flowery.  Hoppy bite, well-carbonated and a bit soft in the palate.
For a lager, I really enjoyed this. Good bitter and slightly sour taste. Round malty mouthfeel. I would choose this over our "budweiser."

Clear pale yellow-golden in color with a decent white fluffy head that leaves a nice lacing in the glass, fresh grassy hop aromas, nice clean light bready and spicy flavors, light bodied with a crisp mouthfeel, finishes dry and crisp with plenty of carbonation, a decent example of the style.
blond with a quickly disappearing head. Flowery hoppy aroma and taste. Light bitter taste and finish. Ok, but nothing special.

Expected gold clear colour, with small short lasting head. Mild stale hops with hint of malt aroma. Light watery body. I simply can't see why this rates so highly, maybe the BMC crowd gets it confused with the other bud. Just an average pils in my book.
Decent nose for a pilsener. Malts and hops, quite fresh. Not really skunky. Clear golden coloured, not much head. Malty taste, some hops. Bitter, fresh palate. Okay.

Sorry,  I just dont get it.  this is a good pilsner but as a whole it ranks merely average in my book.  Hopp nose bitter finish with  a hint of sweet malt in taste.  Light bodied.  White big mostly lasting head.  Fizzy
Golden colour. Small white head. Sweet and herbal aroma. Taste is sweet/fruity and finishes herbal-bitter. Above medium body.

With an abundance of grass and sugar syrup on the nose, Chechvar offers hope that it will be a touch more palatable than its erstwhile namesake. Nothing doing. There’s an initial splash of refreshment when it hits the tongue, but it’s like jumping in the shallow end of the pool feet-first. The initial pleasing spike of bitterness quickly subsides, leaving a woody aftertaste. There’s "var" better beers from the Czech Republic than this.
i expected a crappy lager.  I was pleasently suprised.  Soft golden color , carbinated.   I liked it

Golden yellow/pale green tinges.  Has a clean and crisp hopped aroma.  Great saaz hops taste, with a medium body that provides a ton of pure lagered beer flavor.  Even hints towards some bittersweet tones.  Heavily carbonated and, true to the style, starts to taste a bit meaty and grainy as it warms.  However this, when you drink it cold, its about as good a lager as they come.
This is a world class Bohemian lager.  Excellent malt, great bitterness, Saaz on the nose.  Very much like Pilsner Urquell but nowhere as easily available.
A buddy was nice enough to bring a 16 ounce can back from Austria for me.   Interesting aroma, thin head, golden color, and smooth taste.
Very crisp and refreshing. Extremely enjoyable. Very aromatic.  Bright, clear crisp and sparkling.
Overall, this is a very impressive Pilser.  I used to think Urquell was the benchmark among this class, but I was pleasantly surprised to find this one.

I am not a fan of pilsner beers, but a pint of Budvar is a welcome break from the English town centre lagers.  Not amazing, but well worth seeking out either in the UK or in teh Czech republic - a touch dry but a bit of character and taste that is so lacking in UK lagers.
Golden pilsner color with a thick white foam on top. A nice flavor with a light bitterness. Excellent on tap.
Would be typcial for the style if not so well done. Full, flavorful, and more gently hopped than most Czech Pilsners. Damn good.

Beautiful pale color. Lively carbonated. Great balance between hops and malt. Hops not overstated which seems to be the trend of late. Like a very premium Heineken. The only thing I don't like about it is the price.

Bottle. Light golden color with small head. Hops and mild skunk aroma, yet still pleasant. Medium body, decent hops, sweeter than I expected, decent malts. Good for summer. Glad I picked up a six-pack. This is right up there with that other Budweiser (hah). Seriously a very good pilsener.
Nice overall lager. Medium body, slightly sweet, strong malty  aftertaste. Very quaffable. This buds for you.
Bottled. An excellent golden straw colour. One of the best pilseners available widely, something that is delicious on a summers afternoon. Nice Saaz hop aroma, and decent bitterness.

Bready hoppy nose, pretty golden lager color, decent white head that slowly faded.  Very good on the palate, smooth, no carbonation bite.  The flavor is surprisingly malty with a nice grassy hop bitterness to offset the hops.  Delightful.  Better on draught, but its been too long (3 years) to rate that tasting.
Finally a "Bud" I can drink! Excellent hop and malt nose, smooth, low carbonation. Excellent balance and finish.

Bitter, hoppy aroma.  Lazy carbonation.  Not much head to speak of.  Typical golden lager color.  Not bad, a little metallic in the aftertaste.  A little bit of malts here and some hops there.  Good for the summer.

(Note 6/20/03:  I tried this again on draft at a bar in Berlin - interestingly enough my scoring was almost exactly the same...) Light premium lager - I guess that it's just the style I'm not so fond of...  That said, this Czechvar had the beautiful classic lager golden color and a rapidly dissipating white head with no lacing to speak of.  Moderate aroma, malty with generous hops - orange and a bit of perfume.  Well done, but still typical lager flavor - definitely better than the other mass produced "Budweiser".  For me this would be best with a light lunch on a hot day, rather than featured for an evening tasting.  Drinkable, but give me my ales please!

This brew had a quick dissolving head with no lacing on the sides of my mug. The carbonation could be seen rising to the top. The body was gold. It had a fruity sweet aroma to me. There was an aftertaste with this brew.
Gold, with white head and some lacing. Quite malty, with some grassiness and bitterness from what are probably Saaz hops. Very satisfying.

This brew poured a medium head of fine white bubbles and a transparent light orange colored body with carbonation rising up the sides on the mug. It has a mild hop aroma with the flavor of a lager and its head left little lacing. The taste of this beer is not bad and not great. I could taste notes of chewy hops and some acidic bitterness in its finish.

Well its been a real longtime since I’ve had a Budweiser Budvar, and my notes are quite favorable, but that was before I became a “Beer Geek”, and truly developed my love for dark strong ales.

The archetypal limpid golden pilsner color, the head brilliant white, moderate in size and frothy in structure, the lace adequate, prototypical pilsner nose, all malt and lightly sweet, fresh and clean, start is malt and somewhat sweet, top is skeletal in its feel. Finish is potently acidic, the hops pleasant in their spicy bite, dry aftertaste, a fair to middling beer, good as its 100 degrees Fahrenheit today, and will remain so till mid October, so these “Clean and Crisp” beers do hit the “B” Spot.

Plae yellow color with a large rocky white head. The aroma is perfumey with some very subtle spiciness from the hops. The flavor was rather bland...watery...some hops, perfumey. Typical pilsner characteristics. I'm not really impressed.

How dare the 
Czechvar be in brackets to appease that mongrel beer empire? Should we have truth in advertising and call it Notweaklikethekingofpissvar? Anyway, it is a lovely soft Pils from a country that knows how to do it. Not as strident as 
Pilsner Urquell but nevertheless a great beer.
A decent pilsener but falls a hair short of being as good as Urquell. The normal pilsener flavors are here, light malts, spicy hops. Looks great though.
drank from bottle, could not distingish aroma.  I really enjoyed this beer its flower-sweet taste want down smooth and balanced well with a subtle hoppy finish.

Bottled. This is a nice enough beer and compared to the other Bud, it tastes down right amazing but I do think we need to get a handle on the ratings. Its good but its not great. Its got more flavour and a strong bitter finish then most, but lacks finesses and some depth.

I was so hoping to like this more after waiting so long to try it. (I did actually try it years ago, but the little bit didn't count) This is a fine beer, that much I can say, but I guess I was waiting to be bowled over. What happens to me when something is built up like this. Actually can't see anyone being disappointed as it is crisp, delicious and all. Just waiting for the elusive je ne sais quoi.
The original Budweiser is great.  Very drinkeable pilsner with a great combination of hops and bitterness.  I've had the original in Prague and it is outstanding.
Bit of a disappointing pils.  Has a fairly strong aroma of hops, but the flavor does not back up the promise of the aroma.  Tastes a bit thin.  Not the best of the style.

Czechvar, I had a hard time finding this on this site. Czechvar is a light lager with a thick thick head and golden yellow colour. The bouquet is pronounced with a hoppy aroma. It reminded me of Pilsner Urquell. This beer must have just made it into Florida because I just found it. I would buy it and drink it again.

A light hoppy aroma. A frothy head, but it disappeared almost immediately.
Too much carbonation with a light body.
Maybe the bartender had a bad day...

Interesting that the American Budweiser has had approximately 3.4 times the number of ratings as the Czech version, because the the Czech version is about that many times better than the American version. Strong lager aroma. Clear sparkling gold in appearance. Smallish, white, foamy head. Flavor is crisp and doughy with mild hoppiness which makes this beer. The finish is a little off, but the beer's name automatically invites comparisons to Bud and it will always stack up favorably. Quite good.
Another clasic style pilsner. This version is by far superior on taste and quality than the comerical version.  Has a nice clean flavor to it and is very enjoyable to drink.
Not the best Czech beer, but that is not a complaint.  This is famous by comparison to its infamous cousin.  Clean flavour with plenty of malt and hop subtleties.
Draught.  Clear golden color, creamy head. Nice malty aroma.Fruity and fresh. Long duration. Maybe a little too much carbonation. Indeed drinkable!

Agreeable earthy, spicy hops, draping lightly toasted pils malts... More effervescent than the average BohPils, this needs to be tasted super fresh, or else it gets boring really quickly... On tap at various places in the Czech Republic, it is quite good, but a fresh can can do the job efficiently...
Great beer that is as good as many German Pilsners. While not my favorite style it is crisp and refreshing.  The other Bud is so inferior, this is the one to drink.
Pours a beautiful clear, bright golden colour with a strong white head. Bready malt and fruity hops in the aroma. Flavour is crisp and refreshing with a perfect balance of malt and hops.

Very smooth and fresh, beautiful golden colour with good head that lasts long compared to a lager. This is a nice malty lager that tastes a little sweeter than other lagers i have tasted. My first choice on a lager. Excellent beer.

Smells like the American rip-off but doesn't carry as much rice aromas as Bud. Not skunky like other Czech exports. Malty, slight hops, crisp and refreshing. If you can find it, give it a try when you just want to kick back with a mellow brew.
This one is a treat beer. The real Budweiser. The yanks stole the name and recipe, then watered it down. Czechs make good tennis players and good beer. A crisp golden brew in a classy bottle.
a very nice lager! The best mainstream lager/pils that is.. I never run out of this stuff!! 2nd best Pils I´ve ever tasted. If this wasnt so accesible, we would all be crying our pants of for this!!

For the price, this stuff really sucked.
No reson to dissect it systematically, it just tasted cheap but cost what premium beers do. 
Stupid foil around the neck was annoyoing too.
Close to Urquell. Yellow color, little head. Spec. hops in both aroma and flavor. Fine hoppy finish.
This beer was a big let down for me. It tastes like a cheap Pabst product. Sour after taste that reminds me of american corn and rice beers.

A nice dark gold and thick white head start this one.  In my opinion, THIS is how a pilsener SHOULD look.  The aroma is fairly typical of the style, though a little heavier than normal and also quite nice.  Flavor is also very nice.  I'd put this one off for quite some time, not knowing if I'd like it, but I have to say that this is a top notch pilsener!  I prefer this by leaps and bounds over the comparably rated Pilsner Urquell.  All bow before the TRUE king of beers!
A very nice pilsener, perhaps a bit sweeter than its "equals" Urquell and Staropramen. The ONLY Budweiser!
A great beer.  Nice golden colour with nice size head.  Bready nose with a touch of hops. Nice malty taste with a light sweetness. Very easy drinking.

Initial aroma once poured was slightly musty, like a Becks, but that quickly disappeared and it bacame quite fresh in aroma.  Appearance is golden in color with a nice long lasting head.  Very smooth and fresh in taste, a classic lager.  I can tste why AB would try to stop the name of this import from its original name.
malty honey aroma, light honey then hops galore,  if america drank more of this we'd be in good hands
A good, classic Pilsener.  Very drinkable, and pleasant.  Nice golden color,
Bottled. Golden coloured, average head. Bready nose with a light touch of oily hops. Light bodied and extremely drinkable, yet firm. Balanced bitterness.
Take this Anheuser-Busch. Thats how you brew a decent Lager-style beer. Golden in color pours in with a nice white head. Malty in aroma with a nice dry finish! Go for it!

Blind side by side tasting (of Czechvar) with PU showed nearly identical color, head and carbonation. The Budvar had a less desirable aroma, slightly musty.  The real difference is that budvar had a consistent flavor and mouthfeel from start to finish. Clean, crisp, well balanced. Almost too much so as both of us chose PU as the favorite due to it's more distinctive malt sweetness and dry, hoppy finish. The Budvar was still very nice and deserving of it's reputation as a classic Czech pils.

A very good Czech pilsener. Not the best one, but it is very easy to find in stores. Golden colour with a good head. Malty sweetness in the taste with a light hoppy aftertaste. Really drinkable and pleasant.
Excellent pilsener. Much better than the /other/ Budweiser!.................
Good basic pilsner. Better than the stuff from St. Louis....................
An excellent czech beer, this is what lager should taste like...............
A run of the mill pils. Certainly better than America's "King of Beers"
I really don't have anything to add. I drank this in the bottle while I was already pretty drunk, so I don't remember the details, just the numbers.
typical lager. same weak body, tinny aroma and flavor. could have been st pauli girl or becks in a different bottle.

Good dark yellow colour.  Decent starting head.  Medium bubbles.  Leaves a fair lacing.  Typical pilsener (Sasz?) smell.  Overall not as sharp as Urquell nor as enjoyable as Topvar.  A certain earthiness in the flavour and a better than average Pilsener palate.
Not too bad if you like Pilsners. Fairly clean and crisp, goes down smooth with a refreshing aftertaste.

Jan 03:  Certainly a decent, clean, well-crafted brew, but I don’t get the cult following other than to be able to say you’ve had the "real" Budweiser.  Very typical, slightly above average Pils to my tastes, fairly malty at the front, dry and bitter at the end, grassy... nothing really stands out. 6/4/7/3/13 3.3

Aug 05:  330 ml bottle, BBD 0905...hey I got a fresh one!  Big billowy fast-dissipating head at very clear gold body....beautiful fresh warm-bread aroma, light saaz hops, hints of thyme and aloe....body fairly light, crisp, kinda low-impact flavorwise, with subtle metallic bitterness to finish and heavily malty body, hops a bit indistinct...still quite good, and I would certainly kill to have it really draught-fresh in central Europe.
I was SO releaved when I found out it wasn''t close to that amerikan beer... well done czechs.
Very good pils lager. The best continental European lager I have come across. Very crisp and clean taste.
Fairly OK.  It's hard to tell the pilsners apart sometimes.  Can you tell I'm an ale kinda guy?
Slightly malty smell, classic golden beer color, very crisp and easy to drink, not very complex in taste.

Wow - I stumbled upon the original Budweiser without even knowing it! Very crisp, clean flavor, barely there fresh aroma.  Clean, pour with a light head.  Nice golden appearance.  Flavor is a bit peppery and leave sa bit of a bitter aftertaste. Overall, an above average pilsener - not up to speed with Urquell - but still good.

Nice clear golden color with a medium sized white head that lingers for a while before dissipating into a thin layer on top of the beer. Light citrusy hop aroma with no skunkiness. Light hop flavor with a touch of malts. Finish is clean and crisp. Very refreshing and a little less flavorful than Pilsner Urquell, but still a nice Czech Pilsner.

Not sure you can say this is similar to Budweiser - that''d be an insult to an original Czech Pilsner.  Labeled as a lager on the bottle and classified as a pilsener, it''s one of the weaker pilseners I''ve had (next to something like Urquell).  However, this is a great beer and I like the style.  Skunky nose (as with any pilsener variety), golden pour with medium head; great hop balance and finish.
similar to Bud, very well balanced and smooth...............................

Not a huge pilsner fan, but I knew that this one was above average.  Poor Czechvar keeps getting pushed around by corporate Bud... my pity vote will rank this a bit higher also.  Keep up the good fight guys.
Small average head,smooth golden color. Soft cracker aroma-more wheatthin than saltine. Subtle hop, pretty simple but well balanced.
Bottled(500ml). -2nd best Czech's beer after Kozel..........................
Good hops nose for a pils, but flavor is mostly malt........................
Very enjoyable, but bound to get low ratings because it''s light-bodied and non-complex.  This tastes good and is refreshing.  I''d gladly drink it any time.

Warm, buttery, malty aroma. Crisp malt taste with reassuring bite of hops. Excellent for a lighter beer. Stop for a moment and dream that this is what American 'pilseners' taste like. Now come back to reality.
The name speaks for itself. And the taste is good. One of the best in the world
Crisp and very drinkable. I enjoyed this brew very much and will be making it a regular on my list ;->
Not a bad brew.  Wanted to do a little research into my family''s Czech roots.  How better than by drinking beer?  I''d drink it again.  Pretty decent stuff.
This really is a great lager beer. Light dusty nose, gold color, low tight head. Lemony flavors followed by a classy bitterness. Great balance and a clean palette.

Ha.  No comparison between Bud and Budvar.  If these two beers were on Celebrity Boxing, Budvar would pummel the everliving crap out of Bud, then smash the can on it''s forehead.  Then it''d fight Adolphus Busch, beat his ass, rampage through the Bud factory in St. Louis and beat ass all the way through.  Every last bottling machine would be a smouldering heap, the brewing tanks, nothing but charred smoking rubble, and as the piece de resistance, it''d set fire to the whole operation using those beechwood chips as a starter.  I think this is the best pilsener in the world.  A standard of what all pilseners should taste, smell, and look like.  Considering it''s such a delicate style, it may be the best beer in the world.

(500ml Bottle) It takes the Czechs to make an American icon better! I definitely enjoyed how this one went down.Pours a medium, white head with lively carbonation and a golden body. Slight hop nose. Delicious, full malt flavours with a hoppy finish. Above average.

Fine Saaz hop essence greets the nose...Color a rich gold with medium head and clingy ringed lace...Flavor dominated by the crisp hoppiness...Malt adds subtle sweetness but adds more to the body than to taste...Carbonation is suitably controlled, and the finish features the signature Saaz spiciness...Body is medium-light and acceptable, but not providing fullness found in some other pilseners...Still, this is very enjoyable and flavorful stuff...Now, if only all products bearing the Budweiser were of this quality...Oh, to dream...
yellow very grainy. enjoyable to drink......................................

yellow but topped with a solid lathering white top..aroma was of malt extract and raw cereal...real malty..cereal..grains..the best before date was 8/02..i drank it in almost 12/02..maybe it made a difference..if it did, it was probably for the better knowing my antilust for pilsners..very grainy..very buttery..malty..Tastes like a young extract brew..but its a hell of a lot better than american standards..so whatever.

As close to perfection as it gets. All other pilseners must be judged by this one. Clean, hoppy aroma combines with a deep golden hue. Spicy, hoppy taste with an unbelievably well rounded, smooth palate. The pieces come together perfectly on this one.
The czech equivalent of Budweiser is definitely much better than the U.S. version, for me it would be a summer brew.

had to help up this ones ratings, the only reason i can think that is scores low is so that everyone doesnt rush out and buy this one out.  it was only around here for october.  stellar pisner that resonates between 5 or more flavors.  what i mean by this is that, first the taste is sharp in your face - quickly disappears into undertones of another flavor - a bit later it goes back over the top with a new flavor --- back & forth for quite a while.  truly a complex brew!
Clear golden color, nice thick, white head.  Aroma is floral, grassy.  Flavor is sweet, with a little hop and spice.
An unmistakeable Czech Pilsener. Strong bitterness but not unpleasant. For Pils-Lovers a must.
Big orange-yellow pour with gigantic white airy head.  Very malty with a good body.  Ultra biscuity, but with a nice solid saazy bite.
Appearenc nice but it''s not really blonde. A mouthful of malty flavor, finish dry. Spicy malty aftertaste. Not as sweet as e.g. Gambrinus Premium.

Fine bronze gold with a medium rocky cream head. The aroma is honey and sweetish with some hopping as well/ The flavor is initially sweet and grainy and falls away fast. After some warming, malt plays a role too. Good for the style, but as my rating indicates--this isn't my style.
Bitter, yeasty, clean, simple.  Lots of sea monkeys.  I''d rate this higher if I liked pilseners.  I know that''s not very objective of me, but I''ll never buy this again.
Very nice lager.  Simple and clean.  Slightly sweet with a hint of hoppiness.  Very easy to drink, and a nice change.

Clean light gold colour. Load of carbonation w/ big fluffy white head. Fresh, floral, sweat hoppy nose w/ light spicyness. Medium, slightly oily body.  Smooth maltiness giving way to a rounded bitterness. Slight diacetyl apparent.
Had it on tap, it was pleasant. Clean taste, went well with the Czech food I was eating.

Bud huh?!Well the euro version i guess? Beautiful beer to look at.Crystal clear golden color. Nice soft white head. some lacing that along with the head is,nt there long.Nice malty aroma, some hops in the background.Spritsy on the tongue. Kinda thin in body.Slight bitterness leading to a not to memorable finish. Slightly skunky, but not overly.I,ve purchased this beer in a larger brown bottle and it seemed better.Is it me or that beer afficianado thing coming through about the brown versus green bottle thingy? Oh well beats the hell out of our bud, and it should at that price.
Medium gold.  Mostly dry with a little bit of sweet.  Grainy, straw character by my palate.  Decent body, OK aroma.  Green bottle in the US.
(Green bottle)Pale gold, quickly dissipating head.  Cereals and a bit of citrus fruits aroma.  Crisp with a slightly hoppy long finish.
Flowery hop aroma. Thin head. Nice hop bite. Enjoyable easy drinker. .......
golden with disappearing white head.  sweet, herby hop aroma.  nice chewy, biscuity malt backs up big hops.  a great lager.

i'm well overdue for a rerate on this one. fresh bottle useby about 9 months from now. smell is vague malt and saaz, taste is vague malt and saaz, which is joined by a characteristically budvar cooked apple flavour. sweet and low-intensity honey and flowers flavour at first, you think the bitterness is never going to come, then there's an extremely slowly growing saaz pepperiness in the back of the throat. 5 for palate because it's one of the easiest beers to drink in the universe - unbelievably soft and light texture. nice full gold colour and classic czech clumping head. just a bit too woosy in the end.
Nothing too exciting here.  Sweet with a touch of bitterness toward the end.  Crisp and fairly easy to drink.  I guess that''s the goal of style.  Just not something I like.

Smells slightly sour and bit citrus, with an ordinary head and a yellow-gold hue. It starts off with a pine filled mouth feel followed by a big lemon hop finish. Not bad, but I can't find too much interesting or unique here.

Pours with a medium thick white creamy head, with a fair amount of lace left behind.  the color is crisp and golden.  the aroma is sour and yeasty with malt accents.  the flavor is sour bitter and malty with accents of yeast and hops.

poors a crisp golden with a white non-lasting foamy head. aroma is slightly malty with some hops definitely there. flavor is quite hoppy, i'm assuming good Saaz right? this was a very easy to drink and quite enjoyable Pils.
Ok, I had too many of these....I forgot what I was going to write here......
Malty in both aroma & flavour, esp. for a pils and lots of it. Guess that's why I like it. Thickish as well. What a shame that other 'beer' hijacked its name. BTW thanks DOGBRICK
A golden beer with an OK head. It has an aroma of hops - and a flavor of hops, slightly bitter. Definately a good beer, but if I want a czech pilsener I rather want Urquell.
From a Candian bought bottle.  Very good Czeck pils, smooth, rich malt and pronounced hoppiness.  Everything a czek pils should be. (except for the fresheness which you can only get domestically).

Don't usually drink pilsners, but this I had to try.  Fragrant, malty aroma, light golden color. Lots of carbonation.  Can really taste the hops, some bitterness.  Very tasty, especially with some spicy Thai food!  Much better than that *other* Budweiser.

Bottled (29th July 2002). Good pills. Though i'm no fan of lagers. RE-RATE. Draught(keg). Far better than any draught lager you find in most UK pubs. Would certainly appeal to the average lager drinker - if only there was more advertising.

Not as good as a draft in Ceske Budejovice, but much better than most pilsners you'll find in the states! Nice malty aroma as you pour. The golden color is perfect with a creamy head. Buttery flavor can't be beat. Hops are sharp and the finish is clean and crisp. You can definitely drink multiples.

Medium gold color, medium head. Slightly malty and fairly hoppy. Clean and light, this Czech &#8216;Budweiser&#8217; has the lightness and crispness of &#8216;Bud&#8217;, but it has a lot more flavor.  More hops than malts. Nice crisp sharp hoppy flavor. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and crisp. Aftertaste is dry and slightly bitter. Nice tasty lager.

I prefer this to Pilly-U:  its condition is more reliable and the flavor better integrated and there are no plans to brew it in some godforsaken place like Poland.  Creamy head, integrated light malt and classy hops.  I think I can make out the flavor relationship to A-B's version.  I find this to be a perfect session beer, great when playing sports or grilling.

In my opinion the second best beer, right after the original Pilsner Urquell. Less bitter than PU with slightly sweet start. Those who don't recognized its qualities probably had bad luck with a spoiled bottle - to enjoy it fully you need to experince it on tap.

The first time I tried this, I loved it, and returned to the store a week later for another wonderful six-pack. Apparently those were very fresh, because I picked up another six from the same store a number of months later and it was skunky and much less flavorful. I’d imagine that the third six was from the same shipment as the first two, as they didn’t seem to be turning it over. RERATE 6/08: Some fresh stuff. Simply awesome.

Lightly sweet, bready/cereal malt aroma.  Bright, clear, yellow-gold color, with a rapidly diminishing head and only a little visible effervescence.  Flavor is pretty well balanced between the malt and the herbal, almost grassy hops, but the hops donate mostly flavor and little actual bitterness.  Finish is spicy, lively and very clean.  Light body, of course.  So this is the famous Budweiser Budvar, eh?  Hmm.  It's okay.
"Heey duuude, I'm drinking the REAL Budweiser..."  It certainly is better, though.
A very nice pilsener. Completely different from its rival Urquell, more malty instead of hopbitter, but just as authentic. Excellent pilsener.
Good beer, much better than the OTHER Budweiser with which this shares its name. Slightly bitter, but the taste is a unique one.
Very nice gold color with a decent head and nice finish.  It is kind of heavy for a lager, and has a very grainy taste and aroma.

Grainy, bread-like aroma, good balance of hops and malt... great pilsner. Nice, clean, refreshing beer that just knocks you over the head with its grainy aroma and flavor... if grainy is even a word that is. pilsner's are just unexciting to me...
Wonderful Czech hops in the nose, almost roasted straw malt flavor.  This is the best beer of this style I think I've ever had.  Finally a beer that lives up to every bit of hype I've ever heard!

( on tap in the Schweizerhaus in Wien ): perfect golden colour, malty and sweet, not too bitter, not as heavily carbonated as most pilseners, taste it at the Schweizerhaus beergarden with a "stelze" and you'll love it
Shame on A-B for taking the name to label as piss water.  My favorite pilsner (followed by Urquell and Staropramen).
Bottled: Golden colour. Medium lasting head. Sweetish and malty aroma. Flavour is sweet and malty as well, with some fruity accents. Nice bitterness in the end.

Can 500 ml

Appearance   Bright golen with hint of pale sun, large white firm for lager head. Some lace shown but not much. 3+ 

Aroma  Grassy soft malts with leafy hop of Saaz. Good.

Taste Mid light bodied, clean approach, minereal follow up. Good clean lager , not really a Boheman Pils more of Bohemian pale lager. Quiet decent.
It is hard to believe that this beer shares its name with American Budweiser.  Lives up tp the rest of the Czech pilsners.

I've been told that this is nothing special despite the reputation, and I guess thats true, but it was a bit better than I expected.  Rerate: Color was a bright gold with a moderate white fizzy head.  Despite a bit of a bite on the tongue, it wasn't heavily carbonated.  First sampling was skunky but the sixer I have now is not.  The aroma is tingly with spicy grassy hops, and a little buttery note (consistent with my previous tasting).   Nicely balanced beer with a medium bodied slightly buttery malt profile and a definite bitterness.  Fairly clean except for the diacetyl.  I'd buy it again.
Clear golden color.  Somewhat skunky aroma.  It's an average pilsner that's about it, not quite as good as Pilsner Urquell and not quite as bad as Heineken.
Bottle.  Pale golden yellow with a white laced head and some rising bubbles.  Classic skunk aroma with a yeasty flavor.

Tastes like no other pilsener. Every time I have drunken this, it has had this strange (not bad) flavour, which I cannot identify. An interesting pilsener, not as refreshing as many others, but funnier.
BUDVAR!!!!!!! If you're going to steal somone's product atleast make it of equal or greater value..you know who you are.
These ratings only apply to Czecvar in the brown bottle not the skunky green bottle.

The beer as I am enoying it now (under the Czechvar label), is not quite as good as I remember it from my years in Europe in the late 80's. Then I would drink it quite often under the Budvar label. I don't know if my Northern German Bier Store just got it fresher, or if the years have just made the taste seem better. I do know that Budvar was 1 of only a handful of imports in the store. Anyway back to the Czechvar... Great golden color, mildly bitter start, good dry finish, doesn't overload the palate. I like it and will buy again.
I don't like its taste at all. I won't waste my money in it again...........
Probably my favorite pilsener.  Sensational.  Though the bottle and label look ordinary, inside is a handcrafted beauty of a beer.  Strong saaz hops impart a terrific aroma.

Hoppy, citric aroma and taste. Hopbitter finish. Excellent pilsener, lives up to its reputation. Rating 8 4 8 5 16 = 4.1. Re-rate: slight hoppy, malty aroma. Soft hoppy, malty flavor. Orange. Almost milky and creamy, must be a bit infected with diacetyl. Rounded and balanced. 7 4 7 3 14. As far as these ratings go, the quality can differ. This is a weakness of this classic pilsener. This rating is an average, with a point deducted for inconsistency.
Actually this shows why the Czech are known to be damn good brewers. Very good aroma, and has a very good drinkability. Nothing like to US version which lacks all the good stuff in the original.
This definitely tastes better that it looks, but it is still fairly average.  Decent aroma, very slightly sweet, average bitterness.

Re-rate: very nice aroma, a blend betwwen hops and malt. Very nice saazy aroma. Sweetish start, balanced out by a bitter finish, kind of good, even though it is quite easy to drink, it maintains a good flavour and firm bitter flavour.

So Budweiser made a halfway decent beer. Well Adam Sandler occasionally makes a halfway decent movie too. That doesn't make it a good movie, just a good Adam Sandler movie. Anyway, no one could argue that this is far better than a Bud, but so what, so are 99% of the other beers on the market. Standing by itself. this beer is average. Slightly darker than a standard Pils with an off-white thin head. Vaguely bitter. Mild malt finish. Really nothing spectacular.
Dusty and hoppy aroma. Golden with a nice white head. Bitter and hoppy flavor, nice medium long aftertaste.

I was pleasantly surprised by this beer, because I figured anything with the "Bud" word had to be piss water. This bottle had a caramel color with a huge, fairly long-lasting, off-white-colored head. (That ain't no regular Bud!). Decent malt and hops, decent flavor. If I could get over the name, I'd probably drink another.

Slight malt taste and smooth finish. Better than the other ’Budweiser’ by a longshot, but still pretty bland overall. 
On tap at U Medviku in Prague: Smooth body of light malts with a floral note and presence of bavarian hops. Smooth finish.

Really nice hops aroma when you open the bottle.  Goes down hill from there.  Something sour about the malt in the finish that doesn't suit me.  As far as Czech beers goes,  this one ranks 3rd after Urquell and Staropramen  but it might rank 4th or 5th if I could sample more Czech beers in this category.
Tried it once more,  bought a 6 from a different shipment.  Less noticable hops but malt does not seem off this time.  Not sure what this says about their quality control or cargo handling in between.
This shit smelled just like the american bud...pure crap...the taste salvaged it though...sweet barley taste, very crisp.  Definitely a summer chugger.
Pretty solid.  Decent saaz hop aroma.  Malt is forward at the beginning then hop bitterness asserts itself., with a decent hop finish.  Quite solid czech pilsener and went quite well with food.

There was nothing in this that indicated the bottle wasn't fresh.  Too bad, it would have been a good excuse for being a crummy beer experience for me.  Unique-ish but not to say memorable flavor--couldn't place it exactly, there may be something in the "canned stewed tomatoes" suggestion.  Fortunately, after a while, my meal came and I was able to drown out the beer with Thai green curry.  Not a bad beer with spicy food.
The original and (I wish) only Budweiser!  Pretty good lager / pilsner.  ...

Rerate: still getting a touch of that stewed tomato thing, but not overwhelming. Mainly just too sweet and not enough hops.

Have you ever canned tomatoes? If you have, you should be familiar with the smell and flavor tomatoes have when cooked. This beer had an overwhelmingly strong odor and taste of spicy stewed tomatoes. It wasn’t really a bad flavor but it was too strong to drink and it’s just wrong. I know this is not normal for this beer from the other reviews of it I have read (and the style doesn’t allow for many strong flavors), but it was only days past the Best By date and had been stored in a refrigerator. It should have still been good. There was also some floating particles in the beer which I also assume is not normal, Pilsners typically being filtered. I will come back and rerate, but I’ve been told by some fellow raters that I should take this beer into account for my rating.

Because the pilsners are so perishable, and because I've not been to the source, the style remains slightly beyond reach to me.  But I love the subtle differences between the classic (available) styles.  Budvar emphasizes a gentle, full malt.  The hops are floral on the nose and peppery on the palate, but play a secondary role.  The finish is wonderfully crisp, accent on the malt.
Sweet scent. Golden, fluffy head. Malty, some good bitterness. Very pleasant tongue tingle, not too sweet. Pretty good.
A wonderful balance of hops and flavor. A beautiful well formed head, good lacing. A must try that lives up to its reputation. The only downside is that it causes headaches. Overall - thumbs up!
Interesting...but my bottle had a wierd metallic taste to it................
Light, clean, drinkable in hot weather. It's a pilsner and pilsners don't do it for me.
A good pilsener. Light and refreshing - easy to drink. Good balance between hops and malt.

On the bottle (thanks legion242), it's labelled as a Premium Czech lager, but tastes like a pils. Not as sweet as I remember the draught being. Light body. Crisp and refreshing. Could definitely drink a lot more often.
I think the batch I had was a bit skunky, but it is a fine regular beer.  I would rather spend the money on Shlitz or Pabst since they taste better and are cheaper...
It's okay but a little bit ordinary.........................................
A typical Czech pilsner, which is a good thing. Not quite as full flavored as others, but an excellent crisp beer.
No surprises here, just a plain, smooth and tasty pilsner.  Great price too, 99¢ for a 16.9 oz bottle cannot be beat!!
If only the American Bud tasted this good! Nice balance of hops and malts though not very complex.A good food beer or cold on a hot day.

Rerate: 500 ml bottle, airborne from Praha/Prague, 5.0% ABV. Golden colour, large head disappears instantly, no lacing, bubbly. Some Saaz aroma, but not nearly as good as Starobrno or Staropramen. Flavour is rather malty for a pilsener, reasonable bitterness. Drinkable, but not my favourite pils.
Original rating: I had this beer from a can in Norway, 4,5% ABV. The expiry date was 6 days ago, i.e. the production date was 1 year earlier, and the beer had not been stored cool at my retailer's. This must have impaired the quality, exactly how much I can't tell. Raters NDmullett and (to some extent) ecrvich had the same impression of the beer as I had, and they probably had a fresher can/bottle. Disappointment is the word, folks! Still, I'd like to sample this brew fresh on tap in the Czech Rep. before letting the axe fall. As it is, I have to say that Staropramen has a lot more going. (If anyone would be in doubt: Even outdated and more or less skunked, this 'Budweiser' has a lot more flavour than its American namesake.)
Is good with food, because it certainly isn't going to overpower anything. Like most pilsners it doesn't sseem to be very sturdy, so drink fresh.

Typical pilsner golden, limp white head.  Carbonation is particularly weak.  Light malty aroma, watery texture.  Sweet malt front, just a touch of bitterness.  Lacks the depth of character I hoped for, but nothing overly offensive either.  A pleasant drink, and of course, much better than its domestic counterpart.
Way better then its namesake, although nothing special.  There are way better pilseners out there.  Lacks depth of flavour.

Bottle, BB Jan 08. Head is initially small, frothy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is clear medium to dark yellow. Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted bread), lightly to moderately hoppy (herbs, flowers), lightly yeasty (dough), light note of metal shavings. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, slightly metallic. Lighter than many in its class and has an unfortunate (and consistent across samples) metallic tang. Slightly husky finish too.  It’s well-balanced, though, and the aroma is decent.  There are better examples of the style.
Nice pils.  Easy drinking, clean tasting, nice and refreshing... all the good things you would expect from this style.  Makes American Budweiser a joke.
The original Budweiser.  Not too bad, but for me the German styles are a lot better.  This is a more or less standard pils, and it’s not my preferred type of beer.
It's labeled CZECHVAR now, due to the inevitable lawsuit from Bud. An ok pils at best. So many better pils being brewed a few hundred miles west and many new ones over here that are even better!
The aroma was a little off with in the bottle that I had.  Took me a little bit to get used to the flavour.  Slightly bitter.
Tastes like many other eastern European pilsners, but that isn't a bad thing.  Tastes a lot better than the aroma would have you believe.
Clear, spicy and somewhat dry.  A good but not great pils in this packaging.  Losses something in the shipping as do most.  Perhaps its that I prefer a german pils.

Crystal clear light gold/yellow with a fat at first then thinnish white head. Good lacing. Moderately heavy carbonation. Spicy hop aroma, clean and fresh. Stingingly crisp and hoppy with spicy and peppery notes. Clean finish. Some specs floating around. Malt flavor emerges as it sits, and it lingers in the aftertaste along with the hop bitterness. Finishes softer and clean. A better than average but not stellar pils. Something I'd buy again but there are many I'd prefer instead of this.
Spritzy and refreshing but not as special in my opinion as many suggest.  An odd finish end the beer.
Frothy palate which is bad but has a nice bitter taste which is good........

Large white frothy head, aroma of a German pils, yet very smooth. Bitter middle, but an aftertaste I don't exactly find enjoyable. Crisp and drinkable, but I wouldn't go out of my way.  This beer was very much built up.

Can't help but say Budvar, after all that is what it's called. Comparisons are inevitable. Much better than Bud, no contest but as far as Czech pilsners go I think that Urquell and Staropramen are both better. Good spice and pepper in the nose and mild sweetness in the taste. Well pronounced crisp bitterness in the finish.
Light odor, sharp initial flavor quickly settles down into smooth pilsener.  Golden hue with a mild aftertaste.  I can see why it's so well appreciated.

A classic pilsner that became victim of the mass market - like so many of the other big czech beers.
If you get it really fresh it has some redeeming qualities, especially a nice citric hop nose, but the flavors don't really improve.
Pale straw in color; Head was firm but the beer looked eerily still underneath; Proper amount of skunk on the nose. Unremarkable beer but pleasent nonetheless. Quaffable.
Decent enough pils, albeit a touch overrated by some people. Nice and hoppy. Head doesn’t seem to last much.
Great pilsener style beer, one of the best on the continent. Good Stuff!....
Nice bright golden color. White thiny weak head. Herbal aroma with marked hoppy nose. Flavour is more balanced with malt and hay notes. Finish is crispy and dry but not too long. Light bodied.
Much better than its American namesake.  ...................................
transparent golden colour, few head, deep dry herbal aroma, tart, clean with a short herbal finish - good pilsner but average beer

Hey, give this beer a break. Budvar is such an AMAZING brew in Europe. Czechvar, though pastuerized, is by far one of the top lagers imported in the states. Plus... PLUS - they have been fighting the AB people and WINNING! Bravo!
I love this stuff.  It's especially good in Europe on tap...................
Finally we can taste what Budweisar (budvar) is supposed to be!  Not as good as Urquell but a great Pilsner.  Crisp hoppy aftertaste, a pleasure to drink.
World class beer. Well balanced between the malts and hops. No aftertaste, very crisp. Fails to be good all the time. When it's good, I'd give it a 4.5 rating.
Very nice pilsner. Beats the "king of beers" hands down. Nice balance of hops and body. Very smooth and drinkable.
It's been a while since I had this fresh, in Germany, but oh boy was it good.  This is a lot like pilsener Urquell, but sweeter/maltier.  I'm anxious to try it now that it will be here in the USA.
Not a bad lager.  I'm not that big on lagers though.  Its an assload better than its namesake.

I finally found a six pack and tried it.  It is another fine Czech pils, but just like Urquell it dose not seem to travel well.  I guess I will just have to go to the Czech Republic some day to get a real taste.
This beer did not live up to expectations.  However, as others here have said before it certainly beats the other Bud without contest.
Nice and smooth. Beats the "other" Bud hands down...........................

Ahhh the "Other Budweiser" This one tastes like Beer! Tastes stronger than it is, with alochol finish, but a crisp refreshing brew that is only worth the price (Here in the USA) to know that you are actually driinking something called "Bud" that is good. Moral booster, makes you see the world through rose colored glasses, now if it wasn't $8 a 6...
A decent Pilsener, but tastes a lot like too many beers to mention.  Crisp and well balanced with an extremely smooth finish.  But is it better than Genny.  Go USA.

Really quite great.  

Budweiser USA: PAY ATTENTION!!!....................
Very nice but the overall score I gave it is lower because of the hefty price tag in the Uk
OHHHHHH....so that is what Budweiser is supposed to taste like...sell the clydedales and fly to prague and learn how to make beer...damn it!
World class beer.  It lives up to the hype..................................
Great malt/hop balance, nice color and head, a perfect pilsner.Can't beat the draught served at (surprizingly few) pubs/taverns in Prague, Cz, however!
Disagree with the comparisons to Pilsner Urquell. Czechvar doesn't have any of the classic pilsener flavor or bite that Urquell has. This beer is good though and fun to drink the namesake of Bud.

So much better than it's American counterpart that it's an insult to mention the other around this solid traditional pilsner. I am not the biggest fan of this style but for those that are this is a great beer! Wondrful creamy head, crisp and smoth as all hell very little bitterness and no lingering after-taste. I let my mom, who's beer of choice is Blue light, try this and she said she's switching!

A fantastic original that dwarfs its American ugly stepchild. Smooth lager with a crisp and clean taste and (unlike so many German counterparts) clear aftertaste. Available in the U.S. as Czechvar.

Another user said "silky smooth" and that's right on the money. The smoothest lager I know and, to my mind, superior to Urquell.
Well-balanced bitterness. Goes down well....................................
A typical Czech lager. This is what Budweiser tries to be but fails miserably. Not a great one, but way better than the American caricature.
much like urquell.  not my favorite czech beer, but not bad either..........

Big body, almost silky smooth, hard to accomplish in a lager, I think. Quite malt sweet, would like a little more bite, kind of the opposite of the New Holland Green Hornet from earlier in the day. Very good lager, less pilseny to my taste. Compares favorably, but loses in my opinion, to the Dominion Lager.

A great pilsner, with all the good hoppy taste a pilsner should have. The aftertaste is almost as good as the beer going down. Classic

rerate: a little thinner than I remember, though still pleasant enough

Well, this beer has finally arrived in the Detroit area.  With all the name hype regarding this and AB's Budweiser, I was intrigued to try it.  I have to say this is an excellent pils.  I picked up the 1pt/.9oz. brown bottle, so it was fresh (I bet the six packs in green bottles aren't as good).  Darker in appearance than standard American offerings with a nice, slightly sweet malt taste.  The hops are there whereas they are barely discernable in most American versions of this style.  Good job "Bud".  I liked it and will buy it again.
This is what Bud should taste like.  A wonderful lager with a great blend of malt and hops, quite a refreshing beer
Better than Urquell. Still hard to find in the US...........................
