golden straw colour, nice head but disepates quickly hoppy nose hit when opened the bottle. Better than US cousin

Bottled. Gold with shortlived white head and good condition. Good Bohemian hop notes in the nose with hints of thick sweet malt. Moderate fullness in the mouth with malt and hop both playing their part. Delicate hop bitter finish that makes you want to drink more.

Light, clean, and yeasty.  Some light strawberry notes in the flavor profile, but nothing much else going on here.  Yeast absolutely dominates the nose.  Light amber color and minimal head didn't impress.  Pretty much what you would expect from a pilsner.  Nothing special, but it's worth a try because of its near legendary status.
better than the American namesake but not as good as Kozel or Pilsner Urquel.
As far as I'm concerned, the best beer in the world.  And you can now get it in the rest of the world!
This is a decent lager... a light beer much easier going down than budweiser.  Easy on the palate, and almost no aftertaste.
Sure it's quality, but it is a pilsener.  Need I say more?..................

What's this for an average rating!?!? 3.8?! It's only a pilsener. It is ofcourse better than american bud, but a pilsener is nothing special. The alfa pilsener for example is much better, as also the Hertog Jan pilsener.
Third best lager in the world!  The original from the town of Budweis!  And for Hoss...TRADING UNDER ITS REAL NAME!!!!!  Not like that Fraudulant yank rubbish!

Nice gold colour.  Flowery hop notes in the nose and flavour.  Kind of sharp, which is nice in a hoppy beer like this.  Not a great mouthfeel though.  I think I expected something that would fill my tastebuds with joyful song, but this didn't quite do it.  The aftertaste last and last and lasts.....

Worlds beyond the american budweiser.. this one has actually the soft, flowery aroma of Saaz hops and a gentle maltiness. Color is deep golden, not piss yellow as AB Budweiser.  Not as big and flavorful as Pilsner Urquell, but still a brew of tremendous quality.
it's almost the same exact thing as regular Budweiser.......................
Too bad it is not available under it's own name. A very good mainstream lager
Saaz and a bunch of it, clear but not as crisp  or complex as i would like. It puts Bud(A-B) to shame, but did little else from there.

Clear, medium to dark straw color.  Malt and saaz nose. Thin collar. Not a cpmplex beer by any means, but  oh so soft, malty, right amount of hops, there is something special in this lager. Smoooth, refreshing and periously drinkable. and im sure would be better if i had it as fresh as some of you guys have had it.

A very nice pilsner. real budweiser here!
 flowery saaz hops dominate.
a nice crisp beer.
Very nice lager.  Best in the world?-I'm not sure.  Did I like it?- Yes.  Will I drink it again?-Yes.  Well, I guess it was pretty good.

Re-rate:  Clean crisp malt aroma.  Standard pils appearance.  Good solid malty taste, medium bodied with a dry bitter hoppy after taste.  A truely class pils a world away from that other nasty beer with the same name, not as good as Urqell though.


The orginal and best Budweiser.   Why do the American insist on calling their piss water by the same name?

Thans to Anhauser-Busch Corporation, Budvar had to change its original marketing name to Czechvar. It is the greatest beer that ever came from the Heart of Europe - Czech Republic. GO BUDVAR!!!!! If you won't like this, you won't like anything.

i still love this for being a great contrast to most other czech pilses. only moderate bitterness but a butteriness of texture that makes it disappear in 3 gulps every half litre. possibly the most skullable beer in the world, on tap, of course
The original Budweiser. Pleasantly bitter but not as well balanced as other Czech beers.
A sweet pilsener. But the finish is to bitter for me. Smells great however.
GET THIS BEER!  This is one of my two top pils in the world.  Your taste buds will be in heaven-simple as that.
Almost as good as Pilsner Urquell, a very typical czech pilsner. I love it, too bad it is pretty expensive in Denmark
A bit overrated. There are better Czechs....................................
For a lager or pilsner, there is no better, best I ever had.................

Marketed in the U.S as "Chechvar," this is the REAL Budweiser.  A fantastically smooth, soft lager that is finally being tasted by those Americans who haven't been to Europe, where it is ubiquitous.  This is beer stripped down to its bare essentials. No frills, no wing-dings, just the quintessential soul of beer.
Light and bubbly, mild taste, with a yeasty taste and aroma.................

Huge bubbles accompany this gold pilsner.  Yeast and hops in the nose, although the yeast is less prevalent in the taste, which is primarily hops.  Light bitter finish to this good, but ordinary beer.
This is what Budweiser is SUPPOSED to be.  They ripped it off, and watered it down, you drink it.. Try the real McCoy!
thin, flat head, spicy hop aroma, thin flavor, nothing special..............

Oh God... Hmmm... Where do I start? For me pilseners are the compact class of beers with luxury and sports car varieties being far more interesting and exciting.  Clean, a bit of sweetness in the malt, some partially oxidized hops. Not all bad, but hey this emperor is wearing no clothes, man. If Miller laid claim to the name "Schafer", the original beer would still taste like Schafer, right?

Quite a romantic story befalls this brew. Not only am I rooting for the "underdog," but I'm rooting for the deserving "Budweiser." In my opinion, "Czechvar" has lived up to the hype. Friendly Aroma... Smooth and Tantalizing Mouthfeel... Rich and Interesting Malt flavors... Pleasantly Dry and Bitter. Very well-made, well-rounded, and just an overall Fine Lager. I hope they make it available throughout the States.
An all round good pils.  Too bad it's not sold in place of the american budweiser.
